text:
Aventinus, the Wheat Doppelbock of Bavaria, has always been known to be the most intense and complex wheat beer in the world. This was the case for the past sixty years, but not anymore... Up until the 1940’s, Aventinus was shipped all over Bavaria in containers lacking temperature control. Consequently, the precious drink partially froze during transportation. Unaware that the brew was concentrated by the separation of water from the liquid. People were baffled by this unique version of Aventinus. By chance, the first Aventinus Eisbock was created. Well aware of this story, Hans Peter Drexler, brewmaster of the Schneider brewery, decided to recreate this classic "mistake" in a modern controlled facility. Thus, the Aventinus Eisbock is reborn sixty years later ... Prost!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fles gekocht in Edam-Volendam. Het is een donkerbruin bier met een kleine schuimkraag. Het is een kruidig bier, geeft een warm prikkelend gevoel, smaak blijft lang hangen in de mond.

Restrained aroma in deep dark brown pour. Surprisingly light body (for strength) with complex, yet subtle, blend of spicy banana bread with a puree of preserved fruit on the side. Deliciously different - and dangerously so.
Intense weizen aromas with dark notes. Sweet and dense, bananas, rum, raisins, dark malts.

Ar: Deep maltiness, chocolate undertones; banana, bread pudding, and rum; booze-soaked peach skins and raisins. Ap: Brown-amber and hazy; medium-small light tan head with moderate retention, leaves a cap of foam, made up of medium-small bubbles. T: Rum and raisins; doughy and rich, dark caramel and roasted pudding; medium-high sweetness, fully and luscious but not cloying; booze flavor, but extremely clean and pleasant, with just a hint of rose; bitterness is low, no hop flavor; caramelized peaches and black pepper. P: Full body with high carbonation; finish is medium-sweet. O: Wow; this beer is mind-blowing; great depth of fruit flavor, perfect balance of alcohol heat, sweetness, and fruitiness; rich beyond belief, yet so drinkable.

Red brown robe with thin white head.
Nose on malt, herbs and licorice.
Bubbly attack that pops a bit on the palate.
Medium/heavy body, quite sweet on caramel notes.
Finish is sweet, liquorous, on caramel and herbs.
Alcohol comes back after the finish.
Has a certain complexity regarding aromas, not easy to distinguish.
Quite interesting even if not too much my stuff.

(330ml bottle) Aroma: Strong for sure, some fenols (kinda like in belgian beers), sweeteness, caramel, no alcohol. Complexed. 
Appearance: Nice, quite big head, dark and unclear liquid.
Taste: Sweet and slightly sour. In flavour is very complexed, there is wheat, caramel, fenols too, slightly malty and breadish.
Palate: Medium to full body, oval and creamy texture, fizzy carbonation (definitelyy too much carbonated).
Overall: Great beer, for sure, aroma wasnt that astonishing, but in mouth the beer is simply amazing (carbonation is bad though) - complexed, full of flavours, no alcohol at all - simply amazing. Maybe I would prefer some more bocks typical flavours, but still - amazing. 
Flip ABInBev.
One of the best beers I had ever tasted. A bit of alcohol in the taste, but the final impression is perfect.

Pours opaque brown, with a light brown head. Aroma of dark fruit, dates, cherries, deep honeyed caramel, plums, raisins, black cherry. Taste is pungent, notable hops, cola, currants, dark fruit. Alcohol only moderately noticeable. Medium to full mouthfeel, creamy.

If you have the opportunity... drink it!!!
Intense and strong flavor. A very special beer from Bayer.

Aroma, starts out with ripe figs, plums, raisens , peaches turns to grape bubble gum as it warms. No alcohol. Amazing aroma
. Appearance Dark brown with a creamy white head. Small head little lacing. 
Taste, dark fruits, grape wine.. Malty goodness.
Palate, smoother than a bsbys butt, no alcohol, dangerous sipper.
Overall. Awesone beer. Few beers are this good. World class complexity

Ocena 01.02.2017, uzupelnienie profilu. Bardzo slodko, rodzynki, karmel, troche ciemnego pieczywa, zarowno w zapachu, jak i smaku. Szczerze mowiac, gdy wzialem pierwszego lyka, skrzywilem się od tej slodkosci, ale pozniej naprawdę przypadla mi do gustu. Piwo rozgrzewa przelyk, jest oleiste, geste. Barwa czarna, piana bezowa, srednioobfita, drobnopecherzykowa. Przyjemne piwo, adekwatne na chlodniejsze wieczory.

Mahagonifarben und blickdicht im Glas mit sehr schöner cremiger Schaumkrone. Intensiver Pflaumengeschmack im Antrunk, hefig bananiger Körper mit einem Hauch von Marzipan und gebrannten Mandeln. Eine harmonische Bittere (Herkules) und Nelke im Abgang finalisieren dieses Geschmackserlebnis. Die 12% Alkohol sind spürbar, aber werden gekonnt versteckt.

Originally rated on 1/27/09. My first eisbock turned out really well. It poured a deep rootbeer brown body with lots of carbonation that gave it a big thick creamy head. Aroma of dark fruits like figs, plums, molasses, banana and hints of alcohol. Flavors was rich with the foremetioned fruits and a bit of spice, the alcohol was slightly noticeble but for 12% it was pretty smooth. Overall it was a good beer that drink again and would recommend.

From bottle in shaker. Pours rusty red-brown with nice tan head and sweet aroma of malt and spice (clove?). Rich taste Id liken to plum pudding with noticable EtOH in the finish. A nice after-dinner beer.

330 ml bottle, served in 0,3 l Weizenbier glass. Dark brown, small head. Cognac, bourbon, black cherry, williams pear, dried fruits, raisin, toffee, brown sugar. Very complex aroma. Malty sweetness, slightly bitter. Alcoholic warmth. Oily texture, full body. Soft carbonated.

Aged 1 year in the cellar. Pours brown with a thick, frothy head. Aroma is typical Weizen, but a bit musty, cherry undertones. Noticeable up front is a mildly tart red berry taste set over a sweet malty caramel base. Hints of chocolate and toffee. Finishes with more of the same, but with increasing warmth. Not among the most complex bocks Ive drunk, but it has a smooth, big-bodied rich consistency that makes it a pleasure to drink. Good stuff.

Little cloudy brown (light coffee) color with small thick white head. Aroma is plum, light coffee. Taste is some bread, plums, some nice sweetness. SLightly oily texture. Light sour and longlasting warm aftertaste. Relaxing and enjoyable beer.

Aromat: Słodki i intensywny zapach dojrzałych bananów z domieszką goździka, spodu od ciasta i rodzynek. W tle pałęta się też trochę gumy balonowej.
Wygląd: Ciemnobrązowe, z bujną pianą po byku, która szybko redukuje się do niewielkiej obrączki.
Smak: Całość jest słodka, wyklejająca, likierowata i lekko alkoholowa. Ponownie na pierwszym planie czuć dojrzałe banany. W tle mieszają się goździkowe, rodzynkowe i chlebowe posmaki. Wysycenie dość wysokie i razem z alkoholem lekko drapie w przełyku.
Ogólnie: Dobre degustacyjne piwo, znaczniej bardziej smakowało mi niż np. eisbock z Pinty (pewnie dlatego, że to jest koźlak pszeniczny, a nie zwykły).

Amber kleurig bier met een witte schuimkraag.

Aroma: jam, kruidnagel, wat gist.

Smaak: fruitig, zoet, karamel, kruidnagel, rook en wat alcohol.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Stewed fruit/berry aroma, with yeast and cloves. An opaque dark brown. Thin but creamy off-white head. Sweet at first. Then sourness develops and some bitterness. Matches the aroma, stewed fruit, berries. Heavy. Oily. A fizz of carbonation. Long, warming, finish. A great winter beer (ignoring that its spring now). Enjoyable and subtle.
Sinceramente, mi aspettavo un attimino meglio, invece è la classicissima superbock teutonica, molto calorosa e burrosa, ma nasconde ottimamente il grado alcolico.

Bardzo wysoka i ładna piana jak na zawartość alkoholu. W zapachu bardzo winne i czerwone owoce, zwłaszcza wiśnie. Alkohol intensywnie rozgrzewa przełyk, trochę zbyt intensywnie, ujawniają się akcenty pszeniczne, których nie wyczułem w zapachu
Du?o banana, gumy balonowej i estrów generalnie, alkohol kojarzy mi si? z jakim? s?odkim likierem. Po ogrzaniu lekki rozpuszczalnik. Ca?kiem dobre

Bottle 0.33 
Appearance: very dark brown, clear, with really nice head with small bubbles 
Aroma: mainly clove, which resembles soap, some dried fruits is the background(figs), sweetness 
Taste: sweet, soap like cloves, a hint of dried fruits, fruit sweet finish, a bit alcoholic, warming in the throat

Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a clear deep brown colour with a ruby tiny and a thin off white head. Aroma of plum, raisin, fig, some caramel, slight cola, a little chocolate, a hint of alcohol, subtle smoke and spice. Taste of plum, raisin, fig, some caramel, slight cola, a little chocolate, a hint of toasted malts, subtle alcohol and spice. Full bodied and soft carbonation. A long, sweet, warming, caramel and fruity finish. Malty, fruity and very complex. Sweet but the alcohol gives it a bitter bite and subtle crispness. A big, boozy beer.

Bottle. Dark ruby/brown with a fine head. Aroma of cherries, malts and dark fruits. Taste is plums, bananas, cherries, dark berries and marzipan. Oily mouthfeel. Slightly sour finish. Very balanced. Alcohol is well hidden but buzzing. Strong carbonation. A marvellous dessert beer. Beautiful.

Bottle@ Wegebergs. Cloudy brown with medium head. Aroma of dried fruits, brown sugar, plum. Taste: sweet bread, dried dark fruits, dades. Alcohol well hidden, very good beer. Some Quad similarities. Long lasting and warm aftertaste.

Z: Banan, goździk, palony chleb, biszkopt, estry w stronę śliwki, przechodzące w wiśnie i intensywny alkohol. Bardziej w nalewkę niż ordynarny spiryt. S: Pełne, ciastko zbożowe, dalej chlebowo, słodko, śliwka finisz lekko podwędzany, likierowy. Finisz zostaje na dość długo.

01-04-17 // sampled at CRAFT Frankfurt 2017. Dark murky brown beer with beige lacing. Intense aroma of dired fruits and alcohol. Taste is heavy bodied, very sweet, dried fruits, plum, raisins, banana, alcohol.
Brown colour with white foam. Aroma of dried fruit, a bit sour. The taste is also a lot of dried fruit and sweet

Hazy brown color with thick, stable off-white head. Aroma of roast and caramel. Taste is very sweet, but still not too much. Warming alcohol finish. Its much better after standing 10 minutes, so its warmer. Very nice.
UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 dark caramel goodness with a bit of bite in the aftertaste. like a german brune.
Vynikající pivo s masivní chutí, skvělou silou i aromatem. Na to, e je to třicítka, mi vdy sedl parádně.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter. A cloudy brown with no head, just a thin tan film. Aroma is caramel, roasted malts, dark fruit and a hint of smoke. Strong, sweet flavor with cloves. Thick in the mouth, full body, lively carbonation. Long finish in which the alcohol comes through.
Überraschend süß im Geschmack. Sehr vielfältige Nuancen von Bananen und Dörrobst sowie Schokolade und Karamell. Langanhaltender Abgang feiner Noten.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2017 Banan, suszone owoce, karmel. Słodkie, pełne, gładkie. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie do wysokiego. Super.

Bottle from Saveur biere. Pours murky Brown with tan head. Nose is ripe banana, raisin, dried prune, rum, vanilla. Flavour is a short caramel, dark fruit, dried fruit sweetness with a drying alcohol finish. Warms the cockles.
Kolor brązowy, jasna piana. W aromacie suszone owoce, karmel, śliwka, wanilia, trochę jabłkowo-bananowo. W smaku śliweczka, banan, karmel, suszone owoce. Alkohol dosyć dobrze ukryty. Fajne piwo.

33cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconick te Vichte. U: Donkerbruin met gebroken witte schuimkraag. G: Karamel, banaan en chocolade. S: Zoet, kruidig, karamel. Chocolade, gedroogd fruit. Alcoholwarmte. M: Volmondig met weinig carbonatie.

Aroma of ripe banana, dried fruits, some toasty and caramel notes. Tastes like dried fruits, banana and some notes of plum in chocolate. Almost oily mouthfeel, very sweet, carbonation is very low. Very tasty.

Mycket mörkt rödbrun, rejält grumlig med stort finbubbligt skum. Doften är vinös med massor av torkad frukt, sedvanlig skumbanan, jästighet och kryddighet plus en lite syrlighet. Smaken är minst sagt fyllig, vinös med läckra fruktsmaker och kryddor samt en liten fin avslutande beska; de 12 procenten alkohol är helt integrerade i smaken. En veteöl i kubik! En öl man blir lycklig av, sa min fru. En underbar smuttaröl att förgylla en kväll med! 
En 2010:a testad 13 januari 2013. Inte längre grumlig utan det finns i stället en fällning i form av flagor i botten. Sagolikt god med massor av katrinplommon, lite mandelmassa och en rejäl eldighet. Maffigt!

Dark head disappears quickly, but its normal for high alcohol volume beer. Tawny colour, hazy. Aroma of evident banana, liquorice, caramel in the background and a hint of chocolate. In taste banana, sweetness, alcohol is noticeable but very well balanced. Fantastic beer.
33cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bières. Belle couleur acajou, notes de fruits mûrs. Belle rondeur très agréable.

0,33l Bottle. Pours with a hazy brown color and large ivory head, which disappearces quickly. Only at the first moments, there are some smoked-bacons notes - just sloghtly. The nose is very nice: Raisins, banana, yeast. Taste of bananas, Belgian yeast, malty and sweet (caramel). Full-bodied and good carbonation.

Piwo w kolorze brunatnym, z dosyć szybko znikającą pianą. W zapachu jest cudownie, pierwsze skojarzenie to banan z ogniska, no dokładnie tak to piwo pachnie, poza tym trochę wiśni i suszonej śliwki. W smaku jest przede wszystkim słodko, dosyć łagodnie, po chwili uderza likier wiśniowy. Bardzo fajne jest to piwo.

Bottle 0.33 l, Piwnica, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnobrązowe, mętne piwo o beżowej, niezbyt obfitej pianie oraz przyjemnym, śliwkowo-bananowym, podwędzanym aromacie. W smaku gęste, słodkawe i likierowe, zdecydowanie owocowe - dominuje śliwka, banan i wiśnia, która przełamuje słodycz kwaskowym posmakiem, finisz natomiast z nutami goździkowymi i mocno rozgrzewający gardło.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 Barwa brunatna, piana średnia i szybko znika. Aromat suszonych śliwek, daktyli, fig. W smaku słodkie z nutami goździków, banana i suszonych owoców. Alko nie wyczuwalne. Super pifko
Bottle from Liquor Barn. Pours a hazy brown with very little head. Aroma of dark fruits and wheat.
Mętne, dość gęste, drobno pęcherzykowa piana. Wyczuwalne suszone/wędzone śliwki, figi, banan. Nasycenie dość niskie.

0,33lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos Greece
Intense, indeed! Full-bodied as it gets, a concentrated Aventinus that rocks. You feel the alcohol heat, you get the power of flavor, you can see / smell / feel it.
Awsome!

Lallure dune Doppelbock en plus "dense", brune et troublée, avec une mousse fine beige. Au nez, aucune surprise quand on est un amateur de la Aventinus Doppelbock, hormis lalcool beaucoup plus présent. On retrouve avec joie les notes de malt caramel, le blé, les céréales omniprésentes, le côté chocolat au lait, la noix, des traces de coriandre, des notes damande et de praline, de pain viennois, la banane (grosse charge), le pruneau, la poire pochée et la pomme cuite... La complexité est moyenne mais léquilibre est superbe. En bouche, la claque ! La première gorgée sarticule directement sur les malts et les saveurs associées tandis que quelques secondes plus tard, lalcool monte soudainement en puissance et vous "cuit" la cavité buccale. La carbonatation est faible (compte tenu du processus de fabrication ce nest pas une surprise), lamertume sobre, la texture ronde. Non, ce qui ressort vraiment sur les gorgées suivantes, cest lalcool. Alors attention, point de méprise cher(e-s) lecteur(s)/lectrice(s) ! Cest un alcool de très haute volée avec des saveurs exquises, mais elles ont justement tendance à voler la vedette au reste. Le final est sur lalcool évidemment, et on sent vraiment le côté éthanol genre vodka. Jaime beaucoup les bières alcoolisées car généralement elles ont vraiment du corps. Celle-ci ne déroge pas à la règle à ceci près que ce nest pas une Belge Forte, un Barley Wine ou un Imperial Stout. On ne retrouve pas la richesse aromatique des genres cités précédemment, ce qui nest guère surprenant quand on connait lhistorique de la fabrication de cette bière artificiellement chargée en alcool. Cependant, cette Aventinus Eisbock est on ne peut plus buvable contrairement à dautres breuvages shootés au liquide lave-glace. Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

Wyglad: mętne, brunatne, drobnopecherzykowa piana - gęsta, lacing ładnie zdobi szklo 
Aromat: suszone owoce, śliwka, banan, 
Smak: śliwka, suszone owoce, banan, alkohol ogrzewajacy przełyk, nasycenie średnie

330ml bottle from Beerhawk. 
Thin off white head disappears quickly, no lacing. Cloudy dark brown body. Nose is raisin, brown sugar, fruit cake. Big malty flavour, cake, dried fruit, brown sugar, hints of marzipan, treacle. Gentle bittersweet finish. High carbonation, jagged mouthfeel. Not overly boozy for 12%. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Obfita i trwała drobnopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie suszone śliwki, daktyle i figi. Przyjemna słodycz. 

Dosyć wysoko nasycone. W smaku banany i goździki. Rześkie. 
Fajnie ułożone proporcje. Alkohol ukryty idealnie.

0.33l bottle. Malty aroma, plums, figs, candy. Dark brown color, white head. Malty taste, plums, candy, medium sweet, soft bitter. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation and fruity, finish. Good, but this is not my favourite style.

Dark color, no head. Aroma of red berries, caramel and plums. Very sweet. Nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mętne, bardzo gęste, w aromacie suszone owoce, figi, troche kompot z suszu, dość przyjemny alkohol. W smaku to samo, piwo fajnie złożone, słodkie

Birra di color marrone intenso. Schiuma fine. Allolfatto sentori di frutta, lievito e frutta secca. Al palato una birra dal corpo strutturato con note dolci di frutta secca, albicocca e caramello. L?alcool si sente ma grazie al corpo di questa birra non è sgradevole. Nel finale lamaro del luppolo è praticamente assente. Una birra eccellente che si beve a piccoli sorsi. Si abbina perfettamente ad una torta al cioccolato, sacher e tutti quei dolci particolarmente golosi.

33 cl fles uit 2015....Donkerbruin, crèmekleurige snel gezakte schuimkraag, troebel, weinig koolzuur. 
Aroma: Fruitig, pruim, karamel, chocolade, tarwemout, geroosterde mouten, kruidig en fruitig gehopt.
Smaak: Zoet, kruidig, iets zout en drop achtig, donkere geroosterde mout, tarwe, karamel, vol moutig, brooddeeg, fruitig, donker fruit, pruimen, kruidige/spicy hops, banaan en kruidnagel vanuit de gist. 
Er gebeurt heel veel in dit bier! Wat een topper!
Lekker wat warmte van zowel de kruidigheid als de alcohol maken dit een heerlijke licht bittere opwarmer.
Volle body, romig en zacht mondgevoel, zacht koolzuur.  Afdronk is kruidig en zoetig.
Aanrader!
Bottle from appellation wines dalry. Pours clear dark brown. Nose of spices, malts, nutmeg, coffee, Christmas cake. Taste is full bodied, smooth, more malts, more coffee and spices.

Aromat: karmel, pieczywo, morela, suszone owoce 
Wygląd: piana wysoka, powoli opadająca, oklejająca szklankę, ładna. Kolor brunatny, zamglony, nieprzejrzysty 
Smak; suszone owoce, kompot, morele, banany, goździki, słodycz. Średnio słodowe, silny balans. 
Odczucie w ustach: pełne, nagazowanie brak, zaklejające, oleiste, alkohol wyczuwalny w przełyku. Średnio wytrawne. 
Ogólnie: świetne piwo. Idealnie łączy, koźlaka z pszeniczniakiem dodatkowo podrasowane wymrażaniem. Duży balans. Biorąc pod uwagę cenę w naszym kraju (~10PLN), to aż żal nie spróbować.

11.2 fl.oz. - it pours a cola/iced tea color with almost no head. The aroma is very nice with notes of prune juice, brandy, caramel, ripe fruit and molasses. Rich and sweet flavors like dates, ripe fall fruit, molasses, golden raisin and mild boozy heat. Fabulous
Piwo miedziane, klarowne. Piana średnia edukuje się do obrączki. W aromacie wyraźne pieczywo, owoce, przyprawy, karmel. W smaku podobnie. Pełne. Wysycenie niskie.
Bottle, bb 5.05.2020. Pours brown, cloude, with almost no head. Aromas of dried fruits, bread, melanoidins, banana, very complex. Sweet, no bitterness. Full bodied, average carbonation. Very good.
Butelka. Sliwka, pieczona skórka chleba, ciemne dojrzałe/przejchalw owoce. Lepkie, aksamitne, złożone. Alk. dobrze schowany.

Bardzo dużo ciemnych owoców - śliwki, suszone morele. Na drugim planie delikatnie można wyczuć ciemne pieczywo i banany. Bardzo gęste i aksamitne, zaklejające. W smaku głownie owocowa słodycz, ale dobrze zrównoważona przez słodowe, potężne ciało. Mimo dużej mocy alkohol mało wyczuwalny, przyjemnie rozgrzewa, pije się przyjemnie. Bardzo dobre.

Kolor: ciemny bursztyn,
Aromat: nuty winne, szampańskie, troszkę dzikie, lambikowate
Smak: słodki, lekki posmak czerwonych owoców - wiśni, śliwek, jest banan, wysycenie średnio wysokie, schłodzone bardzo dobrze maskuje alkohol, po ogrzaniu wychodzi delikatnie alkohol ale nie czuć tych 12% alk, całkiem solidny eisbock

0,33 l bottle. BB 22.07.2020. Pours out a little bit oily. A darkest red brown in the glass, smallest light beige head. Malty fruity sweetness on the nose. Taste starts Malty, also wheat, dark fruity, alcoholic warming. But smooth. Very smooth. Some clove and chewing gum. No noticeable vcarbonation. Increasing alcoholic but pleasant. Great stuff!

Aromat słodki, nuty suszonych śliwek, banany, melasa, opiekane pieczywo.
W smaku pełne, słodkie, melasa, banany, karmel, finisz to alkoholowe rozgrzewanie.

Pours brown, very hazy, perfect head. Nose: bread, toast, fruits, plum, bananas. Mouth: nice log sweetness, some biterness, more fruits, almost no alcohol. Bitter finish, average carbonation, extremely oily feel. First eisbock, but surely not last one.

330 ml bottle at German Club in East Brisbane. Pours dark brown with small to medium light tan head. Mild aroma of malt. Balanced flavours of malt, dark fruit. Smooth mouth feel. Very enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2017 What a good surprise. Drank this one on tap @La Fine Mousse, Paris. This is a beer I?ll remember without problem, quite a deep taste and unique character, In a way, this is certainly the best "fruit beer" I ever drank even if it?s not exactly how it is supposed to be categorized. The plum aroma is quite present in mouth, impossible to miss it, resulting in a long and sweet aftertaste. Strong hints of roasted coffee along the way, and a marvelous alcohol level, but still easy to drink without effort. I can?t recommend this one enough. Amazing. APPROVED BY TAVERNY?S BLACK METAL CREW!

Pours deep reddish color with several fingers of beige head that quickly dissipate to a small tight ring. Lots of alcohol in the aroma. Taste is sweet and bready. Some fruity notes. Really intense wheat beer. Highly alcoholic. It pretty drinkable. Not a huge bock fan but this is pretty good beer.
Very strong wheat beer with some plum aromas (imagine a Dunkel with more alcohol and plum aftertaste and aroma). Not my type of beer.

W aromacie nuty ciemnego chleba, rodzynki, figi, śliwki, czerwone owoce, nuty białego wina, estry, fenole, pojawiają się też nuty bananowe i goździkowe, dzieje się bardzo dużo. W wyglądzie ciemny bursztyn wpadający w brąz, obrączka beżowej piany. W smaku znów nuty ciemnego pieczywa, śliwki, figi, rodzynki, białe wino, fenole, także dzieje się dużo, bardzo ładnie ułożone. W tle nieco pszenicznej słodyczy, finisz bardzo fenolowy, drożdżowy, belgijski. Ciało degustacyjne, przyjemnie rozgrzewa z każdym łykiem. Bardzo dobre, złożone i ułożone piwo o przyjemnym aromacie i świetnym smaku.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2017 Coca-colowa barwa. Bardzo bogaty aromat. Z początku intensywna guma balonowa, z czasem wychodzą figi, śliwki, melasa, ciemne owoce. Pojawia się także nuta alkoholowa. W smaku również bogato, słodko. Słodkie kandyzowane owoce, dojrzały banan, rodzynki. Niestety na minus alkoholowość która trochę przeszkadza w odbiorze. Piwo ma dużo ciała. Słodycz pod koniec wydaje się dosyć przytłaczająca, w połączeniu z rozgrzewającym alkoholem sprawia że piwo jest ciężkie, typowo degustacyjne. Tak czy inaczej piwo warte spróbowania, ciekawe. Złożoność robi wrażenie

Dark chestnut colour, cloudy, small beige head. Aroma is fruity, banana, plum, orange, some notes of dried fruits, wheat, yeast. Taste medium sweet, plum, figs, raisins, vinous like notes, hop,spices, alcohol. Medium body, medium to high carbonation, slightly bitter finish.

Bottle at Budapest. Cloudy brownish-copper with beige head. The aroma has lots of fruits, lactic and spicy, alcohol, raisin, dulce de leche, wheat and yeasts. Very complex flavor, sweetish and alcoholic with notes of fruit cake, raisin, yeasts, a bit lactic, spices, clove, cinnamon and wheat. Full-bodied. Excellent.

Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, piwo jest wyraźnie mętne; ładna piana z lacingiem. W aromacie wybitnie słodowe. Czuć karmel. toffi, nieco skórki od chleba; czuć też nieco alkohol. W smaku podobnie - słodko, Goryczka bardzo niska, nieco śliwek. Alkoghol bardzo rozgrzewa w przełyku ale nie czuć go na języku.
Butelka. Aromat alkoholu, słodowy, toffi, po prostu mocny koźlak. W smaku goryczka alkoholowa, niesamowicie rozgrzewa.
W zapachu banan, śliwka, dalej pszeniczny słód, trochę karmelu. Jest też alkohol, 12% robi swoje. Gęste, syropowate, słodkie, ciężkie. Dojrzałe banany, figi. Wybitne piwo

Dark brown color. Aroma of raisins , figs , brown sugar and yeasts. Rich flavor of dark fruits and candy sugar with hint of alcohol. Light alcohol bitterness at the end.Warming finish and aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle with expiry date 2021.01.29. Black colour with brown reflexes, head disappears quickly without a trace. Intensive aroma of date, fig, raisin, also some bread, dough and honey. Alcohol is present but does not disturb. Medium sweet, light bitterness, mostly from alcohol. Not too heavy, lively carbonation.

Aromat - czekolada, pumpernikiel, śliwka, pomarańcza, 
Piana - uboga, średnia i drobna; szybko opada,
W smaku wyczuwalny alkohol "półszlachetny", do tego rozgrzewanie w przełyk. Ponadto śliwki, sok marchewkowo pomarańczowy, krągły karmel; raczej słodko. Ciało pełne. Średnio niskie nasycenie, mogło być niższe. Goryczki brak, choć na końcu język cierpnie od alkoholu. Nadaje się do leżakowania.
Big head, lasts long, dark, red color, looks a bit grey. Aroma: dry fruits, grapes, alcohol. Tastes fruity, full body, sweet, soft carbonation, prickling alcohol sensation

Bottles. (1) Bought 2009; BBE Mar 2013; Drank Jan 2010; (2) Bottled 2009; Bought 2010; BBE Jul 2014; Drank Dec 2014 - Dark murky caramel/reddish brown in colour. Very Fruity; bananas, apples, dark fruit, cherries. Very Malty; sweet malts, caramel, toffee, wheat, candy sugar, hints of chocolate. Spicy; cloves, pepper. Yeasty; heavily sedimented. Vinous; port-like. Very smooth; slightly syrupy. Pronounced warming alcohol. Sweet fruity malty throughout. Liked this a lot. Terrific Beer! (2)=(2014-12-08)

Hazy dark ruby body, with a small off-white head. Indistinct aroma of red fruit, burnt sugar, raisins, a hint of alcohol. Taste is rich sweet malt balanced by a significant alcohol presence, though not hot or harsh. Also, theres plenty of dark fruit esters. Very full-bodied, very thick texture, low carbonation.

Very intense aroma of dried fruit in the kind of plum and grape. Notes of burned sugar and a bit of booze in the background. Dark ruby in the glass with thick tan head. Taste is very complex with notes of dark fruit, some raisin and notes of burned sugar with hints of coffee cherries. Oily texture. Very good winter warmer.

From bottle in Germany. Poured with a large, medium bubbled head with great retention and lacing. Appears near black and opaque with a hint of deep copper in the light. Aroma is reminiscent of a Belgian dubbel lots of sweetness and a little booze. Taste is a masterful balance of dark malt with a little wheat that isn?t too sweet; but the beer itself is malty sweet. Palate is smooth if a little oily and a little gas which isn?t tasted but felt.
Bottle. I like dark wheat and I like specially this one. Dark, sweet and full bodied.

Aroma: very malty and a little dry; Appearance: very dark amber with thin white head that lingers; Taste: follows nose; some smokiness at the end; Palate: heavy body with long, malty finish; Overall: not my favorite style; would not get again.

Pours unclear brown amber with a beige head. Aroma of brown sugar, sweet esters, plums, dark fruit, banana, bubblegum and caramel. Taste of sweet esters, caramel, dark sweet fruits, bubblegum, sweet Malts and raisins. Warming alcohol towards the end. A sweet sipper.
Bottle. Pours brown ruby with low head. Aroma is plums, malts, alcohol. Taste is plums, banana, malts and alcohol.

Bottle. Phenols on nose. Huge banana kick. Nextly overraper grapes, mango, orange. Sweet and fruity in taste. Chocolate and caramell notes after that. So intensive and sweet. Sticky and thick. Like banana/mango/chocolate liquier. Dessert essence!

Nez: Caramel, fruits confits, banane
Bouche: Caramel, fruits confits, raisin, banane, fruits secs, liquoreuse
Excellente bière qui réchauffe bien
Bottle - Transparent clear nut brown color, small head. Taste is nuts, dried fruits, some vanilla, molassus, sweet grape sugar finish. Some bitterness. Good, alcohol well hidden.

33cl, 1st vintage in a series of cellared bottles: Limitierte Abfüllung 2012 -155680 (bb01/18). - Smells, pours and tastes like a plumwine and brandy doused bread/plum pudding, pretty smooth digestif destillation of what is heavy about the Aventinus Weizenbock, adding quite a burn on the swallow. Aromas of umami soy, sherry, stewed apple, massive sherry and Madeira (fortified wine) in flavour, making it great in and with a slow pork pot roast... -
330ml bottle from Good Spirits Co. Very dark amber with a thick off white head. Bready Christmas cake aroma, flavour pretty much the same with a big burny alcohol finish. Lovely stuff

330ml bottle.
Hazy brown color creamy head.
Spicy aroma - cloves, fruitcake.
Sweet body - molasses, rum, raisin and smooth alcoholic finish.
Nice.
dark brown, almost black, some tan lacing. maltt aroma, syrup, brown sugar. malty taste, some bitterness, slightly roasty. medium body, soft carbonation, sticky mouthfeel. pretty good.

Bottle from the Good Spirits Co Wine & Beer. Nose is boozy, sweet, barley sugar. Taste is sticky sweet, treacly, dark slightly bitter. Palate is rather scratchy but oddly appealing. Good, but rather too boozy.

The color is dark ruby. No head. Aroma: dried fruits, apricots, plums raisins. Molasses. Carnations. Carmel and the smell of bread crusts. A little spicy. Taste: caramel, dried fruits, a little wine. Full body, medium carbonation. Rather sweet.

Piwo lekko metne w kolorze brunatno brazowym z minimalna iloscia piany. W aromacie cala paleta to wyboru: suszone owoce, banan z gozdzikiem, drozdze, karmel, skorka od chleba. W smaku intensywna swieza dojrzala sliwka, nuty melanoidowe, przyprawy i przyjemny alkohol grzejacy w gardlo. Polslodkie z niskim wysyceniem i minimalna goryczka. Naprawde intensywne i pyszne piwo do degustacji.

Butelka 0,33l, data przydatności 29.01.2021r.
Aromat - Słodki, śliwki, lekkie landrynki, lekki dym, morele, lekko winny, pełny, lekko waniliowy. Bardzo przyjemny, powiem więcej świetny!
Wygląd - Barwa głęboko rubinowa, klarowne. Piana średnia, zbita i twarda, barwy ecru, średnio pęcherzykowa, długo się utrzymuje w postaci kożucha, ładny lasing.
Smak - Wytrawne, suszone owoce, trochę dymu, lekki karmel, alkohol wyczuwalny w postaci rozgrzewającej w przełyku. Głębia okrągła, ładnie wszystko ze sobą gra, choć mogło by trochę poleżeć. Wysycenie średnie do niskiego. Goryczka niska, ale zaznaczona lekką piołunowością. Bardzo dobre piwo!

Backlog. Old review 
Drank it pretty fresh. A lot of dried fruit, caramel, yeast some alcohol present in both taste and aroma. Pretty slick mouthfeel. I want it aged the next time
Aroma: dried fruits, yeast, wheat, light caramel and toffee. Taste: malts, caramel, dried fruits, yeast and lot of alcohol. Medium head, poor lacing and high carbonation.

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear chestnut brown with a beige head. Aroma of bananas, some yeast, some alcohol. Full oily body with a low carbonation and a medium to heavy sweetness. Flavor of caramel, molasses, ripe sweet pear, quince, spices (cloves), alcohol.

Donker amberkleurig bier met rode gloed en beige schuimkraag die vlug weg is. Geur: gebrande mout, zoet, alcoholisch, fruitlikeur. Smaak: zoet, redelijk droog, alcoholisch, mueslireep, gestoofde peren en donker en gedroogd fruit. Volmondig. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: alcoholisch, droog. Mijn eerste eisbock denk ik. Verrassend!

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Brązowe z przeciętną pianą. Aromat dość intensywny, przypieczona skórka od chleba, tost, chleb, toffi, karmel, dojrzałe owoce, śliwka. W smaku półsłodkie, mocno alkoholowe, wyraźne melanoidyny i śliwka. Nasycenie średnie, półpełne.

No head, dark brown color. In aroma, plum liqour is easly recognized, i noticed also some soureness. Taste is strong but not overwhelming, and its a kind of suprise. Again plums and dark fruits are in front, alcohol is well hidden but warming. I wouldnt say its thin as syrup it is rather sticky and maybe carbonated to high. All in all, I dont like bocks at all, but this one is supereb beer to me.

Spices, red fruits, banana, yeast, reddish/brown with a rocky head, full body, medium carbonation, a very pleasant sweetness, an explendid mix of fruits, very warming...a monumental beer from germany.

Robe brune, mousse crémeuse, peu persistante. Nez tout en élégance sur des notes florales, des agrumes, une pointe de farine, de céréales, sur un fond de caramel et de pain brioché. Bouche à lattaque onctueuse, crémeuse, un fruit délicat, une belle bulle élégante et enrobée, puis lacidité et lamertume équilibrent lensemble. En effet une très grande bière par sa persistance et sa complexité.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (vor 2 Jahren direkt bezogen). Leicht trübes Braun mit vergehender Schaumkrone. Eher süßlich-malzaromatisch. Der Alkohol ist spät spürbar.

Bottle. Brown color with off-white head. Aroma has berries, caramel, wheat malt, yeast, port wine and plums. Taste is malty with long quite sweet aftertaste. Flavors of malt, berries, yeast, plums, wood and some alcohol. Intense and tasty one.

Clear, dark amber colour with no head. Medium intensive aroma of dark dried fruits, toasted bread crust and hint of banana. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with medium long duration sweet (fruity) finish. Warming aftertaste. Solid stuff.

Brown, really nice off white head, medium carbonation. Aroma: banana, caramel, hay, raisin, bubblegum, clove, plum. Full to medium body, medium to heavy sweetness. Again lots of banana in flavour, lots of dry fruits, quite a lot sweetness, but also medium bitterness. Greatly hidden alcohol (bit perceptible, but for 12% very nice). Surprisingly drinkable.

0,33l bottle. Beutiful hazy deep copper/brown colour with yeast drops and a medium lasting big foamy tan head. Aroma: Very intense! Caramel, honey, marcipan notes, but also has a serious tropic caracter with pine and banana aromas. Taste: Oh my god. What a beer. Sweet-sweet malty start with a very pleasent and well balanced bitter mouthfeel. Tha taste is so strong it keeps coming back after the sip. I cant feel the high alcohol in the sip just the warm feel in my stomach. Has some creamy texture. Full body with fizzy carbonation. In the palate a short sweet/bitter, than a medium lasting bitter, finally a long light sour finish. This is a hell of a complex beer. Fantastic!

Bottle at home. Deep mahagony colour, good lightbrown head with a good retention. A nice surprise with the 12 ABV. Lots of dead yeast in the bottle, huge ugly chunks. Nose is booze. Faint rhum, plum mash, almond. Taste is medum bitterness, medium sweetness. Taste is also rhumy, stronger almonds and wood. Really feels like a nice quality rhum. Full mouthfeel. Lovely, but the 12 abv packs a punch.
Gran cerveza con toques dulces y que entra genial. Ojo, se nota mucho su graduación, tiene peligro, pero... Me voy a por otra ahora ??

Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn. Pours cloudy dark copper colour with a small short lasting off-white head. Aroma of plum jam, cherry, rhobarb, syrup, chocolate, and somewhat medicinal and alcoholic. Medium to heavy sweetness, light sour. Rich body, thick texture. Finish has a light sour edge and lasting fruity sweetness. Delicious.

Bottle, dark amber beer, big cream colored head faded. Aroma is malt, raisins, anise. Taste is malt, raisin and prune, anise, and a hint of sour cherry. Theres also some alcohol here (might seem obvious, but its a noticeable, slightly solvent flavor). Palate is rich and smooth, carbonation average.

Kolor: ciemnomiedziany, lekko zamglony.
Piana: średnio obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, w miarę trwała.
Zapach: sporo nut owocowych, dojrzałych wiśni, brzoskwiń, rodzynek, trochę bananów, lekkie aromaty przyprawowe, goździki, po ogrzaniu wychodzi delikatny alkohol, ale nie drażniący.
Smak: spora pełnia, wyraźne nuty słodowe, opiekane, lekko melanoidynowe, sporo nut owocowych, ciemnych owoców, daktyli, rodzynek, wiśni, śliwek, goryczka niska, przyjemne rozgrzewanie od alkoholu.
Wysycenie: średnie.

Ma niesamowity aromat - gdy zawiał wiatr, poczuli go wszyscy nasi towarzysze. Są nim rodzynki, śliwki, mocne banany, rum. Smak podobnie mocny, intensywny i piękny. Lekko mleczny, rodzynkowy, z gumą balonową podkreślającą pszeniczny charakter piwa, winnymi (a może nalewkowymi) wiśniami. Piwo przy całej swojej mocy (25,5° blg i 12% alkoholu) jest bardzo gładkie i lekko alkoholowa goryczka jest praktycznie niezauważalna. Piło się świetnie - nawet na ogromnym upale.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2016 Butelka 330ml (30.11.2020). Barwa ciemno brunatna, czerwonawa pod swiatlo. Piana bezowa, drobna, obfita lecz nietrwala i po kilku chwilach na powierzchni piwa pozostaje tylko cieniutka warstwa, ktora opadajac nie zostawila prawie zadnych sladow na szkle. Aromat srednio intensywny z nutami suszonych owocow jak sliwka, wisnia, poza tym slodowy, slodkawy z delikatnymi nutami malanoidynowymi i co wazne bez sladu alkoholu, no moze malutka nuta po ogrzaniu. Bardzo podobne nuty w smaku przy czym pojawia sie wyrazne pieczenie w przelyku choc alkohol jest dosc dobrze ukryty. Nasycenie srednie do wysokiego, ciut za wysokie, piwo delikatnie musuje na jezyku. Finisz wyraznie slodowy, slodki. Bardzo dobry "podrasowany" kozlak z dosc dobrze ukrytym alkoholem nawet po wymrozeniu.

Data ważności: 29.01.2021 
 Kolor:  Ciemnobrunatny. Pod światło cała masa rubinowych refleksów. 
 Piana:  Drobnopęcherzykowa, potem średniopęcherzykowa, dość szybko opada w dół. Ma ona rzadko spotykany kolor kości słoniowej.
Piana po pewnym czasie redukuje się do cieńkiego krążka. Po zakręceniu szkłem wyraźnie widać "płaczące łzy" spływająca po ściankach Sniftera. 
 Zapach:  Ewidentnie słodowy. Mnóstwo tutaj aromatów melanoidowych (skórka od chleba, tosty). Nie brakuje także wędzonych śliwek i rodzynek.
Wyraźnie wyczuwalna jest także drzewna wędzonka, której się tutaj kompletnie nie spodziewałem.
Po ogrzaniu nawet dość mocno dominuje.
Nie zabrakło także karmelowych, 
a nawet lekko czekoladowych detali.
Początek jest bardzo zachęcający. 
 Smak:  Na języku górują słodowe niuanse.
Najmocniej wyczuwalne są wędzone śliwki, ale nie brakuje także wiśni i czereśni.
Dużo tutaj również rodzynek, lekkie toffi i odrobina czekolady z nadzieniem.
Melanoidowe posmaki co jakiś czas przemkną przez usta.
Eisbock ma bardzo gęstą teksturę. Nalewa się jak olej silnikowy.
Piwo jest pełne w smaku z średnią goryczką.
Posmaki alkoholowe są widoczne, ale nie są one ani rozpuszczalnikowe, ani gryzące.
Ekstemalnie mocne, ale nie od alkoholu, bardziej od pełni i treściwości.
Bez dwóch zdań świetne piwo. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Eisbock jest rodzajem mocnego Podwójnego Koźlaka (Doppelbock).
Nazwa pochodzi od procesu wymrażania w celu zatężenia piwa.
Piwo zamraża się, a następnie powstały lód usuwa, aby zwiększyć zawartość alkoholu.

Bardzo bogate, pełne, słodowe piwo w którym dominują aromaty i posmaki melanoidowe (tosty, skórka chlebowa), toffi, karmel, rodzynki, ciemne owoce (śliwki, wiśnie), lekka czekolada.
Zaskoczeniem dla mnie były mocno wyczuwalne w aromacie, przyjemne nuty drzewnej wędzonki.
Tekstura jest potężna, a pełnia wysoka.
Aventinus Eisbock to bardzo ciekawe i pyszne piwo deserowe, które umili każdemu czas w zimny, deszczowy wiczór.
Polecam każdemu, gdyż jest to rzadki i niedoceniony styl.
Old review. One of my absolutely favorite beers. Heavy, delicious, great mouthfeel. Heavenly stuff and a must-taste for anyone.

Dégustée dans un verre "les 3 loups",jolie robe marron-foncé,légèrement trouble surmontée dune mousse crème peu persistante et avec une bonne carbonatation.Le nez nous offre des arômes puissants vineux,boisés et épicés avec une pointe dacidité.La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs à limage du nez avec un agréable velouté qui persiste en Finale.Cet équilibre entre Douceur et Acidité est extraordinaire et nous emporte dans le même univers des Pannepot,Rochefort 10 ,Straffe Hendrick.....avec cette petite note originale donnée par la petite note "pétillante"mêlée à cette douceur infinie........

Dégustée dans un verre Maredsous.
Température de début 9 à 10°.
Magnifique robe brun sombre légèrement translucide à reflets roux; mousse de couleur crème peu persistante; bonne carbonatation.
Nez séduisant et original : boisé, vineux avec des arômes de caractère acide.
Le goût est tout aussi remarquable : ici lhabituelle dualité amertume/douceur cède sa place à acidité/douceur avec des notes de pruneaux, fruits macérés et des saveurs chocolatées.La deuxième bouche nous ramène des essences boisées et un délicieux et chaleureux alcool.
La finale longue et savoureuse prolonge le plaisir sur la douceur.
Une très grande réussite.
Pour amateurs de Pannepot, Rochefort 10, Straffe Hendrick quadruple, etc...

(bottle)
Aroma:toasted malt,bread,pralines
Appearance:dark brownish color,small yellowish head,
Taste:sweet,flavour of caramel,bread,toasted malt, and dark fruits,sweet caramel finish,bready and slighlty boozy aftertaste.
Palate:full body,oily texture, quite boozy.
Overall:Lovely stuff,rich bready monster,if only it wasnt so boozy.
Bottle at home from valhallas goat Glasgow a dark brown colour beer with sweet fruity aroma flavour is ripe bannana, plum with sticky toffee malts sweet fermented fruity with big alcohol finish

33cl bottle. Dark and murky ruby pour with a very thin tan head. Notes of dried fruit, grape juice, tons of burnt caramel, overripe bananas, spicy alcohol. Full body, medium to low carbonation and a caramel sweet and somewhat alcoholic finish.

Botella en una @Cata. 16/10/16 BBD:06/07/21
Color ambar, sabor malta, dulce, caramelo.

Bottle from Liquor Barn, poured in a pint glass. Dark brown amber with aroma of plums. Creamy full body. Sweet caramel malt and alcohol taste. Sweet finish. Packs a lot of nuance for a beer with so high an ABV.
30cl bottle. Awesome beer! Stong beer, but a smooth drink. Perfect for the cold winter evenings! Defenitly one of the best German beers

Dark copper color, clear, one to two fingers off-white head. Sweet, pleasant, malty aroma with notes of red wine, plums, cherry, sherry, biscuits and just a tiny touch of alcohol. Its also thick and dense in the nose. In the mouth its a little bit over carbonated, but except that its very smooth, full bodied. Taste is very fruity as well but in the same time its more biscuity, cookie-ish, winey. Alcohol is super well balanced, put all together, hard to notice it in taste far a 12 abv beer. Its like dessert, not drinkable for sure. Awesome beer.

0,33l bottle from Merkur. Intense, warm, malty, creamy, well-balanced, the high ABV is not noticeable, Nice malt liqueur.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ sbwf. Cloudy amber with almost no head. Aroma and taste has an incredibly nice complexity of fruits, dark fruits and marmalade, spices, dark bread. Great duration.
Really interesting beer. Despite high alcohol volume its quite drinkable. Aroma of smoked plums and some champagne makes the beer even more interesting.
Bottle. Hazy grey brown body with some carbonation. Medium cream head. Nose is malt vinegar, malt, alcohol, fruit, oak, acetone. Taste is sweet with bitter raw alcohol notes. Dry finish.

Deep hazy brown coloured beer with a big, cappuccino coloured, medium to good lasting, head. Aromas of plums, bitter almond, toffee, clove, bread, heavier claret, whiff of perfume. Taste is plumy, heavy wheaty, malty, some lighter fruitiness shining through towards finish, peppery, spicy yeast all over it. Lasting warmth. Heavy body, oily texture, average carbonation. Beautiful!

Bouteille datée du 10/11/2015, bue après 10 mois. Robe brune trouble avec un mince filet de mousse. Arômes de pâte à biscuit, caramel chaud, baies confites, pâtisseries, toffee, malt de blé soyeux. En bouche, caramel intense, baies confites, vanille, pain au bananes, un peu de chocolat au lait, cassonade, pruneaux. Légère amertume. Texture huileuse et corps moyen à rond. Excellente bière.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2016 Flaska 33 cl systembolaget. Grumlig mörkbrun kulör. Doft av örter, torkad frukt och knäck. Vinös på något sätt. Söt smak med rostad och kryddig touch. Russin, aprikos och lite portvin. Aningen spritig
Flaska beställd via SB. Mörkt brun med beige skum. Kraftfull doft av skumbanan, kola och karamell. Söt och kraftfull. Russin, kola, alkohol och knäck i smaken.

330ml bottle from 20 PIP Craft Pub, Prague. Hazy dark mahogany, small, tanned head that disappears quickly and completely, leaving no lacing. Sweet malty aroma, banana, dried dark fruit, mushrooms, vanilla and cloves. Soft mouthfeel, full-bodied, mildly carbonated. Powerful taste, malty and sweet fruity, banana, dried figs, raisins, peppery yeast, cloves, toffee, dark rustic bread and touch of vanilla and bourbon. Clean and warming finish.

Bottle from bierlinie in Berlin. Pours musky brown with small fast depleting Head. Head has a few fruit smells left from the aventinus left, but also a bit boozy and earthy. 
Taste is strong and bitter right from the Start, palate has chocolate and bread. High carbonation. Alcohol tends to sink to the button pretty Quick, so frequent swinging of the glass helps. Just a bit of warmth in the finish.
A bit too heavy for me, but i expected that for an Eisbock
Отлично& крепкое пиво, хороший аромат и сбаланс& вкус, очень мощно! Алкогол& 12%, но ощущает& что его меньше и пьется достато& легко, а в итоге он дает о себе знать.

Absolute rocket fuel, 12%. Really nice but so boozy. Lovely complex wheat beer taste. Powerful aftertaste. Marked down just because I can almost sense the hangover as I'm drinking it

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours dark red color. Hazy with lots of yeast flating around. Not so big head. Aromas of dark fruits, dates, porto, alcohol. Not so much banana notes inside. Flavor is also very complex. Again dark fruits, caramel , dates with some honey and banana. Full body. On sweet side. Alcoholic, of course. Overall: I am not truly fun of weizens but this one is really good. It is actually very drinkable if it is compared with wine and very carbonated , especially if you look that is cold distilled/fractionated beer. Probably they are also putting some co2 inside after cold distillation.

F: big, off-white, average lasting.
C: dark coppery, clear.
A: very sweet malty, dark canned fruits, raisins, plums, roasted malt, vanilla, overripe sweet banana, molasses, dark bread, hint of porto wine.
T: malty, wheat, plums, dark fruits, banana, vanilla, roasted tones, alcohol, molasses, yeast, cloves, oily mouthfeel, great beer, really enjoyed and worth to try, full body, lower carbonation, 0,33l bottle from Damian bottle shop in Bratislava.

Bottle. At bottle opening, a strong dried fruit, Port wine note takes the nose. Medium plus malt flavour, mostly caramel. Sweet and heavy carbonation : it will make forget 12 abv, for good and bad things....

Definately one of the best beers I've ever had. Wonderful malt profile, a belgium yeast thing going on in a german made beer. Looks beautiful, who could say anything bad? Schneider in Munich.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is malty toffee, caramel, red fruit, taste is similar, rich, biscuit, quite boozy.

33cl bottle, served in Schneider Weisse Aventinus glass. Poures mahogany reddish brown with a small one finger tan head that dissipated very quickly. Not much carbonation going on in glass, but loads of yeast flakes swimming in there. Aromas of smoke, roasted nuts, plums, dates, raisins, malts, vanilla, overripe banana. Taste: Plums, dates, overripe banana, figs, raisins, burnt toffee, caramel, marzipan, nuts, currant bread, some Portlike qualities. This reminds me very much of the Rochefort family. Very creamy, malty mouthfeel. Softly carbonated. Full body with a malty sweet and sharp alcoholic finish. My first eisbock and definitely enjoyed it. An absolutely delicious nectar!

330 ml bottle bought at Running Beers booth at HKCEC in Wan Chai during HKTDC Food Expo 2016.
Looks: Cloudy hazy murky straw brown colour with a thick layer of dark brown yeast sediments; One quarter finger head with off-white foam which lasted for 30 seconds; Fair sticky lacing and zero carbonation.

Aroma: Fragment malt, with strong wheat and tartness, strong banana, strong plums, vanilla, molasses, phenolic, cloves, spices, bread and strong yeast. 

Taste: Mid to strong sweet dark malt, with moderate roastyness, strong alcohol, liquorices, strong wheaty tartness, strong plums, banana, strong phenolic, strong caramel, strong molasses, cloves, strong spices, bread , strong yeast, lemon, quite strong bitter hops and strong grass. 

Body: Full body. Thick and slightly oily palate.

Mouth Feel: Almost Belgian-like dark maltyness in an oily background with strong wheaty tartness from its Weizenbock base. Alcohol hit fast but followed but strong plums, caramel, banana, strong cloves and strong spices. Sweetness is there but surprisingly light for the style. Even more amazing is the strong lemon and grassy hop to round. This is magical!

Boozyness: the 12% abv is undetectable in aroma, and despite a hard first impression in taste, it tends not to scream too loud and doesnt burn, but fairly warm and comfy, very easy to drink. Excellent!

Hoppiness: Spices in nose. Lemon, strong spices and strong grass in taste. Bitterness - hops and liquorices - is squite trong for an abrupt, mid astringent caramel finish.

After Taste: Quite dry. Boozy, fruity and quite bitter to mouth.

Comments: This freezed Weizenbock is a template of great Eisbock - strong but fresh dark fruity aroma, surperbly-managed and expressed alcohol, strong cloves and spicyness, and expressive lemony hops at high abv. All that comes with low sweetness and strong tart wheat. As an Eisbock and a strong beer, this is an art!
Too sweet, to winey and too high abv for me. No need to have any other drink or to go into town. This is a killer.

Bottle 330ml. Served at cellar temperature. Pours a deep, murky copper. Head is beige, average sized and mostly lasting. Aroma is of lightly toasted brown bread rolls, chocolate coated banana sweets, brandy stewed apples, dark plums, rum & raisin chocolate, cooked brown sugar and mixed spices (cloves/cinnamon). Flavour is slightly vinous with a light bitterness; lightly toasted wheat, wholemeal bread, caramelized dates, dried currants, dried pear, rum liquor chocolates, tawny port, and spices (ginger/cinnamon). Full bodied with medium carbonation,  an oily texture and a long warming finish. Deceptively well hidden ABV!

Nagy, nagyon tartós, tömör bézs hab, barna szín. Karamelles, barna sörös illat. Édes, enyhén konyakos, aszalt gyümölcsös, fügés, datolyás ízvilág. Kissé szirupos, testes sör, enyhe szénsavtartalommal és keserűvel, hosszú fűszeres, gyógyfüves lecsengéssel. Nagyon finom desszert sör.

3 vuotta vanha pullo (pullotettu 5.10.2011 ja parasta ennen 5.10.2016). Tumma, punertavanruskea olut vaahtoaa kohtalaisesti, mutta vaahto katoaa pian kokonaan. Tuoksussa kypsää banaanisuutta ja luumuisuutta, alkoholisuutta sekä rasvaista suklaisuutta. Maku samoin kypsän banaaninen ja luumuinen, hieman alkoholinen ja jouluisen mausteinen. Täyteläinen suutuntuma on öljyisen samettisen pehmeä. Hieno olut pimeisiin syys- ja talvi-iltoihin.

11.2 oz. bottle. Dark brown with a lasting light beige head. Moderate carbonation. Aroma of dark fruits, alcohol, spice, and a surprising vinous element. Taste is dark fruits, spice, clove, hints of port/red wine, caramel, faint pepper, and alcohol. Quite intriguing, but not recommended as the drink of choice on an all-night bender.
Poured a ru y red with an off white head. Aroma was of dark fruits, caramel and yeast. Flavor similar, a bit sweet and lacki g the complexity I had hoped for.

Shedding this beautiful delicacy brewing catches the eye one brown coloring coppery and opaque with a foam a cream or collar, if you like, of great consistency, lively, medium-length and slightly sedimented with tiny bubbles.
There are actually a number of carbonation above average for a beer somewhat licorosa, but not misaligns the structure of the beverage.
The aroma reveals a malt with hints of raisins or prunes perhaps a festive Christmas Eve presenting yourself to the great elixir that to come. Even the aroma could notice a caramelized malt somewhat apparent, with the wheat that appears in the background is complemented with the emergence of an alcoholic content.
As for taste, and taste, follows a great Malted liqueur. Like the TAP6 the same brewery, however there is a greater tenacity and complexity involved, where I could see the slightly toasted wheat, but is very soft and perhaps masked by alcoholic power that is in resonance with a balanced yeast. The set is sweet by juicy plums that heat and cherish our chest. Intense throughout the tasting where álccol increases its presence along the gulps generating that delicious warming.
Its medium carbonation texture, velvety and liqueur with a suitable body to the beer type generating a pleasant feeling.
The aftertaste is sweet and fruity and slightly astringent with the right presence of alcohol tone. Remember that alcohol was very well inserted in the set.
A beautiful and complex beer to taste with calm and at the right time, say below 24 degrees Celsius.
A beautiful beer that my opinion becomes a masterpiece in both quality and presentation of their content and on its label. Those you know and tasting again review it.

Barwa ciemno miedziana, bujna, kremowa piana, która jednak dość szybko opada. W aromacie nuty skórki od chleba, toffi, rodzynek, banana. W smaku rozgrzewające od alkoholu, średnie wysycenie, melanoidynowe.

Aroma has a sour cranberry charachter and some sweet cereal in the background. Appears rubyish brown with thin pinkish foam. Taste is sweet malt up front balanced by hay like euro hops and some acidic sourness. Palate is a bit syrupy, but fizziness really helps it out. Overall, very good.
Tap. Super dark brown. Really nice lingering head. Jolly rancher nose. Smooth but syrupy. Sweet malt. Nice.
Bottle. Pours ruby brown. Aroma of raisin, fruitcake, plums and sherry. Taste is rich and sweet and a little boozy. Great after dinner drink. Very enjoyable.
Výborne spravene pivko, vyváená chuť, nie príli cítiť tie grády čo to má, pri pití cítim obrovsky pôitok

Dark copper color, pillowy off-white head. Very slightly hazy but not overly noticeable. Not exactly an explosive aroma. You get some breadiness, dried fruit, and holiday fruitcake aromas, but theyre not really screaming at you. On the palate, its a totally different story. A quite explosive combination of figs, raisins, dates with a very warming and vinuous effect on the aftertaste that tells you the story of this 12% abv Eisbock. Not for the faint of heart! As the beer opened up, i got some whiffs of barbecue smoke to go along with the other sweet notes.

Aroma: alcohol is present. Yeast, fruits, spices. Some weird aromas not very pleasant i couldnt identify.
Appearance: very deep amber-brown color, cloudy, very thin white-beige head with very little retention. Lots of sediments in the bottle, its hard to keep them away from your glass. 
Taste: medium sweetness, medium sourness, medium bitterness.
Palate: creamy texture, medium-to-full body, average carbonation, long bitter and little sour and pungent finish.
Overall: not very nice appearance or aroma but very interesting mouthfeel. Surprising mix of flavors (roasted malts, caramel, frutis, spices), the warming effect of the high alcohol level is present and long. Very long bitterness and spiciness, almost pungent at finish. Not much of my favourite type of beer, but very complex ans surprising beer. Interesting.

Bottle from a store in Stuttgart, DE. Fabulous pour, dark with a two finger beige head. Plum, sourdough, wheat fruity mix. I little on the sweet side but a great balanced brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of wheat and alcohol, yeast and lacquer. Pours a muddy, hazy brown with an off-white, short head that rapidly dissipates. Big flavors of wheat and sourdough with sweet caramel notes and not unpleasant alcohol. Not subtle but pretty balanced. Fizzy mouthfeel and medium to high carbonation. Not my favorite style but its pretty impressive.

I bought this bottle at Drink of the World, Lucerne. I drank it in Bonfol. It is the same version than the Aventinus with a stronger degrees of alcohol and in my opinion even better. The taste is perfect, plum, apricot, malt, sugar, caramel, hop, well balanced and like a syrup. The body is brown and red, low-middle carbonation, white and brown foam. I love it and the best it is to drink this beer with a nice meat.
Bottle. Dark chestnut color, cloudy liquid, tan head, heavy sedimentation. Aroma of banana, orange, generally fruits, alcohol, white wine, cognac. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter. Good one.

Uma cerveja intensa: marrom, turva, com boa formação de espuma. Aroma complexo de trigo, leveduras, figo, chocolate e um toque de cravo. Na boca, é doce, frutada, encorpada, com o álcool realçando o sabor. Final levemente amargo, que persiste, e picante. Uma beleza!

Bottle. Pours is cloudy amber to brown with medium persistent beige head. Aroma is fruity, wheat, touch of yeasts, banana, peach, plum, lot of spices. Taste is medium sweet, fruity mouthfeel. Heavy body with massive malty background, alcohol warmth, spicy character, oily to creamy texture, lively carbonation, spicy aftertaste. Beautifully complex beer, awesomely ballanced.

Smell: alcohol, fusel, metallic, dark fruits, prunejuice ( i get more prunes than bananas) celery seeds, spice, sulphur, oceanic, meaty, fatty, some zesty fruits like lemon/lime, roasted nuts, overly ripe fruits (plums, apples), caramel.

Taste: alcohol, fusel, malt, malty bitterness, sweet, bitterness stays on tongue, alcoholburn. 

I think there are too many fusel oils in this beer, giving it a alcoholic "roughness". Its not a refined beer. Some more hops, both bittering and aroma, would have made it more interesting imo.

Bottle. Dark brown color, small beige head. Aroma of cloves, spices, banana, raisins, dried fruits, caramel, notes of honey, alcohol. Taste is strong malty, caramely, sweet, berries and dried fruits, banana, spices, wheat, nuts and alcohol. Nice balanced beer.good

Aromat bardzo intensywny, pszeniczny, lekkie banany, goździki, melanoidyny, tostowy, ciemne owoce, trochę perfumy, szlachetny alkohol. W smaku słodziutkie, goździkowo-bananowe, nuty tostowe, lekko karmel, lekki pieprz, likier. Piana niska, szybko się degeneruje, mały lacing. Bardzo przyjemny, rozgrzewający alkohol, świetny balans między poszczególnymi smakami, gęste. Niesamowite!

330 mml bottle tasted on the 22/05/2016. Cloudy dark brown color with a beige creamy head. Aroma of bananas, wheat, dark fruits and some caramel. Taste is sweet with caramel, banana, wheat, plums. Aftertaste has some alcohol as well. Next one please!

Aroma: wheat, light smoky, bread. Appearance: brown, hazy, white foam, does not last. Taste: medium sweet, light sour, light bitter. Palate: full body, average carb, creamy texture, astringent aftertaste.

33cl bottle. Cloudy dark brown colour with a small but lasting light brown head. Aroma of cloves/spices, yeast, alcohol, dark malt and fruits. Taste is quite boozy, yeast, banana, dark ripe fruits like cherry or plum, spicy, caramel. Smooth slick mouthfeel, warming. A little boozy but a very nice eisbock.
Bottle at home, dark brown red-ish small head. Aroma is fruity, cherry, dark fruit, smoke. Taste is the same with a pronounced flavour of dark fruit, sweet, spices. nice one

dark brown to black with medium brownish head, aroma of very ripe fruits, banana, some bubblegum, very strong aroma, hint of clove, little bit alkohol as well, taste of fruits, banana, very nice thick mouthfeel without being too heavy, spicy warmth alkoholic finish, very complex, super nice, hides thre alkohol quite well, clove all over, thick sirupy, some dried fruits in taste

Bottle shared at Gremlin. Thanks for sharing Davido! Pour looks almost like a barley wine. Big fruit forward, boozy nose with cherry, apricot and wild blackberry with lots of caramel covered banana. Spicy and peppery on the palate with average carbonation. Raisin and some dark fruit as it warms. Feels lighter as it warms. Warming finish. My first real eisbock. Good stuff.

APARIENCIA: de color marrón intenso, algunos destellos cobrizos a contraluz; corona de espuma color marfil de baja retención, de burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas que desaparece rápido.

AROMA: muy licorosa, caramelo, azúcares no procesados, frutos oscuros como hígos, dátiles, se llega a inhalar y exhalar el alcohol.

SABOR: complejo, las notas de frutos oscuros muy maduros como dátiles, hígos se combina bien con las notas de caramelo y azúcares sin procesar, además se siente el alcohol algo intenso, pero no llega a ser agresivo; el retrogusto queda un amargor ligero, seco y no astringente, sensación cálida en garganta por el alcohol.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio, carbonatación media baja.

RESUMEN: Una buena cerveza de acuerdo al estilo.

Bottle at Beer Time in Athens ( 7.20). BB 03.30.2020. Pours light brown with light beige fizzy head. Disappears rather fast. The nose is malty and hard liqueury, spiced raisins. Tastes heavy malty sweet and brown liqueur but Im not saying too boozy - the 12% is rather well disguised. Thin fizzy carbonation. Medium body. Really nice and doppelbocky - far from the other two Eisbocks Ive had. Lovely stuff, would love to have it again some time.

Bottle. Brown colored with a red hue, hazy and with a fine rocky tan head. Nice wheat aroma with banana and a spices, vanilla and glove. Light caramel notes a slight hint of pepper. Full bodied and thick with medium carbonation and a nice alcoholic warmth. Very smooth mouthfeel. Light sweet taste, dry bitter finish with spicy note. Flavor is complex, spices, banana and caramel, the pepper is growing quite strong till the end. Very well balanced flavor, distinct yet harmonic. Leaves a medium dry finish. Good and intense.

Up until the 1940s, Aventinus was shipped all over Bavaria in containers lacking temperature control. Consequently, the precious drink partially froze during transportation. Unaware that the brew was concentrated by the separation of water from the liquid. People were baffled by this unique version of Aventinus. By chance, the first Aventinus Eisbock was created.

Aromat intensywny, słodki, banany, śliwki, karmel, toffi, cynamon, rodzynki, ciemne pieczywo, alkohol. Kolor ciemnobrązowy, mętne. Piana kremowa, średniopęcherzykowa, niezbyt obfita, średnio trwała. W smaku pełne, gęste, słodkie, suszone owoce, zboże, czekolada, karmel, toffi, alkohol nie dominuje, lekko rozgrzewa. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie średnie.
Ottimissima il gusto da tutto, bella e buona il corpo e la qualita e molto ottima

My first Eisbock. Also by far the strongest beer I had until now. The experience is intense! Dark brown with little tan head. Aroma: Marzipan, clove, banana, and much more, that I have a hard time to describe. Taste: Overwhelming... Almost a little too much of everything. Sweetness was the foremost. Also a considerable amount of alcohol warmth. But less direct than this sounds.-- Comparing this directly with the Aventinus: much less hops, much more sweetness. But also the expected more of everything. Aventinus almost tastes like water compared to this :P.

Une eisbock de la catégorie weizen eisbock, dun niveau abv superbe de 12 %.
Malt dorge et de froment, refermentée.
Mon exemplaire portait la jolie date limite doctobre 2020, mais il na pu attendre  moi non plus !!
Couleur brun roux auburn à lopacité importante, avec un léger voile de levure tendre.
Bulles fines principalement en fontaine centrale vive, mais présentes partout.
Mousse beige clair, pétillante au versage, puis joli nappage très soyeux de 2 mm.
Arômes de vin rouge , fût de vin de Bourgogne, pointe de fruits rouges, levure.
1ère bouche veloutée à la superbe entame vineuse, riche, dense, complexe.
Arrière-bouche dune qualité magistrale.
2ème au sublime ensemble vin/fruits/bois.
Arrière-bouche dun vin de haut vol.
3ème à la texture magnifique, et aux superbes équilibre et harmonie.
Arrière-bouche à la grande finesse de goût, avec une densité de la texture.
Longueur au généreux développement tous azimuts : richesse, finesse, plénitude.
Jambes fines, serrées, groupées.
Levure fine, fruitée, très grande ligne.
Alcool qui fait un prodigieux travail de chef dorchestre.
Finale  comment dire  divine !!
CONCLUSION : voici un 5 incontestable pour lAllemagne et la Bavière en particulier.
Une bière purement et strictement « classique », comme les rocks classiques de radio 21 ...
Tap at Bad flash bar.Hazy brown colour with huge creamy head. Aroma of yeasts, banana. Taste of banana, yeasts, koriander,pepper,spicy,caramel sweetness. Feeling of higher % of alcohol.

caramel, bread, chocolate, leaves, banana, alcohol, brown, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter
Reddish brown with off white foam. Not much for lacing, but the legs of beer itself clings to side of glass. Dark fruit, mostly black banana, with dark cocoa and a bit of alcohol. Taste balance is toward the sweet side, and a bit of sour is present from the wheat. Sticky mouthfeel despite carbonation. Finishes bitter sweet, and lingers.

Pours cloudy brown copper with thin white head. Aroma is spices, clove, dark fruit sweet, light banana. Taste is soy sauce, umami, slight tartness, banana, slight vegetal, dark caramel, clove, fruity. Heavy body.

From a 330ml on 26/3/2016. Pours a cloudy dark brown with almost no head. The nose features caramel, dark fruit and ripe banana. In the mouth, its primarily brown sugar, sweet stewed, dried and ripe fruit (prunes, dates, banana), a good of spice, and touch of warming booze. The palate is rich and the carbonation modest. This is a nice big, sweet sipper but ilacks the depth and comlexity of the Aventinus doppelbock, which is something really special.
Reminds me of a ramped up jw Lees moonraker strawberry plum prune big boozy hit in there first of the style for me so started with the best

Bardzo obfita, kremowa piana. Średnie pęcherze. Kolor ciemnomiedziany, piwo klarowne. W aromacie melanoidynowe, lekki banan, czuć charakter pszeniczny. Wyczuwalny alkohol. Piwo bardzo treściwe. Słodycz oblepia usta. Rozgrzewający alkohol. Goryczka jest słabowyczuwalna. Średnio nagazowane. W smaku słodkie, melanoidynowe i klimaty weizena - mocno bananowe.

Ar- malt sweetness is joined by dark and red fruit, plum, hints of strawberry, and strong alcohol

Ap- dark clear Amber pour with little off white head retention. 

Flavor- similar to the nose, malt sweetness, plum and strawberry, strong alcohol, low to no hop bitterness

Mf- full bodied, almost syrupy, low carbonation

Ov- interesting beer though a bit disjointed for me. I like the subtle strawberry, but think it's a bit too hot. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

How: Bottle Appearance: unclear light brown with a msall slighty tanned head- Aroma: dried fruits, caramel, coffee, plums,brown sugar and ripe fruit. Palate: full to medium body, average to high carbonation.

Rich, malty, raisin and plum aroma with brighter spice notes from the wheat and yeast. Banana and molasses aromas also present themselves as a perfect synergy.


Fairly dark brown and just very slightly murky with an off-white head leaning toward orange.


Mouthcoating, full, dark caramel flavour with a complex and yet not overwhelming spicy character. Fleeting banana gives way to darker caramel / malt flavours on the tongue and the aftertaste is both brightly spicy and burnt sugar dark. 


Undoubtedly one of the best beers in the world.

Botella. Presencia marron con corona blanca poco persistente y con carbonatacion media. Aroma a pan dulce y cereal con intensos toque de alcohol. Sabor dulce y alcohol bien integrado con final dulce y toffe y bastante licor.
On tap: fabulous dense tan foam, slow to disappear. Wonderful nose, dense on the tongue.Really an intense experience, to savor slowly. Worth seeking in all cases. Excellent beer.
Pretty great bock. Main difference with Aventinus (Tap 6) is the high ABV, and maybe there is a little bit more character in this one. Sweet, roasted wheat malts... overall, pretty good.

Bottle, pours cloudy brown with high creamy head. Aroma of bananas, caramel, raisins, dried plums, figs, wheat, yeast and some alcohol notes. In taste high sweetness with some light alcoholy bitterness. The alcohol is burning a bit in the throat. Carbonation is very lively, a little bit too much n my opinion. All in all its a really nice surprise considering bock beer s usually completely not my style.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wheat, Weizen yeast, banana, dark fruit and liquorice.

Appearance:

Opaque dark orange/brown beer with medium yeast and with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wheat, Weizen Yeast, banana, dark fruit and liquorice.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. The German equal to the Belgian Quad. Shamefully the head lacks that amazing always being there for you when you need it of its counterpart.

Pours dark, thick, opaque, with a lovely creamy head which quickly dissipates. Aroma includes ripe bananas, prunes, dates, some spices e.g. coriander and cloves - really nice, actually! The mouthfeel is thick, almost oily, nice low carbonation, warming, slightly spicy. A very interesting experience and a delicious beer for a chilly night!

Dark brown with big white creamy head.Aroma of slight smoke, malts, bananas, wheat, fruits, spices and alcohol.Taste is similar to the aroma. Gets better when it warms. Rich mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Sweet beer for slow drinking and dark evenings, Excellent!

330ml bottle at Hair Of The Hog, Bangkok. In a dark bar appears to pour black with a dissipating head. Aroma of smoke with toffee, dried fruit and bubblegum. Intense mouthfeel, sweet finish. Had one of these years ago and found my first one in Asia. Great stuff.
Bought months ago from Alko bb2019.08.20. Dark brown with some white head. Some nutty, toffee, yeasty, wheaty. Sweetness with some alcohol.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Dieses wahrhaft extrem komplexe Bier, braucht sich definitiv nicht hinter den abgefahrensten Extrembieren der jungen wilden Craftbierbrauern zu verstecken. Meine Flasche (Ostergeschenk von meinem Baby <3) habe ich schon einige Jahre gelagert. Kräftige Aromen jeglicher Schattierung von Duft der Wildkirsche, Marzipan, Süssholz etc. treffen auf einen mächtig satten & vollmundigen Geschmack mit einem sehr sehr langen wundervoll komplexen Nachhall, der mit steigender Temperatur von Schluck zu Schluck noch einzigartigen Veränderungen unterlegen ist. DER WAHNSINN IN FLASCHEN!!!!!!
Bottle from beers of Europe. Dark brown colour with a thin tan head. Aroma has sweet caramel and dried fruit. Taste is fresh fruit, with an alcohol warmth.
This beer was the beginning of my love with the Eisbock style. I find it one of the best examples of how a good beer should taste like!

Oh boy, the old beeswax about by mistake the beer got frozen. See Kulmbacher Eisbock, et. al., for more of this. Anyway, I do prefer the Kulmbacher version to this one, which suffers from a bit more heat from the alcohol and a slight and unwanted taste of cloves. The Kulmbacher is a barley brew and the Schneider is a weisse, probably accounting for its mild deficiencies in the strong beer category. From our flowery friends at BA, I offer another expert judgement:

 Caramel sweetbuns with toffee topping mixed with alcohol spice/fruit cake makes a medium strength and very alluring aroma.

Bright taste with all the elements of the aroma present. Some nice fruitiness mixes in as well, at times I get prune, plum, cherry, dates, as well as some really pleasant herbal bitter teases that tie it all together. So sweet.

Bottle, 33 cl. Dark brown body with a low brown head. Aroma with some caramel sweetness and dry fruit. Rich flavors, however, with ripe fruit and some yeast. Slightly boozy. Moderate/heavy sweetness with light bitterness. Medium body with average carbonation. Smooth and tasty. Really nice.

Donker bier met crèmekleurige schuimkraag die onmiddellijk wegebt. Aroma van mout, (donkere) chocolade, noten, maar ook licht fruitige geuren van o.a. rode druiven, zelfs een beetje banaan. Diepe volle smaak. Het is net alsof je rode wijn zit te drinken met de smaak van bier. Heel complex. Hout, licht rokerig, pruimen, kruiden. Zeer warme afdronk. Van dit bier wordt je warm vanbinnen. Dit bier kan zelfs concurreren met bvb de Rochefort of de Westvleteren. Topklasse.

33 cl, bottled. Pours brown with a decent head. Aroma: Strong wheat, malt, smoked wood. Vinegar. Interesting tones, vinous characters. Taste: Malt, strong sweet, alcohol. Spiciness. Salt. Vinegar notes. Interesting notes, sipper, sure. Palate: Medium body, notable peppery, alcohol. Leather. Sweet, alcohol. No matter how much I wanted to like this, to be honest, not a big fan for style, like the acidity, tho.

Brunatne, pod światło rubinowe piwo o słabej pianie, która dość szybko redukuje się do zera. Aromat intensywny, owocowy, czerwone wino, likier wiśniowy. W smaku lekko słodkie, mocne wino coś w stylu Porto, szlachetny alkohol, lekko cierpkie. Goryczka średnia w stronę wysokiej, lekko alkoholowa, rozgrzewająca w przełyku. Ogólnie piwo z gatunku wybitnych, bardzo ułożone, bogactwo smaku i aromatu.

Wow. Sweet and complex flavor. Bubble gum, fruits and sweet malty flavor a. Definitely can taste the alcohol here. Excellent 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Od razu uderzają karmelizowane i szuszone owoce. Słodki banan, rodzynki, suszone morele, likierowość, wszechobecna słodycz, a na koncu troche leciutki alkohol, takze potencjał do leżakowania jest. Piwo jest ciemnobursztynowe, mętne, pozbawione piany, wysokie wysycenie. Smak powiela aromat, jednak tylko na poczatku, od razu potem wchodzi całkiem spora goryczka i posmak wysokoprocentowego słodkiego alkoholu (cos na bazie rodzynek, moreli).Posmak mogłby być ciut lepszy, za bardzo daje po sobie znac ta goryczką, dopełniona wysokim lekko szczypiącym wysyceniem Mimo wszystko bardzo pijalne, nawet dobrze zbalansowane.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Den Rock Liquor Mart. Aroma is sweet bready malt with dark fruits, wheat, esters, alcohol. Appearance is hazy dark brown, between iced tea and cola. Small, 1/2-finger width noisy, foamy, off-white head with poor retention, no lacing, no sparkle. Taste is sweet malts and fruits, strong alcohol and late toffee. Palate is full bodied with thick texture, late lively carbonation and dry finish. Overall, the strong fruity/ester sweetness is a bit cloying for me--not a knock on the beer but likely more about the whole style. Still good overall and Im glad I tasted the gold standard for the style.

the aroma is fruity and caramel with hints of dried banana, figs, toffee, sweet red wine, bisquit and candy... the taste is fruity and creamy with notes of dried apple, figs, port, bisquit, toffee and some spices... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...

Pours dark with an aggressive head, which quite quickly settles. Strong coffee aroma and roasted malts. A hint of plumbs and some sweet honey notes in the aroma as well. Strong sweet first impression, followed by a very strong and with a more aggressive CO2 level pronounced roasted feel. Full mouth taste. An excellent body, which gives way to a slightly bitter finish through roastiness. The feeling you are left with when drinking this beer is... Being full :)

Murky dark brown color with creamy, beige head. Aroma is yeasty with lots of dark fruit character. You still get some of the wheat beer components like banana and clove but also the dried fruits like raisins and dates. Taste starts sweet and slightly boozy with lots of yeast esters. There is some bitterness on the finish and continues in the aftertaste but mostly its a sweet, syrupy beer. Body is heavy and quite smooth, with a good amount of carbonation. The alcohol level plus the intense yeast character make the beer feel a bit cloying but overall its a nice, complex tasting beer.

Powerful dried banana in aroma with some sweet sourness and caramel. Sweet dark dried fruits in taste with a touch of alcohol. In some aspects similar to St. Bernardus 12 and Rochefort 10 in taste. Good beer as digestive.
Солод, банан, карамел& специи (гвозди почти без горечи, алкогол& не чувству&

Licorice, rye, Christmasy boogie. Dark atmosphere. Thick body. Luscious. After careful sipping the bottom yeast is poured in and the whole shebang intensifies. Which is nice. Too strong for me. Im weak. Still awesome.

Served in teku. Bottled in October 2012. Pours with beige and rocky head, which very quickly reduces to tiny layer. Colour is very intense, dark ruby, very clear. Delicious aroma, lots of dried fruits, raisins, cherry, vanilla, toffe, dark chocolate and hints of woodiness as well as sourness (grapes). Very pleasant and encouraging. Before taste, you feel the power of this beer, its not alcoholic but very heavy. Taste is not disappointing, full of sweet maltiness, cherry, distinct bitterness and very long finish. Its really sticky as well. Great beer, very complex and uncompromising.

Bottle to wine glass. Dark brown coke color. Small foamy head dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is sweetness malt and clove and raisins. Sweetness, yeast, raisin, alcohol with pleasant bite. Sticky but smooth. Medium carbonation that dissappears. Chunky yeast sediment in bottle. A nice change of pace.

Mestadels små bubblor, Beize skumkrona väldigt mörk siraps/amber färg. Söt doft av olika torkade bär såsom plommon, russin m.m. Söt, seg sirapsaktig smak med lite knäck & kola, även här torkade bär, enkel ton av kaffe i eftersmak.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
