Bottle. Pours ruby brown with a very thin head. Aromas of dark fruit, raisin, clove, brown sugar, coffee. Flavors are sweet and fruity. Definite presence of German ale yeast. Raisin, plum, coffee, spice...hint of dark chocolate...vanilla...vinous tones...very complex flavors. Notable roasty bitterness and booziness. Sticky mouthfeel. Very nice.

Bottle. Pours copper with whiteish-beige head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet, bananas, wheat. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, wheat. Finish is dry bitter with warming alcohol. Overall: very good brew.

Red tinged brown beer, big white head. Nose is wheaty and bready, sweet, dark fruity. Flavor is banana, wheat, fruit notes, caramel. Finishes with a slight bitterness and creamy fruityness, lingering plums, sticky and wheaty sweetness.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2016 Dark fruit smell...OK strength appearance is mix of red and dark dark brown, taste is wonderful! The dark fruits are complex and ubiquitous... Hint of smoky sweetness and a good feeling alcohol burn...strong but smooth...
Pours a rich hazy brown from a bottle. Boozy caramel aroma, peppery caramel flavor, wheatiness too, like a sweet loaf of homemade whole wheat bread, lots of sweetness and spice. Very good beer.

9-1-2016-0,33L-Flasche. Dunkelbraun, leicht trüb, beiger Schaum.
Aroma Hefe, Malz, Alkohol, vergorene Früchte. Antrunk Trockenpflaume, Karamell, Honig, gegen Ende wärmend alkoholisch.

Magnifique couleur brune caramel, fine mousse beige. Nez complexe sur la levure (banane), les fruits confits, lalcool. La bouche est remarquable et complexe, banane, pain frais, marron, fruits secs, lalcool est très présent mais toujours bien balancé. La longueur est fabuleuse, le corps rond, liquoreux, bière un peu sucrée, très peu damertume, la carbo très faible (probablement du à la congélation). Un régal, plutôt à reserver en fin de repas.

Bottle from Elysium. Aroma: Heavy, sweet, fruity, dried plum, raisins, caramel, plum jam, white grapes, fruit liqueur, could be more intensive. Appearance: Color is deep copper, head is dense, medium-high, dissapears after some time. Taste: Very sweet, toasty, syrupy, fruity, dried plums, caramel, dried fanny, grapes, alcohol well hidden but feelable, with time it gets more weizen like - more wheat tastes, some cloves. Palate: Finish is light alcohol warming, quite oily texture but the body is not totally full, finish is sweet.

Dark brown colored, medium- beige head, nice lasting. Aroma is fruity raisins, banana, quite caramelish, bit toast, sugary, cloves and a touch of alcohol. Taste is very sweet caramel and sugary, wheat, some toasted notes, banana, raisins, clove, herbal notes, low bitterness, sweet finish, alcohol and boozy warmth. Full bodied, thick and syrupy, flat carbonation. A bit too sweet and boozy, a bit cloying as well.

From bottle. Dark brown color with red notes and beige head. Malty and light yeasty aroma, caramel, bread, dark dried fruits, banana, light spicy, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Pours a weird color with white head. Intense and complex as promised on the bottle

Bottle from Beer:Shop St Albans. Very dark brown, off white head, which dissipates to nothing after a minute. Nose is big. Big malty, liquorice, clove, cinnamon, lots of dried fruit, dried figs, toasted malt grain, rye bread, toasted bread, caramel, big alcohol . Taste is liquorice, yeast extract, clove, cinnamon, rye bread, toast, raisins, Christmas cake, spicy, caramel. At the back theres a lot of fruit. Ripe banana, raisins, sultanas, dried fig. Its big and bold. Underneath theres the subtle characteristics of a wheat beer with banana, lemon, bread, but on top theres layers of spice and dried fruit. Shading into slightly cloying for my palate, but its not too heavy.

From a metric 12 Oz bottle into a weizen glass. Pours a purple brown. Lots of sediment. No head but bubbly lacing. Shoe leather and deeeeeply data fruit and cognac. Mouthfeel is light and slightly different. suppose its from the lager yeast but Im not a huge fan. Taste is fantastic. Dark smokey Pete. Fruit and leather flavors. A real treat.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka 0,33l Kolor brązowy,mętnawy, piana solidna jednak zanika po długim czasie. Aromat suszonych śliwek i innych owoców, skórki chleba. W smaku suszone owoce z kompotu wigilijnego, słodkie a mocnym alko w tle. Oleiste w pełni zbalansowane, super piwo. Jest to ocena druga, zdecydowanie bardziej pozytywna.
Aroma dulce, caramelo. Apariencia oscura, espuma persistente, no muy abundante. Sabor a frutos rojos, cítrico, dulce, alcohol. Fácil de beber. Persistente alcohol.

Attention : énormément de dépôt !
Une bonne bouteille à faire vieillir.
Le nez est assez fumé, beaucoup dalcool, presque une Doppelbock. Des notes perceptibles de banane comme la Tap 6.
La bouche est bien plus complexe (à laisser reposer une dizaine de minutes). On a du fumé, du sirop dérable, un fond assez vieilli, assez noble de type armagnac. Un peu de fruits rouges confits. Une longueur banane très concrète.
Un peu trop dalcool doù un intérêt pour un vieillissement en cave.

0,33 l Flasche. Aroma: Alkoholisch, vergorene dunkle, rote Früchte und Banane. Erscheinung: Dunkelbraunes, trübes Bier, cremefarbener, cremiger, flacher Schaum, keine Gardine. Geschmack: Stark nach Alkohol, rote Früchte und Banane, malzig süß, gleichzeitig eine gewisse Säure. Nachgeschmack: leicht scharf wie ein Schnaps, weich, schaumig am Gaumen. Gesamt: Gutes Bier, aber sicherlich nichts für den Alltag.

From small bottle. Rich cloudy mahogany color with small head. Strong intense and dense flavors of dark fruits, wine, and alcohol which crowd out the wheat but not completely. If you like really strong beers, this is very tasty and drinkable.
Cloudy, hazelnut brown colour, small white head. Honey-caramel aroma. Impressive taste with hints of almond, dark chocolate and banana. Long-lasting bitter-sweet and roasty palate. Brilliant!

Deep brown, hazy, moderate airy head. Retention below avarage. Lacing present. Dense aroma of syrup, dry fruit, prune, port wine, some yeast, wheat. Full body. Thick palate. Soft carbo. Sweet taste with notes of port wine, prune, spicy yeast, roasted malts, light hop bitterness. Very boozy. Nevertheless alcohol not really accented. Its a great experiance still the regular Aventinus is better.
Aroma is banana, spices, clove, bread and alcohol. Taste is moderate sweet, light bitter, spicy and malty flavor, also some harsh alcohol.
Flaske. farven er mørkebrun og skumkrone er der ikke meget af. Den er i hvert fald hurtig væk. Aromaen er malt og rom, og smagen er karamel, rom og mørk chokolade.

Bottle, 33 cl. Dark brown body with no head. Very little aroma except for some caramel sweetness. Rich flavours, however, with ripe fruit and some yeast. Slightly boozy. Moderate/heavy sweetness with light bitterness. Medium body with average carbonation. Smooth and tasty. This is the first eisbock I have had, and it makes me want more to explore this style.

Had this one years ago. Now again to be rated. Poured it into Snifter, it poured a light Brown beer with off white head. No lacing and quickly vanishing head. Nose is yeasty with some banana and wood hints. Taste... Oh well comes in pretty hard astringent alcoholic raisin. Finish is more floral. The alcohol however has some bite definitely no everyday drink. Might be a very good beer but not much of my Type.

Bottle  pours amber brown with off-white head. Aroma and taste comprises dark dried fruit with plum and raisin prominence, sweet bready malts, caramel, some notes of banana, some subtle spices into the finish.
Oe oe oe oe oe oe a a a a a a-pezoet bananenbier!! Backlog from 2014/11/28.

Pours brown, little bit hazy. Medium, long lasting head. Aroma is fruity, mostly bananas, nice. Very smooth, low carbonated beer. When it comes to taste, at first you can feel banana sweetnes, then a little bit of alcohol but also pleasant. At the end theres something like bread and very nice medium bitterness, mostly alcoholic but enjoyable anyway. Aftertaste lasts quite long.
Bottle at Barley Wine (CPH), Strong and long taste. Penetrating taste of wheat .Notes of caramel.

Flaska från @thaalcoholic, som vanligt, tack! Dimmig rödbrun vätska med beiget skum. Doftar fruktigt tungt. Härligt tung fruktig smak med en känsla av alkohol... Har bara druckit en Eisbock tidigare och den här spöar den med hästlängder. God!

Wonderful, bold, complex, best Eisbock Ive tried. Seriously spirited fruitcake in a bottle with consistent hints of the 12% ABV throughout. Other Eisbock beers have a 1980s deja vu Löwenbräu Dark taste, but not this one. The character is all its own. Formidable Eisbock does the tradition well.

Aroma: dried fruits, banana, molasses, caramel, bubblegum, bread, malty. 
Taste: medium sweet, fruity, plum, caramel, malty, herbal, banana, bubblegum, bread.
A bit too fizzy.

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 5th May 2020. Using Tap 6 as its base is a very good start. It poured a dark brown colour with a reddish/purple tint. There was barely any head other than a thin tan coloured layer and not much lacing. Aromas were of sweet plum, grape, bubblegum, caramel with some light booze. Taste was dark fruits, grape, plum, prune, bubblegum and syrup. Mid to full bodied with high carbonation. Overall, this was my first Eisbock and a very good one at that. Considering its 12% ABV, although there was a small amount of alcohol in the nose, there was none in the taste. Very easy to drink and wish I had a few more bottles on hand now to age.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2015 Warka 19/01/2020. W aromacie dominuje wędzona śliwka przywodząca skojarzenie z Westvleterenem 12. W smaku podobieństwo jest jeszcze większe. Jest wyrafinowana słodycz z goryczką ukrytą pod niemałą mocą. Jest gęstość, chociaż może nie aż taka jakiej się spodziewałem czytając opisy degustacji tego piwa. Jest wrażenie jakbym nie pił piwa tylko zupełnie nowy gatunek alkoholu. I jest satysfakcja z Michaela Jacksona, którego dostanę po dodaniu tego wpisu. Bardzo dobre piwo.
P.S. Jest też pewien niedosyt (czy niedobór) w posmaku jakby czegoś tutaj, na samym końcu, zabrakło.

Bottle poured into a tulip glass..burgundy with a
fluffy off-white head..Aroma of dark fruits,malts,
bread..tastes of raisins,figs,bread,toffee..not too
boozy..definitely a sipper..my first Eisbock and
hopefully not my last.

Bottle. Brownish hazy color with thun unsteady head. Aroma is very rich: caramel, banana, dry fruits. Taste is also complex, with alcoholic notes, but rather well hidden. Bitter-sweet. Finish is long. Legendary beer. Must try.
Great aromas and Flavors of plum, sweet bread, heavy malt and booze. Weighty palate with a nice smooth character and dark mahogany color. A definite sipper.

Bottle courtesy of McTapps.

Muddy brown beer with no head to speak of. Nose is huge and hard-hitting with big, ripe grape character. The taste is well balanced bitter and sweet, erring towards sweet, with loads of coffee and chocolate as well as light date and raisin flavours. Very very drinkable for the ABV, but still too strong-tasting to be a total winner for me.
Bottle, 33cl. Opaque brownish with a minimal head. Malty, alcohol aroma. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Sweet and surprisingly not bitter. Earthy and malty with a rich alcohol finish.

Bottle, 330ml. A dark brown beer with a small white head that fades away quickly. Fruity aroma of roasted malt, spices, wood and alcohol. Taste is bittersweet with an alcoholic finish. Some carbonation and astringency. Medium bodied with a strong sweet aftertaste of alcohol and whiskey or bourbon.
Kräftig dunkle Farbe schöner Schaum, Geruch malzig mit rum Note, Geschmack sehr intensiv ganz dunkler Karamell rum dunkle Schokolade

Bottle.

A: Very cloudy mahogany color with a foaming creme color head thats a full inch thick. Lacing.

N: Hefty clove and banana. Toffee and wheat. Black peppercorn and earth. Lots of bread, from a hearty rye to a bit of pumpernickel. Raisin and prune, hint of fig. Some peat moss and black olive far underneath. 

T: Quite sweet and heartily bitter. Carbs in a glass. 

M: Noticeable alcohol, medium creamy body propped up by prickly carbonation. 

O: A hearty brew for a cold winters eve. Makes me think of Belgian quads just as much as German doppelbocks. A definite sipper, but a delight and a beer I would definitely go back to as the weather provides a chill.

Thick, dense from yeast, dark cola color, stable head. Nice. A: strong bubblegum and vanilla aroma, burnt malts, coffee, prune, grass, licorice. T: deep licorice taste with mocha hint. Development: bit boozy, tingling, towards cough syrup. Aftertaste is burnt malts, coffee, sticky. Very heavy.
I guess Ive never had this. Sludgy brown, with huge raisin and dark fruit aroma. Caramel, clove, vanilla - quite nice, but a lot of alcohol heat. Good stuff.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is wheat, slight yeast, banana, clove, dark fruit. Appearance is brown, light brown head. Taste is very much like a trippel, with some dark fruit along with banana and clove. Disappointing. Mouthfeel is medium body, medium carbonation. Overall, this is quite disappointing.

Appearance: hazy dark brown with small beige head.
Aroma: hops, roasted malt.
Taste: bittersweet.
Palate: smooth, medium body, low carbonation.
Overall: nice.

Butelka do 2018. Piwo bursztynowe zmetnione bez jakiejkolwiek piany. W aromacie slodkie suszone owoce zalane spirytusem i troche melanoidyn po ogrzaniu. W smak polslodkie z wyczuwalnym alkoholem. Piwo jak na 12% alko wodniste spodziewalem sie slodkiego melanoidynowego ulepku a wyszlo jak podwojny kozlak z dolanym spirytusem. Sadze ze dluzsze lezakowanie w niskiej temperaturze pomogloby temu piwu. Na razie jest srednio. Troszke podwyzszylem ogolne noty za brak odniesienia.

Bottle 33cl. Hazy brown, syruppy liquid with a fluffy off white head. Aroma is very special: malts, wood(?), walnuts, fruit? Nice! The taste is lovely: mild sweetness with touches of bitterness, fruits and malts. The aftertaste stays long and the glow of alcohol comes much later.
pours dark, cloudy brown. virtually no head. aroma is sweet, vanilla, marcipan. complex. taste is also sweet, marcipan, complex. full body.

It smells wonderful of port and has plenty of ripe fruit in the aroma. The taste explodes with banana, vanilla, lots of candy and ripe plums. It is definitely a winter beer, its heavy, rich and alcohol strong and should be enjoyed temperate at a time when you have plenty of time available. Only a few imperial stouts and barley wine can surpass this amazing eisbock.

0,33 l Flasche im Bräuhaus. Rum und Malz in der Nase. Überraschend frischer Duft für ein Bier mit 12%! Antrunk kräftiges Rum Aroma, Rosinen und Kakao. Dunkelbraune Farbe mit sehr cremigem Schaum. Die Könsistenz ist sehr dickflüssig. Abgang Vanille, Kakao, kaum bitter. Wirklich exzellenter Eisbock!
Gift from Carlos. In Ikeas pint glass. Playing Bardbarian. Spectacular. Really nice caramel sweetness. Not a sugary sweetness like in some belgians. Its high ABV doesnt bother at all.

11.2-oz. bottle. Rich plum and fig jump out immediately, creating a heavy bouquet. Spoiled banana esters, clove, yeasty dough, fresh pear, cinnamon raisin, and a trace of black pepper also waft up from the soap-suds-like head that tops the murky purplish-brown liquid. A boozy raisin flavor rushes hard over the palate before a spicy herbal tone pops up to alleviate the richness. A bit of botanical blend joins complex notes of prunes and woody pear. The heat (from both the alcohol and the spiciness) complements the sweet fruity flavors well, but the burn becomes a tad too dominant after a while. Lively carbonation keeps the slick mouthfeel dancing over the taste buds before a peppery dry finish brings it all to a halt. A nice sipper, but the alcohol burn, while expected, keeps it from maximum enjoyment.

Marrom escura, espuma bege de média formação e pouca persistência. Aroma lembra groselha, uva passa, cereja, licor de morango, álcool perceptível. Paladar segue bastante as impressões iniciais do aroma, bastante malte de média torrefação, novamente uvas e morango, dulçor intenso e amargor proveniente do malte torrado. Corpo licoroso, baixa carbonatação. Aftertaste de longa duração, dulçor persistente, álcool bastante presente que depois de um tempo acaba atrapalhando a percepção do sabor, mas por estar dentro do estilo, não considerei como um defeito. Muito boa !

Pours thick muddy brown, as with regular wheat beer it has a lot of yeast sediment, swirled this and added t glass. Aromas and taste of deep, dark fruits. A fair bit of alcohol burn to this but is to be expected, Soft, sweet slightly dry finish. Nice beer!!

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2015 Small beige head with low retention. Clean reddish brown colour. Aroma is dark dried fruits, prune, spicy and caramel. Taste is complex, sweet, spicy (clove), prune, fruity and alcohol. Medium sticky palate.
Bottle shared. Wow this is mindblowing, so deep and complex, tons of raisin, toffee and tart, thick mouthfeel, warming boozy notes. Outstanding, to be sipped and enjoyed slowly.

Bottle from grove , huddesfield. Deep copper with off white head. Aroma is plummy and rich on the nose. Taste is sweet and rich, a dull alcohol zest. Alcohol hum and tingly carbonation and medium body. First eisbock. Good stuff.
.......pite 24.09.2015. Nie Muj styl. Bardzie wino lub winiak. Wyra?nie czu? alkochol  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Adquirida en botella de 330 ml. en Whole Foods, LES, New York. Estupenda weisse que a pesar de su alto contenido alcoholico es muy fácil de tomar. Su aspecto entre marrón y rojizo, su espuma casi beige, su aroma complejo completan un combo irresistible.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Willows Market in Menlo Park, CA. Nice maltiness with a clean finish. The apple juice concentrate of beers.

Bottle. Pours reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is of caramel, dark fruit, wheat, and alcohol. Taste is of dark fruit, caramel, sugar, and wheat. Has a very sweet taste to it. Lingering taste of dark fruit and grass. The alcohol is there, and it provides a nice warming effect. The mouthfeel is almost syrupy, and very sticky. Body is medium, and very carbonated. Its not bad at all, its just not really my thing. Dont think I would drink it again.
Trübes dunkelbraun mit wenig Schaum. Fruchtig, reife Pflaumen, Banane, malzig, stark, langer Abgang.

Hazy, deep, reddish brown with a healthy beige head. Aromas of toffee and butterscotch. Very rich taste, with flavours of toffee, wheat beer, ripe banana, marzipan and wood. High alcohol which gives this this beer a strong backbone, without overwhelming the balance of the taste. Really delicious and highly drinkable.

Quite an experience. Deep red brown with a small beige head and soft prickly carbonation. It has a sticky rich sirup texture. The alcohol is obviously there but not too dominant in the flavor. Taste is sweet toffee, cherries, dried fruits, marzipan. Could easily serve this instead of a desert wine.

Schneider Weisse Aventinus Eisbock. Espetáculo de cerveja! Caramelo, ameixas secas, álcool perceptivo, aquecendo o paladar. Hoje o sábado foi pra provar que as cervejas alemãs, mesmo as tradicionais, estão bem longe do perfil "engessado" que tentam atribuir. Espetacular. Ein Prosit!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cerveja com espuma de boa persistência. Coloração escura, turva. Altamente alcoolica, bem encorpada e cremosa. Aroma de caramelo, cravo, bem arredondados e alcool (superior) forte. Paladar bastante arredondado e suave. Paladar final amadeirado.

Bottle BBE: 05.03.2020. Cellar temp. Pours a deep, dark, hazelnut brown with minimal head. High intensity nose, with prominent candy banana, glace cherry, clementine, durian and sweet sherry. Ripe red fruits dominate the taste buds, with a high-medium sweetness and a tart sharpness the earliest sensations on the tongue. A light-medium dry bitterness eventually settles. Full-bodied with a syrupy texture, the carbonation is medium, and the finish alcoholic. This is a beast, but the concentration of Aventinus slightly detracts, rather than enhances the beer

Piana kremowa, obfita. Opada bez śladów na szkle.
W aromacie intensywne owoce. Lekka winna nuta, trochę alkoholu. 
W aromacie przypomina winiak. W smaku tez podobnie. 
W smaku kwaskowe z wyraźną goryczką. Trochę wychodzi pszenica. Nuty rodzynkowe, likierowe. Trochę suszonych śliwek. 
Alkohol dobrze zamaskowany, ale mocno grzeje w przełyku.
Piwo złożone w aromacie i smaku. Bardzo dobre. Piwo dość gęste, mocne i aromatyczne.

In bottiglia a circa 3 anni dallimbottigliamento. Colore marrone scuro, quasi nero con velature rossastre, schiuma poco persistente. Aroma di frutta secca, fichi, nocciola, frutta sotto spirito. Al palato molto corposa, frutta secca, datteri, fichi, nota etilica ancora un pò pungente. Finale intenso fruttato, lieve tostato e cioccolato.

Bottle. Pours murky dark amber with large foamy off-white head, sweetish caramel aroma, high carbonation, sweet toffee-caramel taste with fruity undertones, full body, long caramel finish. Very flavorful and satisfying.

Very dark brown pour with a large (though quickly disappearing) beige head. Classic Eisbock with some stronger stickier dark fruits. Prune danish. Candied black cherry puree. Chocolate liquorice. Pretty good

Bottle from Fresh Fields Market, Croydon, it pours dark mahogany brown with a quickly dissipating beige head. The nose is rich, bitter - sweet, caramel, plenty of dried fruits, date, fruit cake, glacé cherry, rich spice, brown sugar, earth and brandy. The taste is rich, bitter - sweet, so much dried fruits, raisin, dried cherry, fruit cake, light spice, good alcohol boost, cherry cola, chewy malt, caramel, earth and toast with warming, woody finish. Medium - full body and moderate carbonation. Quite the beverage. Strong and revitalising!

Aroma: clove, banana, alcohol, bread, 
Appearance: clear dark amber, tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, alcohol, caramel, vanilla
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent, glad I finally got to try this one

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 30.03.2020 Pours deep cloudy dark red to brown liquid, minimal frothy tan head, Aroma: candied fruits, griotte cherries, banana, warming alcohol, Taste: heavy sweet, light bitter, light sour, fruity, griotte cherries, citrus, lemon grass, malty, brown sugar, Palate: full body, oily texture, soft to average carbonation, long sweet banana alcohol finish, Overall: very good fruity, cherries, banana, alcohol, brown sugar, enjoyed, bit too sweet and alcoholic but enjoyable.

0,33 Flasche vom E-Center Stengel. Karamell-Kastanien-farbend, ölig, kaum Kohlensäure, wunderschöner Schaum. Riecht nach Marzipan, Nelken, malzig, Aroma Explosion! Schmeckt nach Marzipan, Nelken, Kaffee, Röstmalz, Feigen, auch hier eine Aroma Explosion. Im Aftertaste würzig-hopig, leicht bitter und sehr wärmend am Gaumen, Wow!

Pours a thick, dark, cloudy brown with no head. Aromas of banana, raisins, alcohol, fruitcake and honey. Flavours bring banana, caramel, alcohol, molasses, and raisins. Hints of smoke in the late palate. Thick bodied with a light carbonation that occasionally pokes the tongue. Sweet, fruit cake finish.

Appearance:
brown with a frothy, brown foam
Aroma:
caramel, banana, clove, raisin, plum
Taste:
heavy cloying sweetness, caramel, alcohol, banana, clove, raisin, plum
Palate:
full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle. Pours a dark hazy ruby red with a mostly fading off white bubble head. Aroma of red fruits, berries, woody, caramel, cookie dough. Taste is of caramel, berries, red grapes, treacle. Medium to hard carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Great beer.

Pours clear dark brown with big off-white rocky head. Aroma is heavy malty with notes of caramel, cookie, milk chocotale and bread. Light hoppy aroma, heavy yeast aroma with notes of dough, soap and broth. Notes of alcohol, peach, toffee and maple syrup. Heavy sweet, moderate bitter with long finish. Moderate acidic. Somewhat (dried) fruity notes. Body is full, palate is creamy, carbonation is lively, light astringent, moderate to heavy alcoholic finish feel.
Very similar to Aventinus but less head. Banana clove wheat and malts. Warming alcohol. Fig and raisin. The malty mixture and booze are strong with this one. Badass.
Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with no head. Nose and taste is banana, burnt caramel and brown sugar. Lots of alcohol. Good.

Cloudy, light brown color. Large spots for lace. Moderate head. 

Smells of banana, clove and semisweet chocolate. 

Lots of wheat on the tongue. Some sweet bread flavor as well. Strong banana in the swallow. A slightly sweet aftertaste. Good body with a high carbonation level. Very smooth.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 Cloudy brown liquid with yellowish head. Aroma: alcohol, caramel, banana. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, banana, burnt caramel, bread. Palate: full body, creamy feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Bottle. Pours brown with small beige head. Aroma is full of nitro solvent, malty, sweet notes, caramel, alcohol, banana, wheat, fruity. Taste is heavy sweet, burnt caramel, slight roast, bread, banana, fruity, alchohol. Medium to full body. Sweet finish.

[2013] 500ml bottle. Murky mahogany with a thin foamy beige head. Flavors are bread, plums, banana, raisins, caramel and chocolate with spicy and port notes. Alcohol is well hidden. Full body, soft carbonation, liquorous texture.
Bottle. Pours a dark ruby color. Aroma and taste are largely dark fruits and some booze.

The best German beer Ive tried. Body, mouth and evolution in the glass. With graduation powerful but very well treated. With very little carbonation. A bottle of 0,33l, better than a 0.5. One of the things I show that Im facing a beer honest, coherent, well worked .... just opening it; Remove the plate beers universe opens to a fantastic world of wonderful sensations.

From Austria, Stiegl factory pub. BBE 2019 Pours mahogany hazy with nice white head. Aroma of plums, chocolate, cloves. Full bodied, thick creamy-sticky brew with medium carbonation. Very complex. Perfectly balanced. My first Eisbock. Second bottle will be put on hold.

On tap at Madriz Hop Republic. Soft weizen nose with some sweet fruity hints, elegant. Weizen flavor, tasty, soft and sweet, good acidity. Is like a silky version of the weizen bock but at 12%!!. Will have another...

Eisbock apresentou líquido turvo,licoroso,coloração acobreada,creme bege inicial alto e volumoso,mas que não se mantem;aroma é o seu ponto forte,aparecendo banana,cravo,passas,ameixa,caramelo;álcool já notado;sabor frutado,adocicado e alcoólico,encorpado,boa carbonatação,retrogosto seco e final "quente"provocado pelo excesso de álcool,o que prejudicou sua "drinkability".Cerveja com personalidade para se tomar lenta e calmamente.

Bottle from Drinks of the World. Pours hazy brown with a medium head. Boozy nose, but in a rather exciting way. Some wheat too. Sweet taste, still boozy, but I dont mind, since it fits with the rest of the beer: Lots of fruits, heavy but not too much, fizzy carbonization.

duft:lidt karamle malt. svag krydret 
smag. karamel banan, meget krydret. stor fylde. lidt varm alkohol eftersmag

Marrón tirando a borgoña, con abundante espuma que rápidamente desaparece dejando un cordón. Aroma a hierbas medicinales, y ligero plátano. Algo de alcohol también. Mucho cuerpo y carbonización media. Muy suave y cremosa de textura. Al principio malta, y luego van apareciendo sirope, miel, y recuerdos de frutas tropicales. Y seguro que mucho más (hay sue repetir). Muy compleja. ¿Y el alcohol? Está, no hay duda, calentando todo el conjunto Muy buena.

.33l pour from refrigerated bottle into a stemmed tulip. Deep brown and nearly totally opaque with a tiny bubby off-white head. Nose is forward-- a little sour smell, a little earthy. Gives a good indication of what to expect. Similar to a sour brown ale. A sour front gives way to a full dark malty body. A little nutty earthiness and then a sour finish. Dark fruit (some plum and lots of raisin) throughout. Not as puckering as most dedicated sours, but way more than your average dark beer. I like it. It feels like there are a lot of flavor levels to pull out. Definitely worth trying.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with beige head. Wood, malt, roasted aroma. Sweet, wood, chocolate, matl, roasted, fruity taste, alcohol warmth. Medium to full body.

S:
very similar to the Tap6 with dark fruits coming through more
T:
-plums,raisins,dates come through heavy
-slight notes of banana and chocolate
F:
For a 12%er not that boozy
O:
Fantastic all around
Bottle shared with friend. Probably one of the tastiest beers Ive have tried. Punch of sweet dried fruit, fruit cake and marzipan. Thick and chewy. Just delicious.

Dark licorice color with very little foam. The smell is heavy wheat malty with caramel licorice bananas. The taste is heavy, screams licorice and a little Christmas (at least its well done for a snowy winter night). The beer has a background carbonation, that is extremely well dosed. The beer is not my style. The aventinus was already a bit too heavy and boozy for me, and this one is even more extreme, but this beer is so round and balanced, that its still a pleasure to drink, so I recommend this, even if you wouldnt describe it as something I particularly like.

Bottle at home. Cola like pour with long lasting white head. Aroma is malty, a bit of wheat and caramel. Taste is caramel, a bit of fruit, bread and wheat. Smooth, not really boozy tasting for such high ABV. Pretty good beer!

Dunkelbraun mit wenig hellem Schaum. Geruch: Banane, Nelke, Pflaumen, Alkohol. Toll! Der Antrunk ist eine Wucht an Aromen: Trockenpflaumen, Lakritz, Gewürze, Rum. Das Mundgefühl ist ölig und schwer. Der Alkohol lässt das Bier langsam abklingen. Sicher ein perfektes Dessertbier. 
Absolute Empfehlung!

0,33 l bottle from EDEKA Mohr, bottled in june 2014. Very murky, dark reddish brown to purple with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Great fruity-spicy aroma of ripe bananas, cloves, prunes, raisins, figs and dates. The alcohol is already noticeable. Very intense, sweetish-fruity aroma of prunes, raisins, ripe bananas and cloves, followed by a warming, quite alcoholic but not unpleasant finish with notes of rum and licorice. Full body, creamy and oily mouthfeel, average carbonation. Wow, what a belter! It contains elements of a wheat doppelbock and a quadrupel which is an absolute stunning combination. So rich, powerful and heavy, I love it! Just a little too alcoholic in the end.
очень крепкое (алкого ощутим во вкусе) пиво, во вкусе сладков& солод, сухофру& пьётся тяжело.

Draft at Khyber Pass. Very dark brown pour with a large (though quickly disappearing) beige head. Classic Eisbock - albeit with some stronger stickier dark fruits. Prune danish. Candied black cherry puree. Chocolate liquorice. Flammable plum pudding. Very rich dark red fruit caramels. Pungent deep aromas. Big stuff. Great stuff!
Bottle 33 cl. Dark brown with a short lived lightbrown head. Malt, dark fruits and wheat aroma. Light bittersweet and alc. Taste, with a soft long dark fruits end.

Bottle from McTapps, thanks Sabine. Pours cola brown with a fast diminishing tan head. Boozy, bitter start. Dark fruit, nothing really fights through. Schneider do better than this, decent winter warmer but cant help feeling disappointed. Drank on a mild May evening, maybe better suited to a cold winters night.

Rarity, vey special. Strange colour. Full body, rich aroma, lots of flavour with sweet dark malts. Excellent look, creamy head. Expensive, but smooth and strong at the same time. A hint of saltiness which I adore together with caramel in dark beers. Beer to celebrate the first snow. Fantastic and delicious desert beer.

Dark brown color, cloudy liquid; slightly tan head - Aroma: strong banane aroma, already clearly recognizable in the nose. Aroma of dark fruits, wheat, yeast, spices / herbs, malt, alcohol, some earthy hops - strong sweet and very slight bitter taste - full body, thick, heavy, round and warm texture - sweet and fruity finish.

A fine example of eisbock. Cloudy, powerful, robust, sweetish and very long.
Very nice.

Bottle @The Rake, London. Great appearance of dark brown-amber colour with huge beige foam. Aroma: rich and enticing, yeast, malts, dark fruity notes. Taste: complex, lots of malts, banana, chocolate, caramel, sugar, spices. Clear alcohol presence. Medium to full body. A delicious winter warmer!

Marrone scuro, quasi impenetrabile, schiuma beige chiara eccezionalmente persistente vista l'alta gradazione alcolica.
Corpo pieno, ben carbonata.
Forte aroma acetico e vinoso, uva, banana matura, ciliegia sotto spirito, alcol e cacao amaro.
Al palato acetico meno marcato, note vinose astringenti, ciliegia sotto spirito, alcol ben presente e sul finale cacao amaro e note tostate, dopo un po' fa capolino una nota amaricante luppolata.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Small head muddy dark brown. Alcoholic toasted. Strong aromas of yeasty esters; prune raisin Sherry notes. Sweetness blended with alcohol rules. Dry finish. Slight staleness. Gets better after warming up in the glass. Very complex.
Pours a dirt brown with an off white head. Aromas of banana and clove. Similar flavors with the addition of green apple. My first Eisbock, but very good.

Thanks McTapps for this one. Pours a dirty brown color, topped with an off-white head. Malty aroma, sweet, dark fruits and quite lots of grapes aroma. Taste is strong, sweet with a medium bitterness in the finish, with some soury notes. Not really my kind of beer.

Pours opaque auburn and settles to a dark chestnut brown body. Thin film of bubbles that leave a halo around the edge of the glass. Rich complex aroma of acidic dark fruits - raisins, cherries, and plums. Banana and clove jumped out at me, but molasses or sweet dark bread also came through. Chewy mouthfeel. Flavor profile changed with every few sips. Layers of concentrated malts, more banana, spices, anise, and cola. Finished with a faint sweetness. Potent potable, but not offensively so. Truly unique wheat beer that is most definitely worthwhile.
Very tasty unique wheat beer. Strong alcohol and strong notes of banana and bubble gum.

Bottle to stange glass
Blackberry, wheat, yeast, caramel, and grape. A dark reddish brown, with a frothy off white head with some dark brown sludgy spots. Taste is caramel, sourness, pepper, banana, alcohol and dark fruits. Wow, this has a kick, but not overly boozy.

Pours clear amber brown with a short tan head diminishing rapidly to nothing, no lacing. (3/5) Nose is banana, dark boozy fruit, toffee and raisins, mild yeasty wheat. (8/10) Taste is moderately strong sweet, mild bitter. (8/10) Full bodied, low carbonation, lingering boozy finish. (4/5)

I want to call bull on the origin story (a shipment partially froze in unheated transport during the 1930s). Yes, partial freezing will concentrate the flavour by removing water - kind of the opposite of the Angels Share alcohol loss - but that only works if you remove the ice. It doesnt work with a sealed container that will rupture during freezing. Maybe, just maybe, a wooden barrel would expand enough to allow partial freezing - but youd still have to remove the water ice before drinking... Though, now it occurs to me that if you just had a chunk of ice still present in the barrel when you tapped it... hmmm... OK, maybe its viable. Regardless of the validity of the origin story, this is one heckuva beer. Flavours are very similar to an Abt - deep, dark, and rich - and despite the huge ABV, are extremely palatable. And man, does the ABV sneak up on you! This is a great beer to get very, very drunk with - or better yet, to get someone else very, very drunk with. (16/20)
My bad idea beer for the night. Should have quit but went for the biggest and baddest.

Fantastic aroma of plums, wheat malt, caramel, grape. Very strong and intensive.
Taste is sweet with mild bitterness in the aftertaste. Very thick and creamy. 
This is royal beer!

Bottle at home bought at Biervana. 19th April 15. This is a beast of a beer, poured cloudy dark brown, aroma is pungent, banana and yeast evident with alcohol. Taste is banana, almonds, dark fruit, cloves and evident alcohol. This is a real sipper and a heavy going, but rewarding beer.
Fantastic beer! Its a sweet, easy drinking and refreshing beer despite the 12% alcohol.

Bottle. Ruby-brown color. Great aroma: sweet, intensely fruity, plums, grapes, cake,caramel and raisins, sweet sherry. Taste: strong, sparkling, warming, dessert wine, dried and candied fruits (raisins, prunes, apricots, figs). Great beer!

Perfect amber color with nice highlights and a huge fine head. Aroma of toffee, malts, caramel, banana syrup. Taste is thick, more bananas, malts, spices, and a warming boozy feeling, but not unbalanced. Sweet, but it fits. Very smooth carbonation and the nice Weizen texture is still there. The perfect Eisbock in my opinion.

bottle in osaka from craft beer belly. dark brown with minimal head. High carbonation. Sweet rich aroma. flavour is toffee, caramel, raisin, a hint of weizen banana. warming alcohol on the finish. mild bitterness follows. Very good. But too rich to have more than 200 ml or so.

BOD 8/26/14. Dark brown pour. Outstanding head volume, poor lacing and almost normal retention.

Wonderful nose of dark fruit (raisin, prune, date), hints of banana and clove over a rich malt base. As it warms, medicinal alcohol notes become dominant.

Full bodied with a thick creamy texture. Normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence in the finish.

The flavor profile is world class and packs a wallop. It begins with a wave of dark fruit, that is mostly prune, over a clove background that is always present. As the prune fades, a balancing malt sweetness emerges. The middle becomes a bit medicinal from the alcohol and has a subtle bitterness underneath. As the finish approaches, malts make their strongest showing over notes of clove and dark fruit. The finish is a long slow medicinal alcohol fade leaving a pucker and burn at the back of the throat.

Bottle: A murky coppery red with a off white head. Its aroma is bananas, dark fruit. The flavor is caramel, bananas and some spiciness. The texture is creamy and a little thick. The finish is a dry and has a bit of a numbing mouth feel.
330ml Bottle at home. Dark sweet fruit aroma. Caramel, raisin, prune. Some spice such as star anise, cloves and cinnamon. Comfortably boozy. Rich and complex :)

Questa eisbock fa davvero il suo sporco lavoro. Colore marrone scuro con schiuma poco persistente, 12% si sentono tutti sin dal primo sorso, accompagnati dallaroma e sapore di banana e frutta. Naturalmente molto dolce e caramellata.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2017 Dark brown colour with creamy off-white / beige stable head  with long lasting lacing. Aroma of dark fruits, banana esters, clove like phenols, so.e caramel, toasted toffee. Taste of dark fruits, bananas, roasted malts with little, but well balanced alcohol presence. Almost creamy, very smooth mouth feel.  Bosy is medium to full, texture is smooth, carbonation is moderate. Overall: Justifiable is this beer on the first place in this rang. Beer with strong caracter.

Piwo o niesamowitym zapachu- mnóstwo owoców, suszone śliwki, rodzynki i banany, do tego zapach ciemnego chleba, delikatna wędzoność. W smaku jest gładko, nie czuć zbytnio alkoholu, przyjemne nuty karmelowe, wędzone, świetne piwo w swoim stylu.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown with a huge aroma of flambeed bananas, rum & raisin and wood. More of the banana-y yeast on taste, along with dark German bread and dark fruits, with a warming alcohol to back it all up. Taste doesnt quite live up to the stunning aroma, but Im not just going to sit around sniffing beer all night.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2017 Bottle. Murky brown. Aroma is syrupy sweet with wheat, lots of bananas, cloves, ripe fruits, warmth. Taste is sweet malty, bananas and cloves, spices, warmth of alco which is still not aggressive.

What a beer! Malty like a dopplebock but with a smooth palate from the wheat. A very drinkable beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle poured. Pours a dark brown color with a ton of fading head. Grainy, and slightly sour grape and dark fruit aroma. This doesnt taste half as strong as it is. Smooth dark berry flavor with some spice. High carb, and a little sour. Overall a great beer. Very impressed here.

Bottle. Hazy, brown with big head.
Aroma: Banana, clove, a lot of bread, alcohol.
Flavor of bread, alcohol with some chocolate. Alcohol is quite strong.
Palate: Very oily, medium carbonation, alcoholic aftertaste.

Perfect beer for long, cold evening.
Bottle. Muddy brown pour with no head, like pond water. Malty aroma with some wheat and citrus. Flavour is very complex; bready, fruity, dark fruit and citrus, yeast, leather, very tasty.

Barwa brązowa, piana drobno pęcherzykowa, trwała i całkiem obfita - dobrze to wszystko wygląda. Aromat bardzo intensywny i bogaty, mamy tutaj suszone owoce, banany, goździki, alkohol troszkę i karmel. Aromat zapowiada równie intensywny smak - bardzo dobrze wszystko tutaj gra, żadna nuta się nie gryzie, średnie wysycenie, alkohol przyjemnie rozgrzewający przełyk do tego aksamitność i treściwość, wszystko to daje piwo które mimo swojej mocy i złożoności pije się przymnie - spore zaskoczenie

I have a hopelessly romantic attachment to stories. If a brew has a good backstory, Ill likely be seduced. For me, the story behind Aventinus and its fateful frozen travel is the stuff of beer lore. Since Im a sucker for just that kind of thing, I decided I needed to try. The chance to try my first Eisbock was also compelling. On both fronts, Schneiders Eisbock was a victory; it won over my brain and palate. The flavors of dark fruit are huge and syrupy. Goddamn if the beautifully-tempered alcohol heat doesnt warm you down to the marrow.

0,33l Flasche. Tiefbraunes Nier mit relativ kleiner Schaumkrone. Riecht nach Rosinen, leicht nach Portwein. Schmeckt angenehm nach Pflaumen und Feigen, dabei verliert es nicht das charakteristische Hefearoma. Lecker!

Poured from bottle (missed it from tap, bummer!) at Braukunst Live München 2015.
Brown body, with a medium, creamy, beige head.
Lovely aroma of dried fruits, dark berries, marzipan, various sweet malts.
Taste follows this, with more alcohol, but not as much as in other Eisbock beers.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a quite lively carbonation.
Finishes alcoholic, a bit astringent, sweet/sour fruity, malty, a bit bitter.

Tasty! Clearly the best Eisbock at all. Much more balanced and less alcoholic than all beers of this style Ive had. Drinks quite smooth for this ABV, with tons of lovely sweet, dark malts.

Massive pleasant surprise! Considered Eisbock to be a gimmicky style - the equivalent of Heston Blumenthal cooking with liquid nitrogen. But, just as Mr HB has a Michelen Star or two, Scheider Weisse is a considerable force in their sphere and this is something quite special. Its an opaque reddish brown, with a fleeting white head. A nice medium body with a slightly oily feel. Nose has dark fruit - stewed prunes with a malty edge. Theres also a herby mulled wine character to the aroma and taste - very like Old Peculier. In the mouth there is raisin, dark malt, traces of cardamom and vanilla and just a bit of that Weizen banana and clove. Fantastic!

Aromat melanoidynowy, bananowy, są też goździki, skórka pomarańczy i landrynki. Barwa brunatna, mętne. Piana piękna, drobna, bardzo wysoka i trwała. W smaku lekki marcepan, dużo skórki chlebowej, fajne podbicie pszeniczną słodowością. Spoko goryczka i minimalny alkohol w przełyku.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2015 Bottle, 33cL. Home. Traded with @Jaghana. Merci !! A dark brown opaque earthy beer with some yeast sediments ; medium beige creamy head ; medium retention. Roasty aroma, fruit (raisin, banana in the end), spices, biscuit, licorice. Medium sweet (round and warming), light bitter. Full body, silky-oily texture, average crabonation, sweet lasting finish, warming background. Overall, a great beer : my first eisbock ! Extraordinary... Aroma changes through the tasting : banana is more and more intense. Palate is also impressive : alcohol is just there to maintain, never to impress.

33cl bottle (17.12.2018). Cloudy dark brown pour with thin light-brown head, no lacing. Aromas of ripe fruits, especially ripe-ripe banana, some dough as well. Taste is somewhat sweet, alcoholic and warm. Aftertaste is a bit too much alcohol, but in a red-wine-makes-you-warm -way. Strong stuff, would be interesting to store this one a bit more...

Nez sur la banane et le chocolat , première fois que je touche a une bière avec autant de parfum au nez. Longue en bouche, arômes plutôt sweety , alcoolisée et ça se sent . finale plutôt sur lamertume
Pours chocolaty with a thin white head. Aroma is stewed prunes. Taste is fruit cake, its very heavy.
Bardzo ciekawe piwo. W aromacie guma balonowa i alkohol. Z wyglądu ponad przeciętne. W smaku wytrawnie. Warte spróbowania.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Aromat: banany, goździki, rodzynki, suszone figi, nieco gumy balonowej, do tego mocarny, ale wciąż szlachetny alkohol. 
Wygląd: koźlak tylko bardziej.
Smak: gęste, bananowe, z nutą przyprawową, sporo suszonych owoców, rodzynek, karmel, skórka chleba razowego, wszystko w ogromnych ilościach, pełnia słodowa tego piwa poraża. Goryczka nieistotna. alkohol szlachetnie rozgrzewa wnętrzności.
Niby nudny styl do potęgi, a wrażenia degustacyjne niesamowite.

Botella a Medias con Marta. Color marrón rojizonoscuro. Espuma beige de baja-media formación y baja retención. Aromas dulces y especiados donde para mi gusto domina la salsa de soja, con alguna fruta madura, y matla muy de fondo. En boca es sedosa, sin apenas carbonatacion, dulces a frutos rojos, cola, soja, con un pequeño toque especiado. El final con las mismas sensaciones, largo aunque no demasiado potente. Da la sensación de limpiarte la boca un poco. Desde luego es especial. Muy bebeible. Los 12 grados camuflados por un prestidigitador.

WYGLĄD: Barwa brązowa, zmętnione. Piana drobna, niska i trwała.
AROMAT: Typowy dla "pszeniczniaka" (banany, goździki, guma balonowa) z ta różnicą, że w tym przypadku zapach jest nieporównywalnie bardziej intensywny. Czuć również aromaty charakterystyczne dla stylu "Blond", czyli brzoskwinie i morele oraz przyprawy. Gdzieś w tle delikatny ledwie wyczówalny karmel i zbożowość.
SMAK: Jest dokładnie to samo, co w aromacie (banan, guma i goździki), lecz przez wysoką zawartość alkoholu posmak wyżej wymienionych "smaków" jest obecny niemal non-stop. Nasycenie wysokie.
OGÓLNIE: Fascynujący styl! Można znaleźć tu podobieństwa do: Blonde czy Hefeweizen. Wytrawne, z wyraźnie zaakcentowanym alkoholem, który fajnie "podbija" aromat i smak piwa.

Bottle 0,33L. Murky, dark amber colour with small, creamy, light brown head. Bananas aroma dominate, cant find anything else on the nose. Taste starts light bitter, hoppy and fruity. finish is medium bitter. Interesting, there is almost no alcohol taste (OK, a little) for the 12% abv beer.
Great and very storng Weissen -Barley beer. I prefer standard Aventinus but this magic item I could also recommend

Barwa ciemno miedziana, mętna, piana sycząca, postrzępiona, przypominająca tą na szampanie, szybko znikająca do zera. Spory osad na dnie butelki. Aromat bardzo bogaty, złożony, nie przypomina piwa pszenicznego a raczej Dubbla czy Quadrupla pozbawionego dzikich drożdży. Czuć wyraźnie suszone owoce (gruszki, daktyle, rodzynki, jabłka, figi), są też ciemne winogrona, karmel, coś na kształt likieru typu advocaat, może miód pitny... Świetny zapach! W smaku jest jeszcze bogatsze, do tego wszystkiego dochodzi dojrzały banan, kandyzowana papaja, daktyle oraz ziołowość, przyprawowość i rozgrzewający przyjemny alkohol. Jest lekka słodycz, ciemny chleb, fajna kontra delikatnej chmielowo-alkoholowej goryczki, całość podkreślona perlistym średnio-wysokim nagazowaniem, uwypuklającym ww doznania. 
Nie spodziewałem się tak dobrego piwa. Bardzo pełne, treściwe, wielowymiarowe, fajnie się je pije przy kominku. Zaskakująco aksamitne, gładkie, lekko wyklejające, z owocowo-przyprawowym posmakiem. Leżakowanie uwypukliłoby jeszcze bardziej całe Quadruplowe bogactwo, choć alkohol jest tu świetnie wkomponowany w charakter trunku.

I am not a beer expert so let me just say that the "99" average what I saw today is unfair. This beer is a definite "100". I cant imagine any better beer than this.

NOTE. I used a no lead crystal brandy snifter glass and the beer was left outside the refrigerator for 45 minutes in the 65F kitchen to warm it up to appr. 60F. It took about 40 minutes to finish the beer.

It pours mahogany with dark brown edges; the head is bone-coloured and foamy. The aroma has notes of: sweet malt, toffee, prunes, rum raisins, yeasty bread, and pumpernickel. The taste is heavy sweet with a light bitterness; there ares notes of: pumpernickel, rye, toffee, prunes, and figs. The palate is full-bodied, has light carbonation and a medium viscosity; the finish is medium. Overall, a lovely malty wonder.

La cerveza es de un color rojizo-cobrizo, oscuro y turbio. La cabeza de espuma es de un color beige, abundante y espesa, con buena retención. En boca entra con esa inconfundible sedosidad del trigo, aunque la carbonatación sea mas bien alta igualmente tiene un trago sedoso y oleoso. El sabor sorprende con matices picantes derivados del alcohol, también el alcohol refuerza todos los perfiles especiados, por momentos todo ese conjunto de sabores recuerda a las mejores Quadrupels belgas. El final es especiado y afrutado, con bajo amargor, aunque también se refuerza con el picante del alcohol. Una de mis cervezas favoritas

Teknisesti ottaen kyseessä on vehnäolut. Aventinus voitaisiin kuitenkin luokitella myös Eisbockiksi. Maistoin tätä eilen ja en muistanut, että maussa oli näinkin voimakkaasti hiivaa, banaania ja lakritsaa. Tavallinen Aventinus vetää mielestäni silti näistä kahdesta pidemmän korren.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a slight red tint with a small but firm white head, malty aroma with some sugar, the taste is light and has some sweetness with a dry finish.

,

Poured into a teku glass showing very dark caramel brown (bordering on black) and light bodied with a finger of banana white colored foam. 

The nose shows a lot of caramelized banana with some hints of licorice. 

The palate is highly carbonated and a very thick bodied - practically smoothie-like. Flavors of caramelized banana, and a strong spicy mid-palate of alcohol. Moderate to high level of sweetness almost cloying. But this is practically a dessert beer and meant to drink like one. Would probably pair well with something like strudel or an apple pie.

Bottle from the brother. Cheers jamestulloch! Pours a murky brown with a light brown head that fades slowly. Aromas of liquorice, green apple and boozy prunes. Flavours of again liquorice with hints of coffee and a bitter dark chocolate. Nice boozy linger. Surprised it doesnt have a 12% kick to it! Great beer!

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2017 Butelka 0.33, Pod Mosteczkiem, warka do 22.12.2018. Dosc ladna, kremowa lekko piana, opadajaca niezbyt szybko (zwlaszcza jak na taka zawartosc alkoholu) i pozostajaca w postaci cienkiej warstewki wlasciwie do konca polgodzinnego picia. Kolor brunatno-brazowy, ciemny. Aromat bardzo intensywny i zlozony. Estrowe, ciemne owoce - sliwki, wisnie, intensywny banan i przyprawowosc glownie gozdzikowa, Do tego chlebowo-ciastowe zapachy. ROwniez rodzynki, moze nawet delikatne figi suszone. Wszystko to z likierowym alkoholem. Troche drozdzowych i zbozowych nut. Po ogrzaniu sie, pojawia sie wiecej nieco bimbowego alkoholu i karmelu. Smak dosc mocno alkoholowy (zwlaszcza w posmaku), przy czym alkohol ten generalnie nie jest jakis negatywny, jest przyzwoicie wkomponowany w calosc, troche a la quadrupele. Jest i slodko (cukier trzcinowy) i kwaskowato (pszenicznie). to co w aromacie zasadniczo tez jest analogiczne do smaku. goryczki jako takiej nie ma, ale dlugie wybrzmiewanie alkoholowe, likierowe, owocowe niejako ja zastepuje. W ustach lepkie, w miare pelne(choc bez szalenstw, w tym temacie spodziewalem sie wiecej). W trakcie picie kolejne lyki potrafia sie mocno roznic, spektrum "skojarzeniowe" od skondensowanego dunkela po owocowy quadrupel ;) Niewatpliwie nie jest to piwo codzienne, sesyjne. Wrecz do pewnego stopnia mi nie pasujace, jako zbyt alkoholowe. Ale zarazem jest w nim cos, co zapewne - na ile sie uda - skloni mnie do powtorzenia. Ma charakter. Niewatpliwie, cos, czego wrecz wypada sprobowac.update 21.02.15 - przy powtorce robi niemniejsze wrazenie niz przy pierwszym piciu....kolejna proba pod mosteczkiem, potwierdza wszystko co wyzej, tym razem mam wrazenie mocniejszych gozdzikow po roku na polce (w dosc wysokiej temperaturze) wiecej kwaskowatych, pszenicznych posmakow... i to dosc wyrazna zmiana. zmienia to piwo, ale nie robi go ani troche gorszym :) Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn by Aventinus Eisbock (2017)
Rami Rami is drinking an Aventinus Eisbock (2017) by Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn at BrewDog Warszawa

Megaprzyprawowa ta warka. Ale cala reszta sie zgadza. Bdb+ocena usredniona

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2015 Dark cloudy brown with minimal tan head. Dark dried fruit and alcohol aromas. Flavors of prune, raisin, alcohol heat. Quite malty and boozy sipper. Its like a Belgian quad without all the spicy esters and banana flavors.

Rouge orangé foncé, texture épaisse, le nez quelle présente est de fruits confits (prunes, marmelade, pêches) et de gâteau aux fruits. Bouche généreuse, avec un alcool présent mais qui participe au mélange sans accaparer lattention. Rappelle davantage un weizen quun eisbock. Une bière superbe, un peu à cheval sur deux styles, et trop pétillante pour lun ou lautre, mais dont les saveurs et les arômes en général sont divins, complexes et tout à fait exquis.

Bottle @ home shared with friends. Color: hazy brown beer with no carbonation and small beige foam. Smell: banana and spicy notes an vanilla presence. Small malt nose. Taste: high banana taste with good caramel and and banana flambée. Spicy notes. Really taste full. Aftertaste: caramel and malt finish with alcohol notes.

Nice malt aroma with candy like fruity esters. Appearance is a cloudy brown with an average tan head. Flavor has a rich sweet aroma with notes of plum and prunes. Alcohol is present in the taste. Mouthfeel is full bodied with medium carbonation.  Overall, this is a classic eisbock.

Bottle from the York Beer & Wine Shop. Pours a slightly muddy brown colour with a good thick cream head. The aroma is sweet and fruity with strong hints of booze. The taste is sweet with lots of banana, stewed red fruits, toffee, port, clove and light spice. A huge amount of flavour going on. The alcohol is pleasantly warming rather than being too in your face. Feels thick and creamy in the mouth. My sort of beer. Super stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 330 ml bottle
Dark brown ruby red beer with little beige head. Aroma has ripe sweet banana, toffee, licorice and alcohol. Flavor has licorice, sugary sweetness, raisin and ripe banana. Palate is quite full and foamy in the mouth. Finish has mild bitterness but alcohol makes it long. Aftertaste is sweet with licorice, liqueur, ripe banana and salmiakki. Very sweet slow sipping brew, but straight-forward. Gets better towards the end of the glass.

Pours a almost black clour, with a big off white head. Good retention. Smell of dried fruits, spices, vanilla, clove, banana, lemon, alcohol. Medium body, one expect some more. Taste of prunes, figs, whisky, coffee, banana, spices. This is a hell of a beer, complex, rich and one that I sure will buy more.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Dark brown with a small white head. Aroma is malt and liqorice. Taste is sweet with notes of malt and marzipan

Dark brown hazy color, big but quickly fading beige head. Aroma of wheat, malt, banana, caramel, dry fruits, spices, alcohol. Sweet lightly dry taste has similar notes. Medium body, fizzy carbonation, warming alcohol burn in finish. Nice strong wheat beer.

(Bottle) Dark brown, untransparent colour. Small, yellowish, fast falling head. Full body, low to medium carbonation, oily texture. Aroma: Light to medium strong alcohol, banana, cloves, red fruits, medium malty, toasty. Taste: Medium sweet, malty, soft alcohol, toastty, light fruityMedium to long, caramel finish. Very complex in aroma and intense in taste.
Dark brown with a small white head. Aroma is malt and liqorice. Taste is sweet with notes of malt and marzipan
Dark brown in color. Rich malty smell with very smooth and complex taste. Bit of an alcohol burn at the end, but still very tasty.
Schwarz im Glas, feinporiger schaum, süßlich malzig schokoladig in der Nase, cremig im Antrunk, sehr massig, Röstaromen schokolade, schön süßlich. Wunderbares Dessert bier
Very, very rich, sugary and boozy (in a good way). Notes of brown sugar, caramel, plumbs, figs, dates, currants, fruitcake, spices, etc.
Bottle. Good. Little sweet , wheats and strong. caramel in flavor and aftertaste.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2015 De color caoba, casi negro. El aroma recuerda a ciruelas maduras con un toque de almendras amargas y de mazapán que muestran las características fuertes de la banana y clavo. Completa y digestiva, ideal después de un gran plato. Va muy bien con Crepes Suzette, profiteroles con salsa de chocolate negro, el tiramisú y el queso parmesano maduro.

http://www.estucerveza.com/schneider-av 2,05

Hazy dark amber brown, low head retention, hazy. Fruity, prune, caramel, banana, spicy aroma and flavor. Strong alcohol taste but well balanced, medium high body. A complex strong beer for a special moment, not for every day.

11.2 oz. bottle, consumed on 1-4-15. I bought this beer within the last few weeks, so, unless it was on the shelf at the store for a long time, it shouldnt have much age on it. Medium brown with slight maroon hue. Hazy. Large amount of long-lasting, smooth taupe head with the slightest lavender tint. Good-looking beer. Tart, citric aroma features scents of toffee, orange, and gingerbread. The aroma is good but somewhat disappointing, as it is not outstandingly complex or strong. Very interesting, malty taste. Flavors of licorice, toffee, ginger, gingerbread, orange, molasses, brown sugar, cookie, and various spices. Quite strong, and I feel the alcohol burn in my throat. Medium to full body (not as full as ABV would suggest, but quite full for a wheat beer). Smooth and soft in the palate. Overall, this is a good beer, and it does have a unique taste, but it doesnt rise above the field as I was hoping and expecting. I have been wanting to get around to this beer for a long time, and Im glad I tried it, but I cant help but be disappointed even while enjoying the beer in an absolute sense (though not relative to my high expectations).
malty, slight alcohol aroma. dark brown in color, fast fading head. very strong malt flavor or darker caramel malts, slight sweetness, good body.

0,33 l bottle. Brown color with medium beige head. Aroma banana, caramel, brown sugar. Full body, complex taste of sweet malts, banana, caramel, wheat hint. Very balanced taste. Alcohol well hidden, I couldnt guess its 12%.
Uklar brun farge med hvitt skum. Lukter alkohol, parfyme, mørke stenfrukter. Litt sherryaktig i smak. sødme og bitter i ettersmak. Skuffende...

330ml bottle. Appearance: murky dark brown color with a dense little head that leaves some lacing. Aroma: strong ripe banana - dark fruits caramel, wheat and some spices. What it lacks in refinement it makes up with how huge the aroma is.
 Taste: Sweet and spicey with a few nice complexity.
You get the bananas but with some sweet red fruit,clove and spices. Alcohol clearly present in the finish and mainly to boost it even further. 
Its hard to describe what this makes it stand up while being actually to sweet.
full-bodied, sticky, smooth,soft carbonation. 


Probably the best German beer that Ive tasted. Also a great beer to cook with (for that +0.1) No kidding.

Pours murky, very dark brown body with a fluffy head that quickly settles down to a ring around the edge of the glass and some specks on the surface. Nose has sweet notes of ripe bananas, yeast, caramel and spices.Taste is bittersweet and quickly finishes with a long, bitter finish that really warms you up. Carbonation is medium-high with small creamy bubbles and the mouthfeel is quite rich and creamy. Overall a nice brew but a little boozy, which is understandable at this ABV.

light beige head. brown colour. aroma of banana, clove, boozy. taste is boozy, caramel, banana, clove, cinnamon, slight salty and roasted malts aftertaste. medium body and carbonation. too much weizen yeast character for me. bottle 33cl

Big bottle. Banana and cloves with licorice, raisin, toffee, brown sugar and some basement dust/must. Decent for the most part, but something seems off. For all the taste elements, the impact is subtle and the flavour fades quickly. Neither sweet nor particularly bitter.

Pretty crest bottle. Pours a murky caramel with a thin, khaki head. Aroma has big notes of banana, spice, caramel. A lot like the original. Taste is sweet but not cloying. Starts out with caramel, banana, and spice, then goes to dark fruits, and a hint of roasted malts, then ends with a drawn out, slightly alcoholic, aftertaste. Full body with a medium carbonation. Creamy, full mouth feel with a soft carbonation. Overall a really nice beer. An amped up version of aventinus in every way.

330ml bottle: poured dark cloudy brown with strong smell of bananas. Taste was very fruity with traces of plumbs/raisins and a distinct bitter sweetness to it. The alcohol presence is felt in the aftertaste and it is deceptively quick in getting you buzzed. Great version of the already loved Aventinus.
Sahtimainen, promilleja on. Likainen salmiakkiolut. Talvinen tökkäsy. Roskia kuravedessä.
Uklar mørk brun med lavt beige skum. Alkohol, tannkrem, brunt sukker, tørket aprikos og rosinlukt. Søt kandissukker og mye alkoholsmak. Mye alkoholvarme i ettersmaken. lite kullsyre

Fantastic powerful fruity aroma, a little citrus in it. A murky brown appearance with a thin white head. Initial molasses flavour with a hint of citrus. Has a smooth finish that ends with a tiny bite from the alcohol. Very easy to drink

Dark reddish pour with a huge head. Aroma is sweet ripe fruits, banana, plums, brown sugar, yeast, some alcohol. Promising. Taste is sweet ripe fruits, bananas, malts, yeast, mild warming alcohol. Fullish body, some bitterness in the finish. This is really good, definitely warms you up on a cold winter day :D

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wonderful rich aroma of dark fruits, caramel, spices. Similar notes in taste, rather sweet, full-bodied, a bit of alcohol in aftertaste. Wow!
Smells like banana bread, tastes like candy. Aging this would make it great.

Bottle. Pours cloudy dark brown amber with a beautiful creamy two finger off-white head. Aroma of malt, ripe dark fruits, blommer in madeira (plums), slight burnt sugar, ripe banana and some yeast and toast. Slight clove and wheat. Taste is quite sweet. Wheat, yeast, malt, banana, plums, burnt caramel, cloves, brown sugar, toasty finish. Full creamy body, low carbonation, warming alcohol in finish. Really nice winter warmer! Love the glass.
bottle at the dub! shared with pals, dark brow pour with potent alcohol aroma some raisen, good stuf overall..

Strong fusel fruity aroma with a hint of caramel. Nice murky swamp-water body but the head dissipates almost immediately. Flavour is strong wood notes, thick and chewy on the mouth with hints of molasses and sugar. Very sweet and oily. Heavy and rich, rather intense, but quite cloying. Unbalanced and overpowering.

In nose- champange like notes, also dried fruits, raisin, plum. Full and strong in taste, few alcohol notes in finnish. Dark fruits and caramel in taste, very sweet and full mouthfeel- syrup like. Clear dark amber colour with little to no head.
Pours cloudy as a typical wheat ale. Aroma of dried figs. Tastes of maraschino cherries and prunes. Despite 12% abv its doesnt taste boozy. Great winter ale!
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a dark brown color with a bit of frothy head. Huge caramel flavor, medium sweetness. Alcohol slightly noticeable.
Smooth, not bitter or hoppy. Awesome after taste almost like a pinot noir. Rather expensive, but a nice treat.

Aroma of malt, some sugary sweetness, raisins, plums, maybe fig and dates?. Taste is the same. Almost has a bit of a oaky feel. Strong but very balanced. Doesn't taste sweet (sweet, but not sugary sweet) for how strong it is, almost has a bit of a Belgian quad feel to it. Very complex. Dark fruits, lots of malt, lots of flavor. Very nice winter beer in front of a fireplace. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pour. Dark brown with a medium tan head. Aroma is dark malts, raisins, prunes, black licorice, and alcohol. Full body. Strong complex taste. Raisins, alcohol, cough drop, and dark malts.

.33l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours cloudy brown with medium off-white head. Aroma is banana, wheat alcohol, raisin and malts. Flavor is sweet malts, bread, banana, wheat and alcohol. Well balanced beer! Warming mouth feel. Swell!

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker. Murky brown colour, small beige head. Soft carbonation. Aroma of plums, banana, toffee and caramel. Fruity with sweet aftertaste. Warming alcoholic finish. Good, but a tad too sweet in my opinion.

0.33 l bottle from Alko. Brown colour, big head. Taste is very complex with sweet dark malts, some hops and some fruits or bananas from the yeast. Wait, this has 12% alcohol? Does not taste that strong, so beware when you drink it.
A bottle at home. Hazy brown color with creamy head that disappears quickly. Aroma of toffee and caramel. Taste of toffee, some alcohol, banana may be. Interesting.
Bottle at Loreley. Poured dark brown with min head. Aroma of sweet dark fruit prunes burnt sugar. Light carb med bod. Tastes pretty boozy with dark maltyness.

Strong aroma with banana, sweet fruits and caramel. Dark brown/orange with hazy liquid. Minimal, natural white head. Strong, very balanced taste with dominating banana, caramel, toffee and fruits. Alcohol quite present but stylishly in background. Wide taste spectrum and long aftertaste with banana, sweet fruits and caramel. Thick/medium palate with medium/light carbonation. Overall a "supercharged Aventinus". A hint of extra malts and thickness could be rewarded by 5.

Dark brown beer with a dark beige foam. Banana, yeast, ash, bread, caramel aromas. Reminds you of sahti aromawise. Crispy mouthfeel. Banana, a lot of sweet liquorice and a little bit saltiness as well. Has a twist of anis too. A lot of flavor and spicyness. The strong taste makes this a slow beer for peaceful moments.

APPEARANCE - Dark, opaque, 2-finger head that dissipates. Foamy. A little lacing.

AROMA/SCENT - Fruits, grass, sweet.

TASTE - Malts, yeast, sweet, nutty.

MOUTHFEEL/PALATE/TEXTURE - Thick, little carbonation, smooth, creamy, syrupy.

VALUE - $6.49 for 11.2 oz - good for an import.

OVERALL/DRINKABILITY - A likable dark beer. Not overly boozy. Goes down nice.

Bottle

Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam,

Palate-full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

hazy brown color. fruity sweetish smell of banana, alcohol, liqueur subtle honey notes. sweet full body. opulent alcohol. heavy but good.

Bottle. Small head. Hazy brown. Chokolate and amaretto on aroma. Strong, herbs, amaretto, chokolate, salmiac and banana on taste. Thick, smooth and edgy palate. Complex, rich and warming. Excellent!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 Bottle 33 cl. Pours murky brown ugly with smooth brownish tan lacing head. Notes of banana, spices, herbs, clover, dark fruits. Plentyfull taste.- beerbasher

Pours clear with an off-white head from a bottle. Very murky but surprisingly light brown. Nose has banana, sweet malt, alcohol and chocolate. Mouth is Liquorice, fruits and a nice bouquet of malty flavours. Taste is sweet with maybe a hint of saltiness. Body is full with a sticky texture and finish is medium. A nice way to celebrate the first snow of the winter.

Murky dark brown to black, dense light brown head is short. Sweet with ripe fruits like banana, apple, alcohol, herbs, yeast, plum. Crisp, medium body, alcohol evident, long finish with ripe fruits...and alcohol. Just an opinion but I did not much like this, lots of alcohol and ripe fruits. Its complex, nuanced but this was obviously wrong day for this much flavor. Well-done beer with lots to analyze/enjoy anyway.

Aroma of rich dark fruit mild toast with hints of sweet. Attractive pour, very inviting. Taste is rich, malty, warming, mild toast with hint of chocolate. Mouthfeel is rich creamy with warm finish.
