Outstanding. Intensive plums in the foreground. Warming, but not dominating, alcohol. Rich texture. What bothers me are the disguisting fluffies and a little gushing I had.

Das ist DAS Bier! Geschmacklich das beste was ich bisher getrunken habe! Dieses Bier ist ein Erlebnis!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2017 There arent many Eisbocks in their own country of origin and this is a relatively new one, but already a classic. Pours a very deep and dark mahogany brown colour, cloudy, under a crackling, light beige, moussy head slowly dissolving under influence of the considerable ABV but nevertheless retaining quite well; upon opening the bottle, it slowly creeped up the neck, so a certain form of gushing can be observed here. Powerful aroma of intense maltiness and fruitiness, overripe bananas and banana liqueur, the kind of chocolate sauce one pours over a dame blanche, amaretto, kahlua, butterscotch, cloves, something vaguely animalistic (leather?), raisins, candied dates, slight wheatiness, pipe tobacco, Belgian chocolates, brown rhum, cinnamon, apple cake, sour apple peel, fresh oranges, bayleaf. Taste immediately attacks with a big but noble sweetness, candied fruits and bananas everywhere, oily, thick and near syrupy mouthfeel, chocolate sauce, caramel candy, medium carbonation, smooth and evolving into a rich finish of profound and chewy bittersweet chocolatey maltiness, sugary liqueur effects with strongly warming, drying but not obnoxious alcohol, a light wheaty sourishness with enlightening effect and a gentle but noticeable, herbal hoppiness; the caramelly sweetness is what lasts the longest. Fantastic and a must taste for those who appreciate thick and big, dark, sweet ales; its deep chocolatey maltiness is somewhat reminiscent of the best of Belgian trappist abts or dark Christmas ales. Delicious dessert beer and a great sipper for a cold winter evening.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2016 Pours hazy brown with oily appearance, medium bubbly head, and aroma of banana, plums and apricot. With carbonated palate of dried fruits, caramel, raisins, notes of honey, and hint of alcohol. A very beautiful eisbock.

Flasche (33 cl, Abfülldatum: 15.03.12). - Tiefes Rotbraun, trüb; üppiger aber sehr kurzlebiger Schaum. - In der Nase weizenbiertypische aber likörartige, obergärig-süße Schwere, Trockenobst, Früchtebrot. - Antrunk doppelbockartig schwer, breit malzig & sämig süß - an ein Weizenbier erinnert da zunächst wenig. Erst beim zweiten Schluck zeigen sich weiche weizenähnliche Aromen und Reste obergäriger Fruchtigkeit, aber auch Rosinensüße, die eher an einen untergärigen Doppelbock erinnert. Schwach rezent, extrem schwer; auch der Alkohol tritt überdeutlich hervor und erinnert an Likör. Im Abgang schwere, weinige Süße. - Dieser Eisbock weckt bei mir vor allem den dringenden Wunsch, mit Wurst oder sauren Gurken diese sämige Süße wegzuspülen ...

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. A murky dark brown color with a dense little head that leaves some lacing. The intense aroma displays strong ripe banana - you do not have to get close to smell that - spiciness featuring cloves, vanilla, wheaty maltiness and dark fruitiness. Taste is heavily sweet and spicy, similar to Finnish sahti in many ways. It is rich in cloves and ripe dark fruits, slightly less banana-oriented than the aroma. Very potent, long taste; full-bodied, sticky, smooth and flat palate. Some alcohol in the long finish, not disturbingly, though. Delicious, intense speciality.

Drink cold (8°C)
Eye: pours a hazy deep brown color with a nice small, not too fast dissipating beige to white head with small bubbles and just the right carbonation. Big yeast flakes settle at the bottom of the glass.
Nose: ripe bananas, dates, yeast, candy.
Mouth: somehow salty licorice, ripe bananas as well, dates, caramel, chocolate, some sort of spices (coriander perhaps) and strong malts.
Palate: mustardy, grassy herbs, almost fir-like, alcohol and yeast as well. Bread and nuts after some seconds.
Overall: excellent and complex beer. alcoholic taste in the mouth a bit too much.

500 ml bottle from the LCBO. BB Oct 2018. I was a bit hesitant/fearful of this intimating brew, as it is my first eisbock,. My fears were confirmed as it poured out of the bottle, a thick, muddy brown. But as I sip on it now, my friends, I can safely say there is nothing to fear here. What a great beer. This is a deliciously sweet malt bomb, no doubt, but seriously good. Banana, clove, spices, booze, bubblegum, sweet bread, ripe plums and dates all hit the nose and tongue in spades. Thick, chewy mouthfeel  I didnt know what that meant until this one... You taste the booze and its warming, but in a totally good way. Its a sipper, but I find myself sipping rather quickly. Superb!

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a hazy dark brown color and aroma of caramel, raisins and prunes. Taste of sweetness, prune, alcohol, brown sugar and a light sourness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 Bottle from Piligrim in Moscow (those guys have all the good stuff!). Pours opaque brown with a dense beige head. Slightest bit of lacing. Aroma of caramel, banana, and alcohol. Flavour of dark fruit, banana. I am not really a fan of the stronger beer styles, but this is definitely worth trying.

Bottle. Pours a murky brown with a beige head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is molasses, bananas, cherries, brown bread. Taste is banana, caramel, a touch of molasses. A bit like drinking banana bread. Sweet and syrupy with some prickly carb to break it up.

A worthwhile beer to seek out and try, with a unique aroma, taste and mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (330 ml). Vintage 2010. Courtesy of Jürgen, thanks! Murky amber brown with a small beige head and very little lacing. Aroma is of breadied malt, caramel, banana, light spiciness, strawberries and red fruits/port notes... quite complex. Taste is moderately sweet and quite complex too with molasses, red fruits/port notes, breadied malt, banana, cloves and alcohol. Full body. Soft carbonation. Liquorous and syrupy mouthfeel. Warming finish. Quite complex and well balanced. Very nice sipper. Its already 4+ years old and I think it could easily survive a few more years.

Sept. 10, 2014. Bottle from LCBO. Chocolate brown with tan head. Strong aroma of raisins, plums, toffee; quite lovely. Very sweet caramel, plum, and raisin flavours with hints of chocolate. Very smooth mouthfeel. Quite nice.
"fruity, spicy aroma with a new level of complexity compared to the others Ive had in the style. not my favorite beer, but worth trying to familiarize yourself with a new style, perhaps."

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2014 Poured from a bottle, into a bell glass, at 40 degrees F.

A: The pour is a cloudy dark brown, like old hickory wood. A thick head of very pale tan forms atop the beer, though lacing is more or less nonexistent (forms quickly, then slides right down the side of the glass). Nigh no light gets through the beer, just enough to let one know this is a seriously dark brown, cloudy brew. Bubbles rise slowly as it sits in the glass.

S: While I am tempted to simply write "awesome in the true sense of the word", thats not exactly helpful. The aroma is malt in all its best forms - toasty, bready toffee caramel goodness. Notes of banana and raisin wreathe through the nose beneath the malt bouquet.

T: Perfect.Toast, cracker, warm whole grain bread, caramel, and toffee, all singing in perfect harmony. Sweetness is undiluted in this beer. Fruity notes pull through as it moves along the palate, bananas and raisins spiced with clove and coriander, and some black cherries. The finish lasts a long while, toffee-slathered toast. The alcohol content is present, but as a background note, adding primarily the warmth.

M: Rich silk syrup, dancing lively and sparkling across the palate, sticking to every surface long after it passes.

O: This is one of my favorite beers brewed, ever, if not my absolute favorite. And yes, Ive had BCBS, Ola Dubh Special Reserve 30, St Bernardus Abt 12, Espresso Aged Yeti, Celebrator...I would order this over any of those.
(Bue à la brasserie): Une banane flambée riche et amère qui détruit rapidement tous les souvenirs de Dunkles, Helles ou Pilsner.

September 10, 2014. Bottle, best before June 13, 2018. Courtesy of McTapps, thanks!
Pours ruby red with a large off-white head. Aroma is dried fruits, plum, caramel, banana, alcohol. Taste is sweet caramel and dark fruits, esters, slight alcohol, light bitterness. Finish is sweet fruity, light bitter, alcohol warmth. Medium bodied, light sticky mouthfeel, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2015 Robe brune et troublée.Banane caramélisée, flambée, caramel, bonbon et guimauve.Lalcool ne se sent pas.Ni même le sucre.Même le malt grillé est discret.Quelques chose de puissant, doux et accessible.Une merveille.

Bottle at Schneider Weisse Munich. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with citrus, banana, hops, toffee, raisins, ripe fruits and a bit of alcohol. Bitter finish with citrus, banana, toffee and ripe fruits. Exquisite eisbock.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle poured into a chalice
A: Pours a hazy amber to brown color with a small bubbled head which dissipates leaving not may lacings. Dirty, with some wheat floating around
S: Very good smell. Very fruity (plums and grapes) and sweet. Strong smell of caramel malts and some yeasts. "Liqueurous" and alcoholic end
T: Complex like the nose: Very sweet and fruity upfront (dark fruits). Very strong taste of malts and wheat. "Liqueurous" and alcoholic end with a nice hop sting
M: Heavy creamy body. Reasonable carbonation to the style. Nice bitterness
D: Good but quite strong. Lovely beer after all. Schneider quality
[ BA Review @ 9/13/2010 ]
La mejor cerveza que me e tomado en mi vida. Es increibldmente buena. Algo grandioso..

Had some friends over and had a good-beer splitting night. Man is this an ugly beer. The suspended lees in the beer make it a cloudy grey brown, and I wasnt particularly rough with the bottle. The nose is all sugar. Raisins, and syrup, and sweet malt. Doesnt bode well. Taste is all sweetness and malt, but mostly sweet. Sugar, syrup and some roasted malt. As much as I appreciate a sweeter, richer beer (Gouden Carolus Cuvee Van De Keizer comes to mind.) this beer just a little to cloying for me.

Dirty dark brown with creamy yellow foam. Rich aroma of prunes, malt blocks, liquorice and dunkelweizen. The taste is malty with a lot of alcohol, associations to wine, juniper berries, prunes and wood. The palate and mouth-feel is rich and complex, some fizzy rock candy shows up early in the aftertaste. Very rich and complex beer - most likely the best I have ever tasted.

Pours a large beige-gray creamy head, very persistent; hazy opaque dark brown, super murky-muddy colour, same as reg. aventinus but deeper. Smells, wow: raisins, blueberry, clove, plums, wheat, cake (torta paesana), milk chocolate. Just imagine a "Boero", the chocolate with the boozy cherry inside, its really that nasty. Tastes dried/dark fruits, cake, chocolatey, vanilla, its like having a dessert in your mouth. Medium to high sweetness, with really none bitter note. Soft carbonation, oily-creamy consistency, light alcoholic and warming touch. Whats incredible its how easy it actually goes down, especially for being 12%vol. For any Aventinus, or wheat beer fan, this would be the ultimate tasting experience. A quite outstanding brew!!

33cl bottle from Great Grog Bottle Shop. Utterly sensational! Pours a deep ruby colour. On the nose, heavy raisin, prune, hay and maturing banana notes. Incredibly rich, dark fruit flavours; raisin, prune, banana, plum, cherry. Alcohol feel is incredibly mellow considering the strength and gives it a warm and lastly finish. This is one of the most incredible Bavarian beers I have ever tried. I need to pick up another to age. Bravo!

5 year old Aventinus Eisenbock Bock with a small white head, medium carbonation.
Taste is powerful alcohol, cherries, fruit, roast malts.
Smells sweet, oil texture.
Very good and strong bock.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color marron. Sabor a malta, ligeramente a banana, dulce, alcohol.

Pours a ruby brown colour with one finger of lasting tanned head. Aroma: Dried prunes, raisins, bit boozy. Taste matches aroma. Pleasantly strong booze taste. Pieces of something swimming in it. Mild carbonation. Just the right amount of bitterness on the palate.

Bottle: Bottled 2011, around 3 years old or so. Little rust under the cap. Burnt, muddy copper & brown pour with a soft khaki head that doesnt last very long. Aroma of plums, vinous grapes, ash, mild sherry-like oxidation, sweet molasses, apples, sticky toffee-ish syrup. Smells very sweet with a little alcohol warmth to back it up. Flavor is big & complex. Very wine-like, actually. Red grape, vinous booze, sherry, rich raisin flavor with some notes of anise, roast, & ash hanging around the edges. Strong, potent alcohol from front to back, ending with a lingering touch of oxidation, sherry, & vinous, fermented grape flavors. A decent beer, Im just not a huge fan of this style I guess.

Bottle. York Beer and Wine. Decent beer. Liked it. But the cheese I bought from here was as dry as some old bollocks. Which is totally useless as far as a beer review goes, but the cheese really was bollocks...
Bottle. Hazy, brown, minimal head, tan foam, very bitter, light sweetness, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.
Bottle pours out a dark brown. Nose is banana, pit fruit, roast malts, and spice. Taste is more of the pit fruit, roast malts, belg yeast, and a nice spice touch.
Bottle 33cl. Dark brown color with creamy white head. Aroma - fruits, raisins and alcohol.

~Sweet malty aroma, lots of maillard reactions, alcohol present, prune, raisin, and spice.
~Pours a murky brownish amber color with lasting off white head.
~Strong malty flavor, bready, melanoidal, sweet alcohol, muted dark fruit.
~medium bodied, medium low CO2, alcohol harshness, lingering spice.
~I love Aventinus. The Eisbock is too much. Seems the alcohol mutes the fruity maltiness that I love. Still a beer with experiencing.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 9B). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 2927130415. AROMA: dominated by a port-like aroma and dried prunes. toasty bread crust notes also present. APPEARANCE: deep brown color and hazy with some material in suspension. average deep ivory head with low retention. viscosity derived from alcohol with pronunced legs. TASTE: sweet malty character with some caramel and vinous notes, balanced by a strong alcohol presence that is not harsh or solventy. Low bitterness just needed to balance the residual malt sweetness. finishes semi-sweet. PALATE: full and velvety body, reminding a liquor. low carbonation. very present alcohol warmth. OVERALL: an extremely delicious eisbock with a great balance between malt and alcohol.

Cervesa molt dolça on es nota la graduació alcohòlica, sha de prendre amb calma i si pot ser amb algun acompanyament.
Cerveza muy dulce donde se nota la graduación alcohólica, se tiene que tomar con calma y si puede ser con algún acompañamiento.
Cerveza color caramelo, con gran aroma, poco gas y fácil de beber en paladar es refrescante y dulzona, ideal para acompañar una buena comida

A great beer!
Pours a dark brown colour with a small head that vanishes quickly because of the 12%, which may dominate for some people
It has a full mouth feel and the prominent flavour is dark chocolate.It is a well balanced beer which adds to its greatness.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a hazy dark brown color and aroma of caramel, raisins and prunes. Taste of sweetness, prune, alcohol, brown sugar and a light sourness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is dark fruits, brown sugar, wild yeast and sweet wheat. Taste is a light sweet grain body, sweet fruits and a rich sweetness. A fairly substantial alcohol kick at finish. Appearance is a murky brown with a thin pearl head that retains poorly.
UPDATED: SEP 23, 2014 dark, almost black colour. aroma is dark fruit, some faint notion of banana. taste is slightly chocholate-y, some bananas again, dark fruit. you can taste the alcohol. good.

This must be only the 2nd or 3rd Eisbock I have had, but they are constantly one of my favorite styles. The flavor is extremely complicated. Its wheaty and super strong. Its hard to go wrong with a 12% alcohol beer.

0,33 bottle purchased and consumed in Serbia. Dark brown hazy color close to coffee from filter machines, some sediment, off-white tick foamy head. Aroma of dark fruit jam, figs molasses, caramel. Mouth: extremely sweet and complex. Notes of dry fruit, candy cranberries, dried Italian figs, raisins. Very good contemplative beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 limited edition boxed 500 ml bottle. Muddy murky dark brown, short lived tan foam. Aroma is portish, dark fruit and caramel. Taste is boozy ripe dark fruits, firm sweet toasted caramel malt, some chocolate and spice. Softer carbonation, fuller bodied, moderately hopped. Potent, complex, overrated and: DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys)
Bottle at home in a sampling glass Hazy brown with a white head. Caramel and dry fruit aroma. Dry fruit flavour with blackcurrant. Juicy mouthfeel prominent alcohol. Long finish. Properly delicious.

Transfer from BA review on 2-22-12-
 Poured from bottle into a snifter glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a brown/mahogany color with a small creamish colored head. The head fades rather quickly leaving a decent level of lacing on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is sweet and malty with a strong showing of an alcohol aroma. The sweeter aromas are largely stone fruit in nature with cherry, plum, and raisin all present and strong. The malty smells are a nice mix of wheat and a bready smell with the boozy alcohol aroma rounding out the sweeter and maltier smells, giving the beer a very inviting smell.

 Taste- The taste is robust and big as would be expected for a 12 % abv brew with the flavors following the nose very well. It starts with a wheaty and dark fruit flavor upfront which creates a backbone for other flavors to come and go upon. Toward the middle the fruit flavors intensify some as more cherry enters the taste while a yeasty and spice flavor complement wheat taste at this time as well. Along with the fruit so too comes nice flavors of caramel and toffee, which get stronger more toward the end of the taste. More toward the end and along with the caramel and toffee comes a alcohol taste. While it starts out more moderate it grows in strength more toward the end in the taste. The flavors mix and mingle on the tongue to in the end leave a very satisfyingly sweet but balanced boozy and lightly spiced flavor on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel- The body of the brew is quite thick and creamy with a very soothing feeling on the tongue as the creamy body and lighter carbonation create a full mouthfeel. This feel is quite nice for all the rich ad boozy flavors of the brew, making for a nice sipping and warming brew.

 Overall  A somewhat obscure brewing style done very well. This is one quite tasty brew and well worth a try.

Bottle post office vaults Birmingham. Murky brown colour decent head. Aroma is banana raisins yeast. Taste is same nice sweetness good malts and bitterness some alcohol warmth. Nice smooth body. V good stuff. Just completed all style ticks with this bottle happy days!!!!

Wow I like this beer. Hazy dark brown color and aroma of caramel, raisins and prunes. Really yummie taste with lots of sweetness (resembles that of prunes I think) and a light sourness. I really like this intense sweet malty beer, which is unlike any wheatbeer I have tasted.

0.33L bottle. Pours hazy brown-black with a frothy, light tan head. Amazing aromas on this beer. Lots of banana, bready malt and yeast. Very sweet up front, with more of the nice banana flavor, some vanilla, licorice, butterscotch and alcohol. Finishes with some yeast, enough bitterness to cut through the sweetness a bit, but still leaves long-lasting cloying sugars and a warm alcohol burn in the chest. Full bodied with sticky mouthfeel and sharp carbonation. Overall, really phenomenal beer for desert. Amazing aromas and really nice flavor to boot.

Dunkelbraun, perlig, schaumig im Glas. In der Nase starke Bananearomen, Alkohol, dunkle Früchte, Karamell, intensiv. Am Gaumen süß, Karamell, Malznoten, Liköraromen, Alkohol. Sehr ausfüllend und wärmend.

Light beige-tan head, a little gush from spout. Hazy red brown dark body.
Aroma; juicy caramel malts, prunes and plums, fermented apricots, wine notes.
Taste; dark juicy sweet malts, dark fruit jam, dark sweet powerful wheat malts, sour candies, raisins, lemon, dark candied almonds, a crumb of brown cheese, a hink of spices.
On palate solid, wine style, medium carbonation.
Finishes on the sweet side, with dark caramel malts, lots of juicy fermented fruits.
Overall a tasty slow-sipper.
[33cl brown btl 12%abv #113 BB04.11.18]

Bottle from lcbo. Opaque milky brown with a fizzy dark beige head that dissipates to a thin film. Boozy maltiness, raisin, wheat, CO2, caramelised bananas, brown sugar, butterscotch, some cherry. Moderate carbonation and body, smooth, slightly sweet and more malt on the finish. Unique and worth trying.
Bottle I picked up from France 44 to try this ageless classic out. Some day Im going to try and partially freeze a doppelbock and see if I can get this. Good strength and complexity

DØE-Århus syd 16013: concentrated version of Schneider Aventinus in numbered bottles. no foam - the shower up, and all the foam disappears. strong scent of original Aventinus mixed with the smell of alcohol. strong beer, with burning alcohol. it is too much. a special beer that absolutely must be tasted. easy banana.

Bottle. Pours murky brown with a quickly diminishing off white head. Aroma: raisins, cane sugar, nuts. Taste: raisins, chocolate, rum, banana, cherries, caramel. Lively carbonation, full body, quite complex, sweet, sticky mouthfeel. Long lingering sweet cherry finush with an alcoholic punch.

Bottle. Murky brown pour with medium bubbly tan beige head that bubbles down but leaves some good lacing. Sweet aroma with lots of dark fruit, butterscotch. Taste is similar, lovely balance of sweet malts and a good amount of bitterness. The alcohol definitely comes though in both the aroma but less so in the taste. Medium body with lots of carbonation.

Pours cola- coloured with dense off-brown head. Aroma of cloves, cinnamon,some 
banana. Taste of the same with lingering aftertaste of booze and raisins.
Murky red. No head to speak of. Sour cherries. Fruits. Smooth. Very good. Very much like a quad. Never had an eisbock before. This is a great style.
Tap. Amber pour. Banana, chocolate, malt. Sweet feel. Medium body. Very nice

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 330 mL bottle from World of Beer. The pour is a dark dark brown/light black with a thin tan head that fades down quickly leaving no lace. There is a little bit of a soda-like dissipating nature of the head. The aroma is a little malty with a touch of yeast. There is a resounding sweetness on the back end, but its relatively good. The flavor is a little different. Im getting a lot of Belgian notes in it, which is a little strange. The yeast and malt are just surprising for an eisbock. The mouth feel is nicely done with a good carbonation to it and just solid. The aftertaste is a little lingeringly bitter, almost like a black licorice. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, pours nice amber with a beige head, sweet malt aroma with some fruit notes, taste is also sweet with chocolate, malt, and fruit, dry very slight bitter finish, very good beer

Pours the same as Aventinus, tiny white head. Aroma is sweet, boozy, dark fruits. Well carbonated, sticky mouthfeel, long lasting after-taste. Flavor is banana, ripe dark fruit, malt, alcohol burn at the end. One and done on this bad boy. A cold-weather beer for sure.
Dark brown pour with a creamy white head. Aroma is caramel, raisins and bananas. Pretty complex flavor with a nice alcohol finish.
Bottle at home, Oulu. Originally rated 25022012. Colour is dark brown with almost no head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, some fruits, alcohol and malts.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Deep smell of banana, butterscotch, clove, raisins, plums and trappist inputs with added rum feel to it. A bit boozy. Taste is more intense on the dark fruits, raisin, butterscotch, dates and rum. Very intense and quite well masked, wouldnt want another one though.
Aromes de alcohol i platan, també pera, dissolvent i nou rancia. En boca es nota massa lalcohol.

Drunk a few times. Had one last night while playing darksouls. gonna try a bunch of heavy duty beers while playing it cuz it seems like the perfect combo. takes the edge of my ragequits at least. so this pours a cloudy muddy orange with medium head tan head. aroma is amazing. banoffee pie, dried fruits, some orange. taste is similar. malty sweetness balanced with a big warming hit of booze and a slightly sour aftertaste. big body holds the alcohol well. its quite fizzy and feels great to drink. when i first had it i thought it was too strong, but now its one of my absolute favs. smooth and completely delicious

Dark brown, beige head. Aroma and taste are full of fruits like banana, figs, raisins and plums, roasted but sweet malts, vanilla, clove, wine tones and a bourbon-boozy burn: quite complex, yet relatively easy drinkable. Lingering sweet aftertaste. Full body, (too) lively carbonation, soft mouthfeel. Great beer.

Smells great, well balanced aroma of dark fruit (plum, prune) and candi sugar. Hazy, dirty b rown with long lasting brown head. Tastes great, not overly complex but well balanced. Upfront get some candi sugar, finishes with some dark fruit and alcohol heat. Comes off a bit hot, but still integrates well with the sweetness of the drink. Not too complex, but I can imagine with some aging this would be great. Above average carbonation and medium bodied. Great beer.
Pours dark, muddy brown out of bottles. Aromas of bannana, dark fruit, . Taste follows nose. Sweet. Like sipping a port wine.
chocolate, roasty, resin, black, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish

Une bière brune trouble ayant une mousse beige qui tient un temps en place avant de diminuer en un mince voile qui reste là. Un nez de bon caramel chaud, de raisins secs, dherbes et dherbes , rassemblés par un alcool assez convaincant. Le goût est très agréable. très près des arômes, une touche fruitée agrémente bien le palais. On y trouve des bannes en purée, quon auraient préalablement flambées. Belle et douce texture veloutée et crémeuse. (1107-120614)
Bottle pours murky brown with off tannish white head. Toffee, banana, soy sauce, molasses, alcohol. Medium, lightly crisp body. A little sticky. Medium sweet. Light bitterness.

Clear ruby from the bottle. Aroma of red fruits, brown sugar, and raisins. Body has a thick feel. Some alcohol marries with the molasses and caramel sweetness. There is a rum like flavor to the finish which lasts quite a while. Good stuff.

Olajos testtel csordogál a pohárba borszerű lenyomatot hagyva a pohár falán. Habja nem sok van, illata annál inkább: a masszív alkohol elrejtőzésére természetesen esély sincs, azonban a túlérett trópusi gyümölcsök jegyeit is magában hordozza, valamint egy különleges aromát is, melyet leginkább egy cukrozott paradicsomlé keltette illathoz tudnék hasonlítani, és amellyel korábban a Verboden Vrucht kóstolása során már találkoztam. Íze legalább ennyire gazdag és változatos, intenzív sör, melyben az alkoholos alapot egy erőteljes gyümölcságy fedi, már-már likőrszerű benyomást keltve. Nem egy mindennapi darab ez sem.
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours an opaque dark brown with thin tan head. Aroma is slightly boozy with malts and dark fruits. Taste of raisins, yeast, bread malts and a slight alcohol burn.
12 oz bottle pours dark brown, little head. Aroma is sweet and spicy. Heavy malt taste with hints of spice, raisins and banana. Boozy finish. Not bad.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2014 ASPETTO: marrone scuro, schiuma fine e omogenea, abbastanza abbondante e abbastanza persistente.
AROMA: Aroma pungente, tra alcolico, maltato, affumicato e tostato allo stesso tempo. Veramente un capolavoro!
GUSTO: tutti i sentori che si avvertono al naso sono presenti anche in bocca. Amarene sotto spirito, liquoroso, prugne secche, caramellato, maltato, un tocco di cioccolato e di tostato. Lamaro è inesistente, ma la birra non è mai stucchevole. Il corpo è decisamente strutturato, quasi masticabile. Carbonizzazione abbastanza bassa.CONCLUSIONE: Questa birra è  una sinfonia di sapori tutti ben equilibrati tra loro. Lalcol è alto, ma assolutamente non si sente. Assolutamente da non perdere!

The pour is smooth, thick and builds a tall tan head. The head quickly settles down to thin wispy layer that is slick and leaves no lacing behind. Its body is thick, cloudy, brownish in color and contains some small bits of yeast sediment floating in it. The nose is big deep and fruity. Wheat malt notes are surrounded by over ripe banana peel and raisons soaked in rum. Its flavor like its aroma is big and deep as well. Concentrated sweet malty flavor is full warming alcohol, mild clove and fruity yeast showing raison, banana peel, prune and bubble gum like flavor notes. The texture was slick and smooth with slightly syrupy, but not overly so, mouth feel. Carbonation is light in this big full bodied beer.

(Bottle) This isnt a pretty looking beer - its murky deep brown with the slightest off-white head. Nice aroma, mainly banana esters but with other notes giving complexity - certainly hints of spice and alcohol. Fantastic palate - thick, rich and velvety. Fantastic taste - rich and complex. Raisins and bananas, alcohol, spice, with some bite in the finish that I think is mainly alcohol.

Bottle at home, another one that I had never rated. Pours a very deep and dark brown with violet highlights and a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have banana, cloves, dark fruit, raisins, mild smoke, slightly nutty. caramel, brown sugar, very well balanced, crisp and drinkable at 12% because the alcohol is well hidden. Not too bad for something I had looked at for some time but not had.
UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 Bottle. Black pour, thin head, aroma is sweet, light sherry and strong bubblegum and malt. Taste is sherry, alcohol notes, nice maltiness, powerful carbonation. Wonderful

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours very cloudy reddish-brown with no head to speak of. As expected, very boozy on the nose, though this is countered by a significant smokey note and a lot of honey, dark fruits, caramel malts and spices. Taste is rather spicy and smokey as well, providing an overlay to the strong undercurrent of sourdough bready malts, cheesy yeasts, caramel, dark fruits and of course, alcohol. Something of a tingler due to the surprisingly significant carbonation and the spices, and obviously rather full-bodied and viscous. The polar opposite of easy drinking, but that tends to be virtually never a bad thing in my experience, especially in cases like this when the alcohol is thankfully not too overpowering.

330 ml bottle packaged in 2012 poured into small weizen glass. Translucent nut-brown color with a momentary finger of bubbly light tan head. Sweet aroma of cereal, clove, banana and a heavy dose of alcohol. Flavor follows suit, with a pronounced warming alcohol quality. This brew delivers on its promise of being a concentrated version of Aventinus.
Brun acajou, effervescence faible, col beige fin. Légèrement fumée, fruits noirs, surtout maltée, léger chocolat noir, alcool beaucoup trop présent!

Truly a standard among Eisbock style beers, everything from the head, aroma and color through the slightly sweet with a hint of bitterness finish on the tongue screams perfection.

Bottle. Dark brown beer with head that minimized very quickly and stays only as a small ring. Aroma is wheat malt and raisins. In taste sweet, caramel, fruits. One of my top favorites for any dark lager or ale. Exceeded expectations on aroma taste and finish. Amazing complexity

I think I recieved this Bottle as an extra pours a hazy brown with an off white head. Spice Bananna and yeast taste.
Amazing beer. Body of a doppelbock beer, but this beer is so much more. Has a deep taste of dark fruits, oak and the warmth of the alcohol. Very good.
Cloudy brown with a hint of orange. Light tan head. Deep, dark fruit and malt. Raisin, fig, and an earthy quality. Smooth and full.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2015 Dark murky brown color with white head that quickly vanishes. Riped banana and plums with a hint of bitter almonds and some alcohol on the aroma. Full bodied. taste follows the aroma, you can feel the alcohol, together with over ripped banana and dark fruits.

Just found my notes on this.
I poured this into a weizen glass.
The appearance was a nice dark brown to almost black color with a decent one to two finger white foamy head that dissipated within about thirty seconds and ends up leaving a decent amount of foamy lacing.
The smell was wheaty yet had a nice allocation of dark chocolate malts and some nice banana coming out to assist in a wonderful aroma.
The taste was basically sweet through the chocolate and banana and the wheat ended up backing all of that up in a decent manner. There was no aftertaste and yet there was a slight dry sweet banana finish.
On the palate, she sat about a medium in body and wanted to show a decent sessionable quality to it, but for the most part, it really wasnt. I sipped this and enjoyed it thoroughly that night I had it.
Overall, in my opinion, this was a nice beer and a great weizenbock.
Bottle at Pivopija in Belgrade.Pour it dark amber color with thick small white head.Taste and Aroma of roasted coffee, yeast, fruits and dried fruits.Very nice expirement.

une mousse marron de taille moyenne. L’arôme de bannane, de pruneau, et clous de girofle. Le goût est très intense au début et s'adouci peut a peut, fruits noir, levure, blé, et un peu d’épices. Une très bonne biere!!!
Una bombardata alcolica con un gusto prevalentemente dolce, di malto, caramello e banana. Tutto sommato abbastanza stomachevole, ma sa farsi apprezzare in caso di bisogno.

Bottle. Dark brown with a large creamy white head. High effervescence and looks very inviting. Over ripe banana galore, raisins, prunes, nutty, warming alcohol, a little dark chocolate and cocoa, light clove like spicy things. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, sweet but overly so. Silky soft and gentle and the alcohol is well concealed, so it drinks pretty easy. Lingering banana in the finish.

Un violet très sombre avec une mousse marron de taille moyenne. Larôme de pruneau, banane, et clous de girofle. Le goût est très intense avec du malt, fruits noir, levure, blé, et un peu dépices. Pas onctueux en bouche, plutôt lourde! Une bonne bière intense.

500 ml bottle. A very hazy dark brown beer with a medium light brown head. Aroma is sweet with notes of roasted malt, raisins, plums, bananas and alcohol. Flavor is sweet with notes of banana, dried fruit, wheat, light yeast and a warming alcohol finish. Excellent, world class beer! Great for winter.
Dark brown with very small head. Very caramel and candy sugar taste. Sirupy. A bit too sweet for me

Bottle. Startled because of gushing (twice, different bottles). Fortunately, both aroma and taste make up for that. Strong banana and grainy impression in the aroma, pleasant oxidization lurking out, matched perfectly by doughnut hints. Pours dark brown, hazy, with a quickly dissipating head. Booze and banana in taste, leaves some mild burning sensation in the throat. On the whole, apart from opening the bottle, I enjoy every aspect of drinking this gem
Dark brown with tan head. Persistent carbonation. Roasted caramel hops. Full bodied. Initially very sweet. Warming alcohol palate

Clear, deep amber colour, light brown small head. Intense aroma of dried fruit, bananas, prunes. Taste is overwhelmingly intense: liquorice, roasted coffee, lots of died fruits and banana again embedded in sweet maltiness. Medium long finish.

Bottle from Papago Brewery. Pours a hazy, amberish-brown. Sorta looks like prune juice. Smells of dried fruit and sweet malt. Taste is rich and complex with lots of plum. Never would have guessed 12% alcohol. Delicious.
A monster! Big caramel aroma. Hints of brown sugar, prunes, grain, and bananas. Full-bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Warm alcohol feel.
Bottled Oct. 2011. Murky brown, small offwhite head. Aroma of raisins, caramel, bubble gum. Taste Is similar - malty, vinous, sweet, alcoholic. Thick, creamy mouthfeel, lovely, warm alcohol finish.

Full caramel dark brown hazy beer with a lot of sweetness yet not cloyingly. Quite complex, some yeast clove notes. Not my thing though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle from Etre Gourmet. Pours hazy dark reddish brown color with huge beige head. Strong and complex aroma of fruit. Cherry, raisins, apricot ,malts and some alcohol notes . Taste is similar, lots of sweetness and fruitiness. Nice oily palate, lively carbonation and strong sweet aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Bottles from Vino Wines and Bottle Baron. Clear ruby/brown body with a thin beige head. Very faint lacing. Aroma of toffee, liquorice, orange peel and dusty yeast. Flavour of caramel, peppery spice, coffee, liquorice and red apple. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel. Light fizz. A rich, concentrated beer of strong, complex flavours. Very nice indeed - the beer equivalent of a rich red wine.

Bottle @ home. Birra marrone carico, velata, con schiuma beige fine e poco persistente. aroma fruttato, di albicocche disidratate e datteri, banana zucchero di canna e miele (piuttosto complesso). Dolce amabile, per nulla amara, una lieve punta acidula. Gusto di caramello, liquore e frutta disidratata armonico. Corposa, abbastanza equilibrata nonostante sia molto dolce. Calda.

2007 bottle, cellared since release. Deep burgundy colour, lively head quickly disappears to nothing. Winey aromas, almost port like with the sweetness coming through, sweet malts, raisins, small hints of clove & banana, yeasty, fruit loaf. Taste follows the aromas, sweet, vinous, hint of sourness, leather, spicy, hits of the alcohol are still present, giving a subtle bitterness. Full bodied, sticky, thick textures, surprisingly lively carbonation, going to a bittersweet, long, vinous, tannic finish. This has aged fantastically well, and would be a great after dinner drink in place of a port!!

Wow, flavour packed and it almost covers the alc %. Almost...
Any beer that is 12% is going to expect respect.
This is a beer that will make the winter months pass. great taste with a warming alc %

Das Aroma ist eindeutig von Weizenbier geprägt: Banane, Hefe, Fruchtaromen, Brot. Geschmack dann stark bananig und alkoholisch, fast ein bisschen wie vergorene Bananen. Eine weitere starke Komponente ist ein sirupartiger Malzgeschmack. Insgesamt nicht so richtig ausgewogen und sehr süß. Würde auch als Likör ganz gut machen, aber in größeren Mengen nicht mein Ding.
Geruch nach Kunststoff und Bananenweizen. Im Geschmack extrem süß. Starke Rezenz. Alkoholig. Hätte wohl noch lagern sollen..

Pretty decent brew of semi-sweet taste and mild carbonation. The alcohol is obvious and there are sum rum raising esters of the malt showing through the sip. There is a bit of leathery banana, and a faint presence of bubblegum but extremely innocently present.

My head is all over the place with this beer. Taste and smells extremely strong. Yes, its 12% ABV, but it tastes stronger than that. In the aroma is banana and clove, which is also in the flavor. Sweet malts are as well.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with small off-white head. Nice retention. Aroma of bread crust, caramel, raisins, hints of vanilla and clove. Very sweet with medium bitterness in the finish. Some herbal hop aroma. Huge body, high carbonation. Great on a cold, rainy evening. Very good beer.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2016 Liquid is cloudy. Looks very thick. Full body. Medium to heavy sweetness. Smell and aroma of melon.

Edit: alcohol in taste but not taste like 12%.
Surprised this is rated lower than regular Aventinus. Better on draft than from the bottle, but still very good. Wheaty and sweet, hint of bread. I will have it with a pretzel.

Flasche. Gießt dunkelbraun ein, fast ohne Schaumkrone und lediglich mit einem dünnen beigen Ring. Die Aromen sind süß-malzig mit Noten von Trockenobst, allerdings auch etwas von derben Trauben. Der Geschmack ist überwiegend süß mit fruchtigen Bananennoten, im Abgang etwas bitter ohne starken Alkoholgeschmack. Gut.

Cerveja intensa, alcoolica mas nao agressiva. Toques de caramelo, damasco e uvas passas. Lembra a Carolus em alguns momentos. Bem escura, turva e com sedimentos, tipicas das brejas com trigo. Cerveja boa, eu curti.

Bottle 330 ml in Tolkiens House, Zagreb. Pours dark brown with off-white head. Yeasty and fruity aroma. Roasted malts and fruit flavor, touch of alcohol as well. Sweet. Full bodied. Complex, not easily drinkable but very nice beer.

Troebel, hazelnootbruin bier met compacte, beige schuimkraag. Aroma van banaan, karamel, mout. Alcohol vooral duidelijk in de neus, maar ook aanwezig in de mond. Smaak is erg zoet, licht zuur. Zacht in de mond, volle body.
Bottle: pours a dark cloudy brown with a foamy light tan head, sweet, banana aroma, taste is slightly sweet, malt with a touch of an alcohol burn. Nice!

330mL bottle poured into a teku glass. The tart, and sweet, fruit aromas come through in force right off the pour. Its a very bright berry-like aroma; kinda like sweet red grapes, blueberries, and raisins (maybe even some chocolate. It reminds me quite a bit of a sweet red wine. Theres also some hints of wood, or maybe its more of a smokey or charcoal character. Some citrus creeps into the aroma as it settles with some vanilla and some flowery notes come through, along with a faint alcohol suggestion. The pour is a fairly ugly, very murky (nearly opaque), dull wood-brown color that does have some effervescence to it. The head is a consistent, small-bubble, tight, neat, evenly spaced pillow-like texture that leaves a healthy, puffy ring behind, but a very runny lace. The taste is a high / medium-high sweetness, with a touch of bitter at the finish - very much in the vane of a sweet red wine. The very soft, and crazy active, abundant carbonation combine with the full, rich body to create a very creamy mouthfeel with a fruity stickiness. Theres a nice, wine-like alcohol warmth at the finish with a floral and resin aftertaste. This ones a good beer to use if youre trying to convert a dedicated wine lover.
Bottle share thanks to Dave Webb and his world famous honey. Nose is full of Munich like malt, slightly dusty. Mouthfeel is full with lots Munich malt and very sticky on the lips. Very nice.
Pours a reddish brown color with light foamy head. Big malty dark fruit aroma. Malty sweet boozy dark fruity, slightly buttery, smooth, high boost.

330ml bottle. Pours hazy dark reddish brown color with big beige head. Very intense and complex aroma of fruit (especially cherry, raisins, apricot and candid fruits), malts and alcohol. Taste is similar, lots of sweetness and fruitiness. Nice oily palate, lively carbonation and strong sweet aftertaste.

Bottle, three years after bottling. Pours clear dark amber, with a fiery but quickly dissipating head. Aroma is dark roasted malts with loads of dark fruits and berries, as well as some nice oaky notes. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet with roasted malts, kandi, molasses and coffee, and with light alcoholic bourbon, vanilla and prune in the finish.

Bottle 0.33l. Pours murky dark brown with no head. Aroma smells very strong of banana with yeasty spiciness, dried fruits, plums, rum pot. Taste is light bitter, medium to heavy sweet, heavy banana flavour , slightly sour, dried fruits, alcohol. Aftertaste is boozy and sharp. This is a beer where I drop out. Too strong, too pungent.

Dark brown color, not exactly beautiful. Low beige head, disappears almost immediately. Heavy smell of dark fruits, caramel, dough, some banana and sweet spirit. Taste is very rich, with sweet fruits and very noticeable alcohol that warms up the palate. Strange but good.

From Baccus Wine, Olney, Bucks. Dark fruit with sherry aroma, pours murky brown with a lasting tan head. Taste is sour, cherry liqueur, burnt banana fritters, sweetish. Alcohol is obvious, not that subtle, yeasty, almost medicinal . Pear drops with clove oil finish. Im not sure if I like it or not but I wouldnt rush to buy another one. Perhaps better with age.
Cola colored pour with no head or lacing. Complex aroma with a raisin note. Bit of alcohol burn in the mouth. Tannin feel similar to a red wine in the mouth as well, with a fruity aftertaste.
From bottle. Warm, cloudy brown. Smell is dates, sherry and sweet bread. Dark fruit taste. Sweet malts.
Purple black hazy. Small head, not lasting. Banana, sweet. Heavy, rhum, sweet. Flambé. Not that strong an alcohol taste for 12%. Boozy warmth. Spicy. For dessert.

Dark brown color, thick texture. Minimal bur firm head. Sweet nose. Strong sweet kick at first, than you can feel chocolate aroma and some alcohol. Sweet finish. Full body and flat carbonation. (Svijet piva 0,33l bottle)

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2016 Strange looking brown color, thin off white head. Full body, soft to average carbonation. Very thick texture. Aroma is overripe fruits, wheat, berries, light banana, slightly peppery. Sweet, but not too sweet taste. I didnt even notice the high abv, so thats good. I liked it.

Pours dark brown, medium head that reduces to ring. Aroma of malt and raisinns, little fruitness. Taste is sweet, caramel and toffee, light fruit notes. Medium bitterness, rather low carbonation. Little alcohol warmth and the end. Very enjoyable and balanced beer.

large creamy offwhite head. good lacing. fully lasting. sparkling thick light brown body. aroma: moderate yeasty, dough, banana, clove. if: moderate sweet light bitter. ff: moderate sweet light bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic heavy alcoholic finish. Espuma mais duradoura até hoje. Delicioso dulçor alcoólico lembrando dulçor de banana e com toques maltados. violentíssimo aquecimento alcoólico (12%). Baixa drinkability devido àquele fator. Dulçor banana-passa. 120 s

330ml bottle from Beer Hawk - Deep ruby to black body, thin off-white covering. Nose is a banana-caramel-toffee aroma, with the obvious alcohol presence giving it a daunting feel. Almost smells like a booze soaked loaf of banana bread. The taste and mouthfeel is boosted by a big boozy warmth, with a complex sweetness carrying it through to a nice robust spicy finish. Love this one! Prost indeed!

Nut brown color, with a decent white head, leaving no lacing. 

Aromas of hazelnut, banana, malt, plums, not as intense as the Aventinus. 

Malt driven, supported by yeast and banana flavor, with a lot of spicy cloves and alcohol, enwrapped by sugar. Alcohol becomes too present for my taste as the malt sweetness begins to vanish, gets supported only by sugar. Beer turns from very sweet to sharp bitter in a split-second, due to the alcohol. Carbonation is fine, supporting the body of the beer. Oily, honeyed mouthfeel. This may just be a little too extreme for my taste, I dont find many nuances in this beer, as my tongue seems to get numb by the obvious alcohol. First impression is surprisingly refreshing, medium-bodied, fruity and warm. Then my palate gets hammered by lots of sugar, followed by alcohol and alcoholic bitterness, which warms my belly.

Although I dont love it, I have to admit that the beer by itself is somehow convincing. Its something you should take your time with, to adjust to the taste and furthermore the goal of the beer. As this is the first warm week of Spring in this year, I find it hard to imagine the streets around my room covered in snow. But I think thats when you should drink this, to warm yourself up. When it is very, very cold. And you dont mind a sugar rush, followed by an alcohol overdose, because it fits to the overall situation. This is a special beer for special ocasions, you shouldnt drink it as an every day beer. Get ready for it, and try to enjoy.
Pours chestnus with no head. Minimal carbonation. Sweet aroma. Smooth, malty flavour. Pleasant sipping, goes down smooth and oily.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes dunkelbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hefig fruchtig, überreife Bananen, süß. Geschmack stark süß fruchtig, Dörrobst, sehr reife Früchte, alkoholisch.
Looks almost Grey brown, not very appetizing, but tastes like a quadrupel with a German yeast, and the signature banana clove flavor. Dark fruits and slight alcohol burn

Bottle from 2013. 
Aroma has a nice malt character with a lot of dried fruit notes related to the malt. Lots of toasted bread and dark caramel and toffee. Moderate chocolate notes and faint roast. Lots of raisin, lighter prune and fig with a bit of berry character. 
Pours a murky brown with some lighter brown boots on the edges. Medium thick, moderately sized tan head that recedes fairly quickly to the edges where it lingers for a bit. Light leaving and medium sized legs. 
Flavor is fairly sweet with quite a bit of dark caramel and toffee. Moderately high chocolate notes with faint roast. Lower toasted bread notes than in the aroma. Lighter fruit nous than in the aroma. Medium light raisin and prune along with faint berry and fig. Medium light bitterness. Finish has some alcohol spice, faint roast and toasted bread along with faint chocolate and moderate raisin. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a pretty enjoyable beer with a really nice malt character and a light, but balanced fruit character. The alcohol is well hidden behind the malt sweetness. The beer is dominated by malt and Maillard reactions - if that is your thing you will like the beer. Not much yeast character.
Plum aroma. Burn and flavor similar to brandy. A little too sweet for my liking but a decent beer.

Bottle Limited 2012. Piwo swietne zapach powala. Rumu sliwek moczonych, piernika. W smaku dochodza rodzynki w alkoholu. Alkohol ukryty ale lekko sie jednak go wyczuwa, ale to ten szlachetny a nie czysty etanol. Wyglad piwa to ciemno fioletowo brazowa barwa, metna ze spora lepkoscia. Na dnie az sie klei od osadu. Bezowa i gigantyczna piana. Stoji dlugo. Naprawde przy takim alkoholu nie opada prawie wogole. Tresciwe i po prostu super bardzo smaczne. Szczegolnie polecam

Un classico tedesco delle birre invernali. La doppelbock "ghiacciata", un puro concentrato di alcol e sapore. Colore rosso rubino, schiuma densa e bianca molto persistente. Profumi di malto e frutta. Corpo molto denso, gusto di caramello, nocciola e alcol. Birra impegnativa, da bere con moderazione.

Medium mokka brown head, dark black slightly brown colour, alcohol fruity banana vanilla smell, medium creamy carbonation, medium bitter, a bit alcohol but no feeling of the 12%, drop tinteling smokey a bit sticky menthol spicey caramel

Bottle - opaque dark brown, with slim off-white head. Intense aroma of dark fruit, prunes, banana, cloves. Same in the taste with added liquorice, dark berries. Full bodied, moderate carbonation with warming alcohol in the finish. Excellent.
Delicious, jam packed with wonderful spice flavor! lightly bitter, medium sweetness, medium sourness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
One of the best beers Ive ever had. Schneider refuses to disappoint. As I understand its limited release and Ill be looking out for more of this!

Intense notes of jammy dark fruit and spice inter mingle on this beautifully rich beer. After the syrupy body coats the palate flavors of currant, rotting banana, clove, cooked cherry, burnt sugar, grape must, and so many more flavors. This beer provides a wealth of depth that really lingers through each sip.
(bottle) clear dark amber colour with a small tan head; aroma of sweet fruit; creamy palate; balanced and subdued flavour; very nice

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2014 Loved this. Pours chocolate brown with a finger of fluffy beige head. Aromas are great: bananas, bread, blackcurrants, cloves. Great weizen flavours and towards a classic heavy, bready texture and body. Booze isn?t very obvious, though if you seek it it?s there. The dark berry notes are a lovely surprise. Highly recommend.
Wow what a concentrated flavor! Aroma is amazing, but pour is lacking. Cloudy brown with zero head. Taste is sweet and weizen but strong!

33 cl bottle @ home. Murky brown/beige pour with a small dirty head. Lots of weizenflavours in the nose, yeast, bananas and cloves. Most of the flavours of the nose come back in the taste, lots of yeast and sweet banana. The high ABV is nowhere to be noticed.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2014 Bottle from alcampo, gran canaria. Muddy dark brown color, small tanned head. Aroma is wheaty, banana, sweetness, little roasty. Full body, wheat, yeast, roasty, hint of alcohol, hops, licorice.
wheat dopplebock; que mas puedo decir. trigo y un pijo de alcohol que se deja beber solo por la fama que tiene
Pours murky brown with low head. Aroma is mild sweet hefe esters. Taste is sweet malt with nice banana and clove flavors, big beer

Pour is a murky brownish dark purple with a tight tan head. Nose is much like regular aventinus, lots of esters, banana, lemon. A hint of peppery spice with a good bit of dark berry fruits. Taste has a touch of booze through the finish, full bodied with strong carbonation and a light burn. Lots of dark berries, light banana and a touch of spice to it.

Bottle at home. 
Complex nose, sour, sugar, smoke, pine?
Dark muddy bown color, offwhite head creamy. 
Sweet , medium to full body, smoth mouthfeel, alcohol, acid. 
Super nice bock. 
#bandofskulls #sweetsour :)


:)
Bolton Brew.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with some sediment and an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are booze, caramel, banana, and dried fruit - with a dry and alcoholic finish.

Zo dat had ik nou echt niet verwacht, een Duits bier waarbij ik nadertijd zoiets had van heerlijk.. meestal is het allemaal van die fletse reinheitsgebot bocht maar zo niet deze, mijn complimenten !

zeer donker kastanjebruin.caramel, schenkt als stroop/olie, met minimale witte kraag. 
aroma zijn die van banaan, licht zuurtje, rozijn bessen, fruitig, peer
smaken zijn redelijk zoet, zwak bitter, zeer licht zuurtje, zeer sterk bier, redelijk fruitig (banaan, vijg, dadels, pruim), caramel, zwak moutig, redelijk kruidig, peper en zoethout. 
volle body, romig in de mond, lage co2, afdronk kruidig en zoetig, heeft in de ondertonen ook wel iets weg van een la trappe, iig heerlijk complex. en erg goed bier.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra, Tiel. Non-transparant dark brown to almost black with a small tan head. Overwhelming banana and plum aroma. Sweet taste with malts, caramel and more fruits. Warming and creamy smooth. Great sipper.

Like an exploding bomb of aromas, Aventinus Eisbock catched me with its complex fruity notes at first. Overgained, but lovely level of isoamyl acetate creates a fight between the banana, fig and some lurking roasted malt notes. At this point it reminds me the infamous St Bernardus ABT 12. Appearance is perfect too, a near-black body with a thick, creamy tan head. In the taste, mainly plum, fig and a little chocolate rule, bitterness and the high level of alcohol are both almost unrecognizable. Palate is heavy, long lasting, and the fine carbonation helps to avoid this beer from being too sweet or syrupy. I found this one way more similar to Belgian quadrupels than to weizenbocks or doppelbocks; but if I dig deeper, as far as I know, not only those are also include a big part of wheat in the malt base, the retained use of hops, the yeast strains and fermentation processes are similar too, so the resemblance makes sense as well. Finally, this one is definitely among the best beers Ive tried, ever.

Currently my go to beer for any occasion. It has very strong banana and prune hints and the alcohol mixes in perfectly. However, I would go for the aged one if its available. Make sure its extremely cold and its your starter beer for best taste. Favorite!

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Pours mahogany with a slight residual tan head. Punchy aroma offering under-ripe sweet banana, plum, yeast and some fiery booze. Palate is medium/full and creamy. Yeast and banana fade, replaced by some dark chocolate. Finish is warm like a brandy but much more gentle. 
A style so defined and accented that it defies comparison. The qualities of a great beer are apparent but they lie within an idiosyncratic expression.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2014 Almost black with medium off-white head. Yeast, strong boozy notes, some roasted grains, chocolate, marzipan and dark fruits. Big banana candy and lots of sugar. Very sweet and alcoholic. Medium-full bodied, average carbonation and slightly syrupy texture. OK stuff, but a bit too much straight up alcohol.

330ml bottle. Pours to a deep brown hazy colour with a tan head and a soft carbonation. 
The nose consists of sweet malt aromas coupled with a yeast and banana. Big flavors of sweet malt, caramel, estery fruit flavors of banana. You absolutely dont recognize the 12% abv. 
Without any doubt the most impressive and best beer I have ever had the pleasure of drinking. I also had the chance to taste an example from the 500 ml bottle and I could not distinguish
Pours dark brown with little head. Profound fruity esters on the nose. Flavors are surprisingly light as is the mouthfeel. Incredibly well hidden ABV
Dark brown almost black beer. Foam head collapses quickly. Intense aroma. Raisins, balsamic vinegar or soy sauce. Full flavor. Boozy alcohol taste. Wood, sweet/sour and spicy.

Aroma - the aroma takes on a caramel-like malt, alcohol, rich spice
Appearance - color is a very dark reddish-brown, that has a 1/2" head that falls to white halo.
Taste - the taste is more toward the heavy sweet side, with a light bitterness as well. Of course the alcohol pops off, and when you explore the nuances further you get intense doppelbock richness. It gives off flavors like black cherry, black currant, and curaçao spice. Its super complex, and the further through it you pick up more nuances - such as cake.
Palate - body is full, the texture is thick, the carbonation appropriate for bocks, doppelbocks, and eisbocks. The finish is really impactful. Its strong and hangs on for quite some time. It has an alcohol warming effect with you.

Much like bocks, doppelbocks, and scottish ales, sweet just doesnt agree with me in beer. With that said, I can be objective, and this was not a chore for me - it is a very nice beer.

Poured from a 330ml bottle. The aroma is loads of raisins, I think two scoops, slight spicy phenolic note, fruity alcohol, prune. The flavor is rich maltiness, banana, reminds me this is a weizen beer. Nice, rich, and warming. Poured a bit chunky, so not a pretty beer. Sipper.

Wheat, clover, banana, caramel, alcohol; brown, hazy, small foam; medium sweetness, light(+) bitterness; full(-) body, oily feel, average carbonation, long sweetish finish;
overall: very good beer, great aroma

From bottle. Pours a deep murky reddish brown with a thick off-white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is big and full of red and dark fruits, a little boozy. Taste is fruity, moderately sweet. Mouthfeel is full and creamy. This is a nice rich brew.
Smells a bit hot and kind of like sake. Tastes sort of like sake as well which isn't a complaint. It's nice and smooth on the tongue.

S: Chocolate, plums, raisins, caramel malt, alcohol, brown sugar, honey and overall there is just a ton of things going on in the powerfull smell this beer is giving off. P: Dark cola with a 1 finger white/tan head that doesnt last long. T: Strong malt, plums, lots of dark fruit, alochol and bannanas. M: Thin with light carbonation. O: A complex and flavorful beer with lots to give but its a bit harsh.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is meaty, smoke, caramel, some apples and leather. Very sweet and light bitter. Very alcoholic. Full bodied, sticky texture and long finish of red fruits.

0,33l bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Great fruity aroma with raisins, yeast, plums, spices, dark fruits, wood and basement aromas with vinous notes. Taste is sweet, with dark fruits, plums, raisins, vanilla and yeast. Full body and average carbonation. Alcohol is also notable, but not offensive. Overall it is really great beer, very tasty and aromatic.

33cl in a Aventinus glass. Pours a dark, thick liquid with little head. aroma is almost too strong. Taste is extremely powerful with raisins, richness and damp cardboard?? (in a good way). A very pronounced Aventinus taste but too powerful and strong for me. I have tried De Molen Bombs and Grenades (15.2%) and Goose Island Bourbon County (15%) both of which hid their ABV miles better than this. Possibly the strongest tasting beer I have tried. Very nice but maybe one to share and try once in a while.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Alex. Murky brown with no head. Aroma of banana, prunes, caramel and clove. Sweet, with banana, dark fruits, raisins, clove and alcohol flavors. Medium-full bodied, thick mouthfeel. Pretty good, especially for a slow sipping.

330 ml bottle. Cloudy medium brownish color, short-life and small-sized beige head, aroma of raisin and dried fruits with ester notes, full heavy body, a bit fizzy, very malty and syrupy sweet taste, sweet malty and ester palate with plumy and alcoholic notes

Ich hab Flasche 2008 / 05732 
Der Geruch ist sehr schwer-malzig, der Schaum dunkelgelb und sehr cremig. 
Schon der Antrunk ist sehr schwer & alkoholreich. Im Hauptteil entfalten sich schon fast weinartige Aromen, allerdings ist für mich im Hauptteil noch keine alkoholische Schärfe wahrnehmbar. Die alkoholische Note im Hauptteil ist zwar nicht zu "überschmecken", aber ich empfinde sie nicht als sonderlich störend. 
Der Nachgeschmack ist sehr süß und klebrig. Eine ganz leichte Schärfe ist im allerletzten Teil des Nachgeschmacks vorhanden und hält sich relativ lange auf der Zunge. 
--> ein sehr interessantes Bier, das man allerdings nur in sehr kleinen Schlucken trinken kann. Und auch würde es besser in die kalte Jahreszeit passen, als zu einem 27° warmen Sommerabend. 
Trotzdem ein schöner Eisbock.


Test vom 22.6.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,10,6,10,12,10 - 9,70
Smoked malt aroma with a cloudy brown colour. Sweet malty taste with a phenolic palate.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2014 Bière de froment de fermentation haute fortement alcoolisée (12%). Brun foncée, avec des reflet roux, une mousse généreuse de couleur crème, ocre, retombe moyennement rapidement. Les arômes dalcool tout dabord agressent les narines puis disparaissent pour laisser la place à des arômes harmonieux, subtils. Café, caramel, chocolat, banane, miel, confiture de cerise, biscuits, raisin sec... une impression générale agréable au nez, une envie de sentir ses arômes longuement. En bouche, le réveil! Lalcool domine. On a limpression de boire un alcool fort, fumé et distillé. Le chocolat, le café fort et amer reste. Lamertume vient de la torréfaction du malt. Aucun houblon nest perceptible. Et pas de goût sucré sur la finale. Le procédé de geler leau dans le processus de fabrication afin daugmenter le taux dalcool (et non en rajoutant des sucres) enlève la finale sucrée de cette bière. Bière intéressante et complexe, mais je la boirais seulement en guise de digestif.

Drinking from 33cl bottle. Label just states Eisbock, not Weizen, backlabel does talk about Weizen-Eisbock.
I smell candy, alcohol, chocolate, iodine and syrup.
Its a clear, dark brown beer with a good brown head.
The taste... well mainly sweetness all over. Some bitterness in the background. Normal carbonation.

Bottle at home. Pours a brown color, not at all as dark a expected, with almost no head. Sweet smell of bubblegum drifts out of the glass while pouring. Aroma is sweet and a little smoky, full of red fruits and winegums. Not really my style, but who knows what the taste is like. Taste is dark brown, fruity, infused with alcohol. This stuff is strong. Very high on alcohol, the taste is as dull as the bottle looks. If someone bought me one, I would gladly drink it, but I wouldnt buy this again myself.

Bottle from Legacy Liquor in Vancouver. A murky dark brew with a bit of beige head. Alcohol, fruit and malts on the nose. Wow! This is a rich and heady brew. Big and complex fruit and malt flavors on the tongue. Further sampling required. I just had a 2 oz taster, put a stopper in it, and will have a wee nip in a day or so. This is a big beer!

Hazy brown, brown minimal head
Passito, banana, sweet dessert wine, dry fruit, raisins, glue
Sweet alcoholic complex beer, with a slight bitter ending
Banana flambé, dry fruit. Marron glacé aftertaste
Exceptional beer for an evening dessert
Aroma: Porto, deeds, caramel Appearance: Brown, orange amber, cloudy, little yeast, off white head, staying, light lace Taste: Roast, hint of porto, deeds, bit quadruple like

Poured into clay stein from bottle. Tons of head. Pours bottle brown. Ripe banana, chocolate and coffee aromas. First sips were nothing but head. Taste of the head was of a banana liquor candy I remember from childhood. Lace even on the clay sides of my stein. Thick mouth feel. Taste is dark fruit, wheat, with an alcoholic banana finish. Spicey after taste. Fantastic winter beer. One of my favorites for sure.

330ml bottle. Murky red-brown shade. Fruity, smokey, gamey, meaty aroma. Also red berries and oranges. Really unique and unusual aroma. Taste is orange, clove spice, big looming heat behind everything. Pretty interesting stuff, not exactly how I expected it to be but good.

Very tasty and boozy eisbock. Full of flavours. Banana, prunes, cherries. Sweet wheat, leather licorice. Delicious warm winter friend.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)

Oh, wow, you must approach this one really carefully, its veeery strong which is very well masked under enormously complex aroma and body. Its very dark with quite dense head which disappears quickly. In aroma you will find wide range of dark dried fruits - from raisins through prunes to cranberries. But what is really predominant is strong aroma (later echoed in taste) of umami. It is literally as if you were smelling miso paste. Its very oily in palate, carbonation is very smooth however thanks to it, the beer creates lighter layer on your tongue. Body is full and hop bitterness is very limited. I need to try it at least 2 more times and come back to this rating... Its extremely complex, you can only compare it to the quadruppels that were aged very long.

Niezwykle złożone piwo przywołujące na myśl style belgijskie. W aromacie niezwykła pełnia, drożdże, owoce takie jak brzoskwinia, pieczone jabłka, winogrona białe, ale i niestety wyraźna nuta alkoholowa. W smaku właśnie alkohol zabija przyjemność delektowania się pełnią smaku, którą nadają wyżej wymienione owoce, nuty pszeniczne (lekki banan), chlebowe, lekki karmel i toffi. Podstawowa wersja Aventinusa jednak lepsza.

Bottle: Cloudy, brown and medium head. Intense, Shiraz like, dried fruit and fruit cake. Intense. Dominated by malt and yeast aromas. Moderately sweet, low bitterness and not sour. Intense and long. Very slippery and thick. Like an aged ripe Australian Shiraz. Huge concentrated Malt Flavor. 
Rather amazing and unique. Concentated and wine or Late harvest / Port like.

A very complex and delicious beer that can not and should not be taken lightly...caramel, bread, cereal, dough, earthy, banana, alcohol, butterscotch, clove, licorice, raisin, ginger, vanilla are just the beginning of the flavor profile involved here. FABULOUS for making exquisite beer cocktails and desserts (including ice cream!) as it pairs effortlessly with any and all of the following flavors and liquors: hazelnut, plum, cassis, cherry, chocolate, vanilla, almond, rum. BEST BEER IVE EVER AGED- 5+ YEARS is just the beginning of its potential, provided you have a good cellar!!!

Appearance: Clear dark brown with ruby highlights and a finger thick ivory head.
Aroma: Banana, bubblegum, vinous, slight leather and fruit cake.
Taste: Medium bitter and sweetness, with low sourness.
Palate: Thick coarse texture, medium body, average carbonation, lingering astringent, spicy finish with a hot alcohol sensation in the mouth.
Comments: Very good. Rating for 2012 bottle 186890.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2014 Bottle from Bacchus in Olney. Cloudy dark brown like diluted cola. Plenty of carbonation but little in the way of head. Aroma of chocolate, malt, raisins, caramel and alcohol. The taste is perfect: a heavy sweetness tempered by a lighter bitter finish. Syrupy mouthfeel. Warms all the way down.The pinnacle of the brewers craft.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Quite a murky dark brown pour. Basically Aventinus but more so, all of the classic fruity clove apple spice yeast wheat flavours intensified. Really intense. I actually think I prefer the basic version, this has quite an alcoholic punch and bite to it, I think you get better flavour profiles from the weaker version.

330ml bottle with my Weissewurst at Schneider Weisse Brauhaus in Munich. Pours a murky brown with a nice bit beige head. Buckets of booze on the nose, with a lot of ripe fruit, banana and toffee. Taste is strong strong sweetness, with quite light sour notes. Big and boozy. Viscous and smooth mouthfeel yet a big boozy finish. Not quite as good as the original Aventinus, but still a cracking beer.

smells of sweet dark red wine a the smallest scent of alch. pours a nice deep purply black color almosdt like a smoothie with a big head and now its gone tastes like figs plums so smooth and tasty very little almost no carbonation total genius brew

(Flasche) Es hat ei.e dunkelbraune Farbe, ist nicht filtriert mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süß, malzig, schwer mit etwas Brombeere. Geschmacklich ist es schwer, süß, vollmundig, malzig,alkoholisch, Waldfrüchte und leicht sirupartig.

fles
kleur: donkerrood/bruin, mooie schuimkraag, stabiel
geur: rood fruit, alcohol
smaak: licht zoet, fruit, bitter, alcohol/warm
Nasmaak blijft lang plakken

33cl bottle at home. Hazy dark amber brown with a medium off-white head which didnt last long. Full body with medium fizzy carbonation. Sweet with some bitter notes. Caramel, chocolate, dark fruits and warming alcohol. A great full flavoured complex brew (especially in winter).

33cl bottle @ home. Dark brown color, medium beige head. Aroma dark fruit, caramel, glue. Light sweetness, medium bitterness, light to medium sour. Medium body, sticky, average carbonation, short sour-bitter finish. Not bad but not really my style, bit too sour.
Bottle to snifter. Very deep reddish brown. Wheaty yeasty aroma. A little banana. Very belgian ish. Tastes sweet and dark fruits.

Bottle dark brown cloudy Body with nice Not very long lasting tan head, aroma is caramell almonds and also some alcohol taste is sweet malty some wine and dried fruits aftertaste is some sweet malts some wine and a little bit bitter great One
Poured from 500mL bottle. Hazy brown with minimal off-white head. Dark fruits and honey on the nose. Yeast and alcohol flavour. Medium body.

Bottle into snifter glass, hazy chocolate brown color with creamy light tan head. Aroma of heavy malt sweetness, dried dark fruits (raisins, dates, figs), banana, clove, honey and a red wine-like note. Taste brings out notes of toast, plums, toffee, some cinnamon, pretty yeasty and booze. Heavy body, low carbonation, rich, creamy, malty with some lingering malty yeasty booziness. Very much like a quad, delicious.
Maravilhosa cerveja. Exemplar do estilo eisbock. Vale a pena conferir. Extremamente complexa.

We did a vertical tasting of a 2012 bottle and a 2008 botttle. Both poured a dark brown with a thin white head that faded away fast. Both had an aroma of malty sweetness with a backbone of dark fruitiness; 2008 smelled almost like wine. 2012 tasted like a beer; almost like if you mixed a weizen bock with a belgian quad. Sweetness was there: dark fruit, bananas, cloves, mild wine flavor. Heavy carbonation and mild alcohol on the backbone. 2008 on the other hand tasted like wine. Much less carbonation than the 2012; grape, port wine flavor was MUCH more prominent. We let my friends dad who isnt as much of an experienced beer drinker taste test these and he said if he didnt know this was beer he would have thought it was wine. Alcohol at the end was a little more prominent in the 2008 as well. Overall, very interesting beer. Definitely recommended. I personally liked the 2008 bottle better and if you can find one that old Id suggest you try it.

Aroma: marzipan, banana, caramel malts. Appearance: dark brown, hazy. Taste: quite sweet. Palate: thick oily, long rich full body taste, complex dried dark fruits (plum?). Overall: fantastic desert beer. Personally preferring this over the regular "Unser Aventinus". Bottle from Wittich Weine, Switzerland.

Bottle pours dark brown with a small white head. Very thick oily body. Nose is Belgian quad, cinnamon spice, wassail. This is a very nice brew. Alcohol is well hidden.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted from bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a thick white creamy head. Aroma is caramel, toffee and dark fruits. Plums and raisins very prominent. Taste is sweet up front with a lot of dark fruits like the aroma mixed with biscuits and some spices. Ends with minimal bitterness and a slight alcohol burn. For 12% the alcohol is very well hidden. This beer is dangerous. Very smooth and complex. Full bodied with a sticky mouthfeel. Excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours thick, turbid and brown. The color of dark brown sugar. Thin very off white head, that can be a bit thicker and creamier with a vigorous pour. Left a thin ring and nice legs. So pretty.Nose is banana and clove, a dark hefe nose. Malty, sweet bread, dark fruits. Not a trace of alcohol and a fresh plum. Smells deep and rich and as it warms caramel and toffee. 

Taste is spectacular. It is creamy beyond description. Full, smooth mouthfeel. Malty and round. Banana. clove, dark fruits a bit of raisin comes forward. But, there is a fresh and bold fruit juiciness in this. It has a bit of tang, a little zip and this beer is not heavy in the drink. There is no alcohol on the palate except a mild edge in the finish and a warming in the chest as you swallow. Finishes dry sweet and fantastic. 

This is a terrific style and while you will not drink 5 of these in a session its worth seeking out.

Butelka 0.3L. Ciemnobrązowe, błotniste, mętne z kremową średnioobfitą pianą, która ulega dość szybkiemu dziurawieniu ale pozostaje ładny kożuch.
Aromat intensywny, banany, czekolada, kakao, śliwki, rodzynki, suszone śliwki oraz delikatny alkohol.
Aromat bogaty przyjemny, złożony, dość słodki. Wyczuwalne także jabłko, goździk i rabarbar.
Pachnie trochę jak ciasto kakaowe z bananami, śliwkami, rodzynkami i rabarbarem. Albo jak śliwki w czekoladzie z alkoholem. Smak również bardzo intensywny, lekka kwasowość, kakao, zaraz po niej sodycz z owocami a na finiszu gorycz z alkoholem. Bardzo złożony smak.
Piwo pięknie zmienia smak i odczucie w obrębie każdego łyku.
Po przełknięciu czuć wyraźnie grzanie, nuty alkoholowe w nosie, a w ustach posmak po dłuższej chwili gdy już zniknie alkohol rabarbaru.
Bardzo złożone bogate piwo. Mój pierwszy eisbock i zdecydowanie zachęca do próbowania tego stylu.

Robe ruby, cargo très faible, collet inexistant.
Arômes puissants et complexes, malt torréfié, banane sèche, sauce soja.
Puissante, avec un corps bien rond une bonne longueur sur les raisins, le caramel et le grillé.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je chmelové s nádechem jahod a alkoholu. Pěna je bílá, lehce do hněda, jemná, vysoká a pomalu mizící. Barva samotného piva je tmaví hnědá. Chuť má ve středu nádech praeného sladu, s jemným závanem jahod, okraje jsou sladové a fini je vcelku jemný, zakulacený, nepříli robustní, celková chuť je doprovázena silnějím alkoholovým závojem. Vcelku se jedná o velmi zajímavé pivo kde se snoubí jemná chuť se silnějí a ve krásně ladí dohromady.

Bottle, 12/15/2013. Pours muddy brown, fine off-white head fades to a thin film over the surface, decent build-up of lacing left behind. Aroma is dark over-ripe fruit, raisins with dark wheat, sharp clove and spices, banana bread. Taste is rich dark toffee and caramel, dried fruit with classic weizen-bock character, spices accentuated with booze presence, banana notes more subdued for a nice effect. Rich, round and thick body, almost liqueur-like. Excellent eisbock.
Brilliant when cold. Starts to develop some more undesirable plum flavours later.

Bottle 330 ml, poured into a snifter. ABV 12%
Impressive deep red ruby to brown colour on the body, with a tall and thick off-white to light brown head. Good retention, light lacing on the glass.
Very complex aroma, lots of dark fruits, then red grapes, port wine aroma, raisins, light alcohol that makes the aromas even stronger, ripe pears, sugar. 
Very complex taste as well, on one sip one of the above, on the next all of the above together, on the third something new like the light banana taste. Alcohol is more notable here, both as a light burnig on the tongue and as a warming feeling on the body. 
Full, thick body, with good carbonation. A little bit sticky on the palate.
Overall an impressive beer on all levels. The complexity of aroma and flavour reminded me of the best trappist beers. Really great and for an unbeatable price.

Dark brown pour, thick foamy head that settles down to minimal layer with tiny little bubbles. Aroma is big syrupy malty sweetness, its thick even in the nosterals. Taste is rasins, some spice a bit of harshness from the booze as it warms some butterscotch and nuttiness comes through and the harshness tempers off. Good stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 Pours a murky deep brown with a light tan head. Aroma of wheat, caramel, banana, sugary, dark fruits, plum, raisins, malts. A bit wine-like, with noticeable alcohol in the finish. Beautiful beer, will definitely drink this again this season.

Texture hyper huileuse ! On le voit dès que lon sert la bière. Presque du miel... Un couleur brun sombre. Des goûts de banane séchée, de caramel et de fruits rouges assez intenses. Un goût bien long en bouche et une présence réchauffante de lalcool. 
Très bon mais pas forcément adapté à tous les types dapéro... A découvrir ! 
Attention, ça nourrit pas mal : deux bières de ce type et vous avez fait votre repas !

11.2 oz bottle from Evergreen Discount. Deep brown appearance with a light tan head. Sweet, malty aroma with caramel, sugar, chocolate, bread, clove, banana, dark fruity esters, syrup, alcohol and yeast. Similar flavor, heavy sweetness and minimal bitterness, mostly hiding the alcohol. Medium to full body with a creamy feel and soft carbonation. Too sweet for me.
