Appearance: Dark brown, slightly murky. Good amount of tan head.
Aroma: Wheat, slightly burnt. Fruit, maltiness? Slight alcohol.
Taste: Fruit, some sweetness and alcohol. Pretty good.
Info: 330ml bottle, 3/12-2013, BB: 7/8-2018

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2015 
Look: Pours with rich, large, equal brown head. Retention is fast but equal.
Dark amber, brown, dark wood-like chocolate. 
Cloudy, yeast visible with light carbonation.


Smell: Starts with figs, plums, raisins, then the alcohol notes hit the nerves, feels like you smell these dried fruit soaked in rum - sweet and potent. There is a hint of light acidity - almost wine like, and some apple, fusel notes. Soaked with rich sweetness.


Taste: Fat and rich. Starts with in rum soaked raisins, plums, prunes, reminds of plum wine or maybe Porto and some boozy notes in there. Rich medium/heavy sweetness, munich, caramel dominate. There is a hint of banana and light acidity. It gets a little spicy, probably doe to the high alcohol content which kicks out towards the end but isnt annoying - it sums up all the flavors in a complete image. Gets yeasty towards the end.


Mouthfeel: Full medium heavy body; low carbonation, warming from the alcohol.


Overall: Rich, almost obnoxious but in the end well round and tuned beer. High alcohol content is well incorporated into the flavor and its presence enhances the experience.

Bottle. Very dark brown with a reddish hue, fine frothy tan head, vanishes rather quick, thin rim remains, good lacing; sweet roasty nose, very complex aroma, brown sugar, licorice, dark fruit, raisin, caramel, clove, cinnamon, coffee, herbs, woody; roasty sweetness, mild bitter undertones, sugary, dark fruit, caramel, alcohol; yeasty mouthfeel, heavy body, creamy roasted texture, average carbonation; full sweet malty finish, with hints of coffee, cloves and dark fruit. At the end a shot of alcohol and pepper...

Pours thick, dark brown colour, average brown head. Aroma remembers of sugar, cinnamon, vanilla, toffee, raisins, dark fruits. Body is full, creamy, alcoholic. Low carbonation and long sweet finish. Taste is amazingly balanced: sugar, cinnamon, bread, black fruit.

Interesting style, thought I would give it a whirl

Pours hazy muddy light brown, minimal head.

Smell big wheat sweetness, normal gum and clove accentuated. Some added red fruit.

Taste sweet sticky gum, burn on tail. Weizen comes out more than the bock, sort of like an imperial Hef, but one that tastes good and balanced. 

Stronger, fuller bodied

Nice beer, glad I picked it up

11.2oz bottle into weiss glass. Cloudy mocha with a tall tan head that quickly drops to a ring and leaves spotty lacing. Aroma is banana, bubblegum, clove, and alcohol. Taste is clove, alcohol, phenol, fig, banana, bready malts. Certainly malt-forward, but the sweetness is held in check by the other elements. Medium-full body, very creamy and sticky around the mouth, velvety soft carbonation, with an astringent finish.

0,33l fles, in het glas een zeer troebel donker bruin bier met een fijne crème schuimkraag. Bijzonder biertje, geur is mooi complex met vooral gedroogde pruimen en krenten en wat chocolade. Smaak is overweldigend. In de smaak chocoladerozijnen en overrijpe banaan, ook de alcohol komt nu duidelijk naar voren als in rumrozijnenijs. Body is mooi vol afdronk is zoet met een bittertje.

Pours very dark brown with a nice foam head. Aroma is rich and full, with plum, raisins, honey, muscovado sugar upfront, and fainter tones of caramellized walnuts, figs, dates and cherries. Taste is plum, dates, honey, vanilla, muscovado sugar, roasted walnuts. Very good!

Pours hazy walnut-prune juice brown with a rich tan head in a field of fine bubbles. The head settles quite quickly to a rim and coating and makes a bit of noise doing it. The aroma is totally bananas right off the pour and then yeast, spicy malts with notes of prune and raisin darkfruit. The taste is powerful, striking and complex - have we invaded Belgium? A somewhat syrupy symphony of sweet malty goodness with more banana and dark fruit on the front, followed by a warm river of booze (close your eyes and just float) and closing with clove, nuts and caramel - even chocolate. Velvety mouthfeel. Nothing bitter but potent. The 12% - let's say that I'm feeling no pain. Outstanding - one to remember. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown, cloudy, 
Sweet, syrupy but bitter background and finish. Full body, flavorful. 
Malty, alcoholic, raisiny, banane flambée, 
Good with dessert or instead of. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle shared with Jeevan, bought from Appellation Wines. Chuffing-buggery-fuck this is a great beer. I tried it a couple of years ago and wrote it off as a syrupy mess, but having let it slowly come to room temperature for a couple of hours before opening, and then sipping it over the course of an hour or so... Jesus wept... and well He might. Aromas are all the big banana and clove notes youd expect, taste brings dark fruit in, not the sweet finish I feared, because a clove-spice bitterness creeps up to tickle you into agreeing that this is one of the best beers ever. Ever. Not that Id have it every day mind you.
Color oscuro y espuma poco persistente. Aroma dulce y banana. Sabor a licor y sobretodo plátano flambeado. Bastante persistente. Ideal como copa de noche. Fantástica y sorprendente.

From a bottle. Pours opaque medium brown with a thin beige head. Tastes strong, like alcohol, raisins, caramel, earth, licorice. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like chocolate, raisins, caramel, roasted, bready.

0.5l bottle. Aroma of dried plums, caramel and yeast with alcoholic notes. Plum color, cloudy, nice light beige head. Really complex flavor, dried fruits, caramel, bananas and cloves, a bit sweet and sour. Pleasantly warming alcoholic finish. That is probably the best German beer available nowadays. It should be a great idea to age it.
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 This was just one hell of  a beer. I sense, bread, dough, basement aromas, barnyard...
caramel, bananas, licorice, dark brown, medium sweetness, creamy, medium to full body, fizzy carbonation, long finish. Love this wonderfull beer especially for cold days.
500 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown/mahogany with almost no head. Aromas of molasses, tar, and alcohol. Flavors of liquorice, rich roasted malt, chicory, and burnt sugar. Hot. Exquisite.

Pours a dark cloudy brown. almost chocolate milk like. A very thin, but very persistant head. Aroma of alcohol and sweet bread. Taste is of fruit, bready, roasty. Mouth feel is sufficiently chewy and slightly creamy. But not sticky or overly thick. Goes down very smooth. Excellent.

Pours dark brown to black with thick light tan head. Aroma of spices, caramel, light cherry, earth, hay and blood orange. Taste is sweetish, light alcohol warming with subtle bitterness in the finish. Body is medium to full and creamy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vintage 2009. Bottle: 11756

A: Dark Brown Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Thin Brown Head Ring, Very Minimal Lacing

S: Sweet Bread, Brown Sugar, Raisins, Mild Toffee

T: Brown Sugar, Raisins, Sweet Bready, Mildly Boozy

M: Mediocre Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Boozy, Chewy

Overall, a pretty robust eisbock and full of deep, rich flavors that almost leave it a little thick but has aged very well.

12 oz from the Coop for about $5... enjoyed from my HotD goblet. Not much head at all ... deep amber brew. All sweet bananas and raisins ...a touch of pink bubblegum and cloves.

Deceptively smooth for a brew with this much alcohol ... medium body and pretty explosive carbonation on the palate. Flavor is bananas and the expected bubblegum.. thick "raisin box essence" on the finish. Some caramel mid palate. Lingering spicy clove esters. Very good, but so rich it is only a 1-2/year indulgence.

The beer look good. Had a good sweet of aroma. Initial taste was pretty good. It had a decent palate, but quickly became heavy with citrus, alcohol, cough drop. It might have been better with a blue cheese pairing. I was eating beef.
Aroma of sweet cherries and sweet malt. Beautiful red ebony color. Head lasts forever. Complex flavor of fruit, roasted malt and notes of toffee. Even slightly bitter finish. Outstanding.
Complex aroma of malts and caramel. Rich dark our with thin cream head. Taste of dark roasted malts and caramel. Nice twist with ice distillation.

Darker brown, cloudy body with a tall tan head. Full aroma with dark fruit, yeast, chocolate,alcohol. Big flavor of dark fruit, yeast, banana, vanilla, slightly syrupy with a bit of cherry and the alcohol popping through in the aftertaste. Palate has nice lively carbonation and an oily texture.
poured a dark ruby red brown colour with an off white head. fruity notes of cherries, plums, banana, roasted malts, caramel, raisins, some chocolate. this is one good beer

Opaque brown with a large tan head. Aroma very vinous, cherry, plum, prune, toffee, caramel, coffee liquor. Taste heavy and sweet, vanilla, cherry, dark fruit, chocolate, plum brandy, caramelized banana (or maybe banana bread with maple). Quite remarkable. Palate rich and warming, sweet almost (but only almost) to the point of cloying, with banana notes.
small bottle. 300ml i think. pours a very dark brown/red with no head. syrupy. aroma is heavily of alcohol, spices and toffee. taste is great. lots of alcohol, yeast, fermented fruit.

33cl bottle into tulip. Lille. 

Appearance: very dark brown, completely opaque. Small off white head when poured discipates rather quickly. Nice cloudy effect from the abundant lees. 

Aroma: banana is most present. Dark Chocolate, yeast, dark fruit, alcohol. 

Taste: slight sweetness with a light bitterness. Warming alcohol in he back of he throat. 

Palate: full coating on my mouth, oily texture, good carbonation, good log finish. 

Overall: I actually didnt realize this was the eisbock until I went to open the beer. I just pulled it jockey from the store shelf when I purchased. This was a nice surprise! I havent had the normal aventinus recently to compare, but this was very good. Not super complex, banana and dark chocolate dominates the flavor profile, but the beer does an impressive job of hiding the 12% alcohol. Ill be buying another of these to cellar.
Is there a heaven this is close. Hint of bananas. Not to overwhelming taste of alcohol.

Amazing beer. Poured into a pewter stein. Only hints of banana in the aroma (lots of alcohol though). Taste is a deep over-ripe banana, sweet and lots of booze. For me, this is a fantastic sipping beer. I've got some of these cellaring, really interested to see how they age.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home from St Albans beer fest. Aroma is sweet caramel and raisin and a bit of bannofee pie. Flavour is caramel toffee apple and raisin. Murky brown pour with a thin cream head. Not a looker but very tasty. Spritz carb. Wheat and banana bread.

Great strong beer, mix well with meat and roast in general, you can feel the alcohol without burning your nose.
Its like a very reinforced Aventinus.

For cap colllectors: a violet and grey cap, similar to the label, with the name written.
Very very good weizen bock beer, super taste. 12 % its only advantage. For me this beer have 100/100 points. All beer Schneider are super. This is worl-class.
UPDATED: NOV 20, 2013 Wow that?s strong, but good. Great aroma, fruity and bold. Caramel taste, nice carbonation. A bitter finish on the tongue.

Flaska från beernavigator. En två år gammal flaska. Mahognyfärgad, mycket skum till en början, men det försvinner ganska fort. Tydlig veteölsdoft med sötma, mogen banan och nejlikor men allt med större intensitet och sötma. Krafitg, fyllig, koncentrarad och rustik. Söt men inte sliskig som kulmbachers eisbock, viss vetesyrlighet, torkad frukt, jäst, alkohol, praliner, marsipan och en tydlig men väl integrerad beska. Ett stort öl.

Pours cloudy and dark brown with a dense light tan head. Aroma is their trademark clove and banana with something a little dark and malty somewhere in the background. Taste is banana (!) and clove all day long with a really thick and heavy mouthfeel. The sweetness runs throughout the palate and that banana flavor really picks up at the finish. Nice.

Pours a deep caramel color with a prune aroma. Taste is of raisin and dried fruit. A clean beer that you can barely taste the alcohol content. More of a strong Belgian ale taste rather than an eisbock. An easy drinking beer that had a bitter malt aftertaste.

33cl bottle. Hazy brown/grey with a medium , thick and grey head. Nose : strong banana, caramel, tart. Cooked fruits. Some toffee. Amazing nose. Real pleasure. Sip : thick and oily body. Low carbonation. Sweet with dominating flavors of banana. Develops more fruity notes. Cloying sweet it brings some more character of wood and cooked fruits. It ends with metallic and earthy notes. Caramel notes are dominating. Overall this is a really must try brew. Historically and culturally speaking its one of those beer sampling moment that one will remember for a long time.

The aroma is that of banana, caramel that almost smells like BBQ. Is is a cloudy brown with a weak head that disappeared quickly. It has a good combination of malts with a banana taste that comes with it. There is a hint of raisin as well.

Slightly chilled bottle, 2012 vintage. Cloudy brown with no real head. Smell - spice, wheatjust what I was expecting really. Body is medium, slightly foamy, mid carbonation (more than expected). Taste - spice, lots of alcohol. The wheat beer characteristics are there but theyre masked with an alcohol sharpness. OK overall.

Bottle. Brown, quite foggy with a minimal white head. Aroma has banana, syrup, apricot. 

Taste has citrus, yeast, strong liquorice, anis, yeast and fermented fruit. Alcohol is present but quite well balanced. Carbonation is really low. 

Complex
biere très sombre, peu de mousse. Super arome de vieux fruits, malt grillé et banane. Gout de chocolat et ...corbeille de fruits. On sent aussi lalcool en fin de bouche, un top de bière!
Dark dark amber pour. Overpowering sweet aroma. Swwet taste, syrup consistency. Warms the belly as it finishes. Very strong alcohol taste
Bottle from TWM Sterling - pours murky brown. Great nose, dark fruits, not a lot of alcohol. Nice body, great beer!

Dark and deep brown, thin tan tinted head. Looks great. Fruity notes, esters, plum and raisins, some banana and clove spice. Flavour is sweet, complex and fruity, backed by some warming alcohol. Soft carbonation, big bodied and slick mouthfeel.
brown, small fizzy off-white head with short retention and no lacing. dates, raisin, molasses, fruit preserves, yeast, toffee. very sweet, light bitter. full body, slick feel, moderate carb.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a thick fluffy off white head. Aroma is nutty and toffee. Taste follows suit and adds some clove, bubblegum and a huge alcoholic punch. Incredibly smooth and full palate. Very pleased with my introduction to this style.

Another day, another style tick. Tastes like a strong ale to me. Scent is grapes and caramel. Pours brown with orange tint. White head. Taste is all sweet and no bitter. Carbonated with medium body. Bottle - Ale Yeah! - Decatur, Georgia
Deep brown pour with medium fluffy white head. Strong sweet banana clove/bubblegum nose. Smooth sweet malty body. Big semisweet boozy warming finish. A classic
Deep amber colour, head was literally gone in less than a minute. very sweet bubblegum like aroma..very sweet. flavour was also quite fruity.

Drank out of bottle, so giving appearance a 3. Aroma rich, hint of vanilla. Taste... Purely amazing. A lot going on. Vanilla, dark fruits, caramel, hint of almost cherry, heavy on the alcohol but not overly so (pleasantly warming). Perfect carbonation, creamy and velvety on the tongue. I am impressed!

Camping rating. 11.2oz bottle, courtesy of a forgetful visitor. Dark, reddish / cola-brown color; fine, off-white bubbles; excellent lacing. Lots of overripe dark fruits and dried fruits in the nose; vinous warming alcohol. Medium-full body; dense dried fruits (raisins, dates), and fruity alcohol; plenty of complexity (oak, vanilla) but heavy on the alcohol and overly warming.

Murky brown with large, thick, creamy lasting kaki head. Aroma is thick, delicious wheat, banana, clove, some malt. Flavor is much the same but with some alcohol. Delicious. Full body. Chewy and creamy. Wow. Das goooood.

Aroma. wheat, banana, a little dark fruit. Sweet. Smells fresh and refreshing.
Tastes malt and banana. Similar to the aroma.
Mmmmmm.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2014 Poured from a bottle into an Aventinus glass. Deep copper color with a light off-white head. Aroma was sweet and cloying. Tasted of sweet maltiness, and ripe dark fruits. No perceptible hops. Very enjoyable.
330 ml bottle. Dark ruby with thin white head. Aroma fruity; cherries, wheat and plums. Taste is slightly tart, cherries, fruit and some wheat. Nice

Yeasty hazy brown in colour with a lovely pillowy soft beige/tan long lasting head. Creates nice viscousity and lacing. On the nose malt bread, biscuit, grain flour and sweet sultana/raisin cake and caramel sticky toffee pudding aromas develop. Soft CO2 on the palate fading quickly into a creamy velvet slick texture with a full body and tastes of well balanced sweetness. The finish is at first full and heavy fading swiftly into a malt sweet cake linger on the palate. Excellent beer for desserts!

Bouteille 33cl, BB 19/02/2018.
Couleur acajou, col épais blanc cassé laissant un léger filament au verre.
Arôme est profond dans son aspect fruité noir suivi dune pointe dester typique des blanches allemandes. Note fine de banane-levure suivi de ce côté fruité fermenté et baies. Léger malté accompagné dune pointe de chocolaté.
Palais est épais, fruité noir sur ce fond de Deutsche Weisse et desters - banane. Alcool est de suite présent et les 12% ne sont pas cachés mais contribuent néanmoins à développer la complexité de la bière. Note de sucre brun, fruité noir; date et prune. Lamertume simmisce en fin de bouche ajoutant ce léger côté houblonné. Fini laisse apparaitre un côté liquoreux sucré collant aux lèvres. Reste complexe, malts pâle cara crystal avec une belle effervescence.

From bottle. Very dark brown in color, with lots of sediment. Aroma is sweet toffee, prune, and alcohol. Taste is prune, grape, caramel, and dark malt. Quite concentrated sweet dark fruit aftertaste with a smooth, though potent, alcohol warming.

Bottle - pours very dark brown with some floating particles. Nose is strong of molasses, booze, caramel, and grape soda. Very frothy mouthfeel. Taste is molasses and a very strong booze backend. Alcohol aftertaste lingers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Caramel, bread, nuts, roasty, butterscotch, coffee, alcohol very nice, highly recomended

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2015 Bottle. Aroma nicely strong and spicy. Raisins, plums, lightly smoky. Hazy dark brown colour. Taste has strong unhidden alcohol. Plums, raisins, spicy. Light chilli. Interesting, but not very enjoyable IMHO. Too strong alcohol and spicy.Rerate at RJ. The spiciness is mostly clove, there is some fruitiness but not the raisins/plums of ordinary strong beers, rather general ambiguous fruitiness, maybe light banana. However alcohol is on top and the rating remains the same.
Bottle. Pours dark brown, beige head. Aroma of blackberries, alcohol, strong aroma, strawberries, strawberries jam, chilli. Taste is strawberry, alcohol, medium sweet, low bitterness. Nice one.
Bottled. Overall fantastic! Alcohol is dominating this beer. The alcohol is warming, i sense a lot of rauch characteristics. Taste is a bit of chili. Overall a great beer!
Strong aroma, alcohol where it has to be (inside me, hehe), easy to find at a good price, and a really good beer. Everytime I have recommended it, I was succesfull

33 cl flaske, 12 %, købt i SuperBest, Rødovre Centrum, vinter 2013.
Uklar brunlig stærk tysker med flygtigt moccafarvet skum.
Citrus og krydderier i humlenduftindtrykket og desuden noter af rosin og sveske.
Første smagsindtryk er kraftigt sødt og middel syrligt og den lange eftersmag holder på dét indtryk. 
God, fyldig smag og mundfylde som giver et tykt indtryk med middel kulsyre. En helt særlig øl! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Tilleys, Newcastle on 27 July 2013.
Pours a murky brown with a tan head, which dissipated quite rapidly, though there was noticeable carbonation. Not too much of a looker, to be honest. Wonderful aroma, though. Cloves, banana, dates and a nice whiff of alcohol. Velvety mouth feel with flavours of toffee, figs, treacle, biscuit and wheat. Sweet malts and warming alcohol linger on the palate.

Got that sexy wheat head on it. The nose is intensely fruity in an over-ripe mango kind of way a tiny touch of spice underneath too. Rich, thick and fruity it he mouth too with very Christmassy flavours and a touch of heat to the finish.

Muddy brown appearance. Candied malt aroma. Licorice, clove, banana, and alcohol flavors. Full bodied. Finish is wet w/ prune flavors. Syrupy and sticky palate. As it warmed it kept getting worse in my opinion. The potent alc flavor mellowed, but it became so syrupy and sticky sweet I could barely finish it.
Very complex eisbock, with a banana touch and, in overall, a great alcohol flavour. Very strong, adecuate for winter but I could drink it during all year. Great consistency. A beer for enjoy slowly.
Amber dark brown pour. Lots of clove and some banana. Thick but smooth mouthfeel. Picked up at Randall's in St. Louis.
Doften är mogna hallon/jordgubbe och kanske banan. Karaktär av madiera samt olivspad. Smaken är syrlig, maltig med toner av dadlar, väldigt söt. Spännande öl med en trevlig avslutning!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Old rating rerated 13.08.2013, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Small creamy shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly concentrated and fruity, raisins, toffee, broth, caramel, dark sugar, anchovies, grass, almond essence, salty licorice, and strangely even very concentrated sour apples as in an ice cider. Taste is slightly metallic-sourish-grassy something, dark malts, grass, oak, dark dried fruits, licorice, almond essence, burnt caramel, toffee, alcohol. Medium bitterness, a little thin mouthfeel. Nice.

Pours dark murky brown with nice head. Aromas contains banana, alcohol, brown sugar and roast. Tastes dark fruits with a noticeable alcohol presence but it suits the beer.

Recommended
Bottle. Ruby brown color with a frothy beige head. Smooth aroma of clove and banana. Some sourness in taste. Full body. Nice warming finish from alcohol.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2015 Dark brown and cloudy. Aroma has some liquorice and bay leaf as well as alcohol. Quite a thick, rich feel Its sweet with a background of dried fruits, warming spice and a kick of alcohol.

2013 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours a murky, dirty brown color with a dense khaki head and nice sticky lacing. Aroma is very complex with an assortment of dark fruits, dank malt, a little caramel, soy sauce and alcohol. Taste has all the same elements with a little sweetness that is cut by the alcohol. A little spiciness is a nice compliment. Has a full, thick mouthfeel with a little alcohol burn. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled in 2012. Thick dark brown body and a small off-white creamy head that lasts. Nice lacings. Aroma of alcohol, banana, roasted malt, brow sugar, licorice. The taste is heavy sweet. Full body, sticky texture and a thick feel. Long sweet finish and nice aroma.

Pours chestnut brown with two fingers of off white head with good retention but little lacing, not surprising for a12% beer. Big raisin and plum aromas with some caramel sweetness and alcohol spiciness. Taste starts with some earthy and toasty malt which is immediately overtaken by the raisin and plum flavors. Some vinous qualities with a honey sweetness and some spiciness from the alcohol along with some warming in the throat and stomach. Finishes semi sticky. Mouthfeel is creamy with a full body and medium/high carbonation. This was a big, flavorful beer that hides the alcohol well. Would be a good winter sipper or something to have with a berry pie and ice cream.

Dark brown pour with medium sized off white head. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel sweetness, slightly floral. Taste of malts, caramel, doughy, figs. and dried fruits. High carbonation and a slightly dry fruity finish. Alcohol well hidden and this went down very fast, excellent beer.

Pours a beautiful furniture brown color with amber hues. Aromas of figs, plums, raisins, molasses, spice, and esters. Rich, smooth palate with flavors of cloves, baking spice, banana, sugar, molasses, and greatness. Nice rich semi sweetness on the finish. World class beer.

A cloudy coffee brown coloured beer with a weak beige head. Typical wheat beer aromas of clove, cinnamon and tropical fruits, but these are over-powered by a sweet malt aroma and a certain yeasty sourness. Dry, but rich mouthfeel. A potent taste, all the expected wheat beer elements, especially banana and clove, but then a hefty alcoholic, port-like taste adds a sourness to the finish, not for the faint-hearted!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Head: light beige, medium, sparkling, almost no retention. Colour: dark mahogany. 

Aroma: sweet and sour dried fruit, alcohol, caramel, right after puring some doughy aroma (yeast or malt?). 

Taste: intense, dried fruit: prunes, raisins, some warming alcohop, phenol bitterness.

A sort of Aventinus on steroids. Complex and full bodies like a belgian abt. The alcohol is very well hidden.
A fruity sweet flavor with barrel aged notes almost like port. A very alcoholic mouthfeel. Color is caramel brown with a white head.

My first eisbock! Bottle #2012 79464. Pours into my tulip brownish purple, cloudy, with a creamy looking light khaki head. Aroma is huge aromatic fruits, figs, plums, black cherry, pears, caramel, chocolate. Flavor is a mix of chocolate fig and salty caramel. Intense mix of flavors here. Hints of spice and light alcohol bite. Creamy mouthfeel yet plenty of carbonation. Very sweet. Tasty stuff.

Appearance: Utter, complete, total perfection. Caramel syrup with cotton foam. Extremely thick. There is complete darkness; no light gets through when held up to light.

Smell: Bananas. Cloves. Chocolate. Bubblegum. Smells like a hef on steroids. Sweet maple syrup with a hint of pine. Smells like whiskey when it warms.

Taste/Mouthfeel: This stuff is strong. Extremely full-bodied. Pine, caramel, cloves, and a hint of maple hit you first. Then the bourbon, vanilla, and oak, followed by plum and banana. Some coffee in the finish. Tastes like an IPA, hef, and stout all in one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Prachtige, chocoladebruine mocca kleur. Volle fijne kraag. Ruikt aan de ene kant zoetig, caramel en aan de andere kant zurig en bitter. Smaakt apart. Heeft een zoetige, caramel, chocolade en vanille smaak met ook weer frisse tonen. Zware brandende nasmaak.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2015 dark brown colour, moderate creamy beige head; aroma of dried fruits, raisin,banana, lot of maltyness and alcohol; taste of intensive malty sweetness, dried fruits,some banana, intensive alcoholic spiciness and significant bitter aftertaste; its more like a liqueur, than a beer, but I liked it very much

bottle. brown murky, one of the most dirty looking beers Ive drunk. rediculously overripe bananas, really sweet raisins. body full, well carbonated. syrupy sweetness, a lot of esters, some phenols. long (too long actually) finish with the same dried fruit sweetness met before. really flavourful, a bit overpowering.-- bb/wp8

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2013 33cl bottle. Nice dark brown-ruby color with a quite fast diminishing head. Aroma is Intense quite complex: sweet, winy, a bit sour, chocolate, alchool, wild fruits. Flavor is sweet, fruity, (apple?) the alchool can be felt but in a plesant way, chocolate, very complex. Oily and sticky texture. Becomes better and better as it warms up.

33cl bottle from Liebick Getränke in Germering. Pours a deep, ruby-brown colored body with an inch thick, creamy and frothy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is pretty awesome with raisin and plum dark fruits, chocolate covered bananas, a slightly sweet wheat maltiness, toffee, hints of roast, and a bit of a clove spice. Flavor is solid as well. Prunes, raisins, and plums up front with a slightly sweet wheat maltiness. Some clove spice throughout with touches of roast, some chocolate and banana, a touch of toffee, and a pleasing alcohol warmth. Finishes a bit sweet, but somewhat spiced with a hint of roast showing up. The alcohol note provides a nice balance, actually. Lengthy aftertaste following a rich, full body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a fantastic beer. Sweet with plenty of dark fruits, but a nice spiciness, alcohol warmth, and chocolate covered banana note to keep this extremely enjoyable. One of my go-to nightcap beers at Schneider Weisse in Munich over the last 4 months. Wonderful.

This brew was fantastic. It poured a cloudy/murky yellowish-brown with a soft frothy head. The aroma was full of berries, caramel, spices and banana. Flavors were bold; rich toffee and dried banana peels among clove, caramel and cherries. Glad I finally found this one.

impresionante! color marron turbio a la nariz banana ,floral y se siente ya la alta gradacion alchoolica, al paladar corposa, intensa,los mismos sabores de la aventinus pero mas espesos y cargados,deja un muy buen aftertaste.fantastica!
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: A bit rougher than the normal Aventinus. It has the banana aroma and dense malty taste, and more of the intense sweet raisin flavor. The alcohol is still pretty well buried under all the heavy flavors and smells even though its like two beers crammed in one bottle. Overall Id take the regular Aventinus but I certainly would not turn one of these down.
Testar en 10 och 12 vertikalt. Ingen årgånskillnad att prata om. Härligt maltig och ganska tung. Alkoholen känns, men inte så det stör.

thanks to zenkis.. huge beer.
Cloudy deep brown with medium off white stable head. Lacing
Aroma.. uhmm.. complex fruity, some interesting spices, thou not too pushy. Quite malty, caramel, yeast, bit alcohol
Sweet with some bitterness.
Enjoyed a lot. Something like quad exp
Bottle thanks to Jason: Pours amber color with little fast head. Smells and tastes sweet...hubba bubba like, fruity and the alcohol well hidden. Great refreshing drink
Mørk amber farve med beige skum. Lukt av malt og frukt. Smak av malt og vinøse frukttoner. Cardinal.
Fin nøttebrun gyllen farge. God lukt av malt og krydder. Herlig smak av karamell og krydder.

Bottle at Epic Beer Festival 2013. Pour is murky amber with a big cream head and decent lacing. Figgy, herbal dark fruity, licorice, raisins, brown sugar, pruney, and caramelly aroma. Taste is wheaty, light banana, clove, figs, bready, licorice, and a touch roasty. Slick mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Pretty tasty stuff.

Poured from a 500 mL bottle into a stem glass. Generous brown head that is slow to fade leaving nice lacing. Aroma is is sweet malt, barley, wheat, with a hint of spice and cloves. Flavour is rich malt and wheat with layers of brown sugar and molasses. Amazing dark wheat beer.

Pours a very dark brown body with a small, off-white head that reduces to a partially covering film and additional build-up of bubbles at the walls of the glass. Not much of these bubbles stick to the glass. The aroma is strong, sweet and complex. Its malty with lightly roasted notes, but most of all I get sweet dark dried fruits. Also well integrated vinous alcohol, port wine, brown sugar and a herbal Jägermeister touch. Moderate to heavy sweet taste with a light bitter finish. Quite strong flavours with dark malts, dark dried fruits (but also with a hint of banana in the back), vinous alcohol, cough syrup and traces of almonds, Amaretto and cherry kernels. Full bodied with a syrupy texture and soft carbonation. A nice first impression of this beer style. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 2.5 years after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

Bottle. Pours a murky brown, creamy white head (think Guinness) with outstanding retention. Nose is complex: dried fruit, caramel, yeast. Mouth is fruity, malty, creamy yet chewy, lots of dates, raisins, figs, toffee, malty goodness, warm finish. First time I had this was in Seattle with my brother last August, but I didnt rate it then. Its a memorable brew and must say for the record that I fucking LOVE this beer. Prost mein freunden!

Pours murky brown colour with two finger beige, frotty head. Aroma is caramel, dark fruits, raisins, sweet malts. Taste has all of these components with a nice alcohol warming effect at the back. Full body, medium carbonation. Finish is sweet and malty.

Bottle 33 cl from Maruhn - Darmstadt (D). Dark brown with a clear beige head drawing to the glass. Aromas very fruity, plum, banana, cacao, spices, toffee, caramel, molasses, pepper and german pumpernickel. The mouth is unctuous, syrupy, warm and very rich. Acidity present, taste strong, concentrated and sugary, fruity, complex, esters. Heady beer, bitterness in finale and residual sweet flavors.

AROMA: alcohol, port, wood, 
APPEARANCE: brown, clear, frothy, white foam, 
TASTE: light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
PALATE: medium body, sticky, fizzy, astringent, bitter, long finish, 
OVERALL: overpowering alcohol and fizz, interesting notes of wood and port, but not sufficient to make this a repeat.

The aroma blends scents of caramel malts, sour fruits, and dough yeast, and the appearance has an opaque brown color with a small off-white head that fades to a ring quickly. The taste is mildly sour, slightly sweet, and a touch umami, and the palate combines a soft carbonation, full body, thin texture, and a long finish.
malt, plum and seasoning aromas. unclear with a thin head.   sweet taste  long fine aftertaste and mouthfeeel
UPDATED: JUN 16, 2013 This is a heavy beer. It has a sweet, raisins/fig/date smell.  Very thick, with a hunt of belgian spice. Excellent balance for the high sugar and alcohol.

Color caoba con espuma beige. Aromas dulces, pasas y frutos rojos. En boca comienza con un dulzor tostado que rápidamente pasa a un sabor agrio y afrutado intenso y equilibrado con un toque alcohólico.

Bottle from 2010: Dark brown pour with a light tan head. Aromas of malt, yeast, and candied fruit. Big malty flavor with dried fruit notes and wheat shining through. The abv is just barely noticable with a nice warming sensation. Delicious!

Appearance: Dark nutty brown color with a big frothy tan head. Ok lacing.Aroma: Slightly sweet dark malty, wheat and some dried fruit.Palate: Medium + body. A bit sweet and a moderate bitterness. Rich carbonation. Soft texture.Taste: Sweet caramel malty, wheat and dried fruit (plum/raisins). Some warming alcohol in the back.Overall impression: Lovely and well balanced, although it was a bit sweet.Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with Grima

2010 Vintage bottle # 009165

A - Pours a hazed russet brown with a fleeting cream colored head.

S - Caramelized cherry caramel aroma, plums, molasses, leather, cinnamon, allspice, prunes, very complex aroma of malts.

T - Sweet carmalized brown sugar, molasses just blankets the palate. Cherries, plums, red Bartlet pears, caramelized plantains, hints of cinnamon and all spice, some minor bitterness on the edges,

M - Chewy but smooth feel, light side of full bodied, low but spritzy carbonation.

I havent had one fresh but this 2 year old is tasting mighty fine. Awesome yeast works with multiple layers of malt. Very complex flavors. One to be sipped and pondered on for sure.

Serving type: bottle

05-06-2012
Smaksprøve på Tap1 mai-13: hvis man liker søtt, sterkt hveteøl av typen bokkøl er dette et must. Et klasseøl fra Schneider, selv om alkoholen kan bli litt for fremtredende.

11.2 oz bottle.  Pours a very deep brown with enormous fizzy tan head.  Aroma is sweet and mostly caramel malt with some fruity notes and grain.  Sweet flavor with some wheat and perhaps plum as well.  Full creamy mouthfeel with some warming from alcohol content in the finish.  My first eisbock and a very good one.
Banana and herbs in aroma. Nice dark amber color. Taste is very well balanced so high alcohol content is only noticed by warm feeling in aftertaste.
Pours a nice brown amber beer with a good white head. Smells odd. Herbs. Wow. Ok. Taste is odd too. Palate is perfect.

A dark brown color with huge khaki colored head. Smells of brown sugar, fig, caramel, a small amount of floral hops. Taste is quite sweet with those same scents coming through on the taste as well. Alcohol is well hidden but still apparent if you take too big a gulp. No bitter, just a good sweet taste off set but a maltiness, delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Unclear brown. Strong taste with hints of weissbier and caramel. Alcohol is rather evident.

Dark muddy brown, thin grey head - its no looker; smells like the souped-up wheat beer that it is: wheat, alcohol, dubble-bubble and Christmas spices; tastes sweet, with an attack of spicy fruit: raisins, plums, prunes, burnt orange; sprinkled with plenty of brown sugar, some dark malts to balance not as thick as you might expect (or would like); long sweet malty finish; an enjoyable sugar- and alcohol- kick, but not as complex as Id hoped for a beer of this strength.

Bottle, at home. Deep, dark hazy brown, small off-white head, no lacing. The nose is perfumy, wheaty, some medicinal yeastiness - pepto-bismol -  some bubblegum, licorice and booze. Full mouth, good and foamy. Taste was boozy initially with some acidity at the back of the mouth - the bubblegum, slight chemical taste came through strongly too. Yeah, OK.

330ml bottle. Pours a cloudy dark chocolate brown colour, foam beige head and aroma of banana, dark malt, wheat, fruits, yeast. Taste is sugary sweet, with malt, liquorice, plum, cherry, banana, vanilla & yeast notes. Milky mouth feel, full bodied, soft carbonation, warming alcohol finish. Quite drinkable.

Appearance: Very dark brown, with a slight fogginess / murkiness. The head is a work of art, with amazingly consistent tiny beige bubbles, almost all the exact same size. Close to perfect in appearance, but let down by the lack of clarity and some small particulate matter.

Aroma: Sweet dark fruits (plums, cherries, dates, figs, currants) initially, mixed with some sweet malt and honey. Slight unfermented wort aroma appears, and some caramelised sticky-bun type notes.

Taste: There was a lot going on here. The same dark fruit in the aroma, but the taste is almost as if they were stewed and candied. Very smooth malt and caramel, with rich juicy Port / Torquay aspects as well. Honey, brandy, grape skins, and a herbal aspect in the aftertaste. Warmth from the alcohol helps boost the aftertaste, and helps offset the sweetness. Well balanced bitterness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-full body with medium-low carbonation. Thick and rich, but never heavy. If I had to pick any flaw, maybe a little astringent and a little too dry.

Overall: This is probably the best beer that I have had in a long, long time. It is extremely satisfying, amazingly balanced, and just so drinkable. It is something that can truly be appreciated sip-by-sip, like a fine wine or liqueur. I am interested in seeing how this one does with some age on it.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Bottle at home. Shared with Mathieu87.
I was expecting quite something from this beer, had heard a lot of good things, though, couldnt be more disappointed...
Appearance: dark brown beer, nice mocha rather stable head.
Nose: sugar, liquorice, wood, malts, rather heavy nose in general.
Taste: lots and lots of sugar, very dense, liquorice, smoked ham? quite some alcohol. Really not my type of beer...

Pours a sewerage mucky brown. Aroma huge belgium yeast banana sweet note and cheese soy notes. Taste is has a licorice root beer belgium yeast note followed with some barnyard funk and vanilla and banana notes also a sirloin steak note. Medium mouth feel wet finish. At over 12% abv is completely hidden.  Extremly complex difficult beer to dissect. Extraordinary brew!

Dark. Minimal head. Dried fruit and malt. Intense but very drinkable. Better than the standard Aventinus.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy toffee color. Big light tan head. Plenty of lacing. Malt and bananas tickle my nostrils. Taste is a great sampling of the nose. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Well balanced heavy alcohol wheat beer.. cherry aroma and flavor ..robust dark in color.. definitely a nice quick buzz ..would absolutely recommend this to any avid craft beer drinker

Bottle from Stirchleywines. Very dark brown beer with a small beige head and a little lacing. Aroma of fruity malts, chocolate and raisins. The taste is raisins, some chocolate, more fruity malts, sweet dark toffee and spices. There is a little bit of alcohol in there, but no where near as strong as you would expect. This is full bodied and very smooth, but a little sticky afterwards. This is a complex, multi faceted amazing beer. Is this the best Eisbock or do they all taste as good as this.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Pre lunch beer at Cherry Reds. Beauty. Fruity and dark. Nice buzz going, football on the box, just about forgotten the silly tit who was arguing in favour of the bedroom tax. Wheres me chicken?

Pours in dark ruby body with tan one-finger head. Aroma is fruity fighting with the high alcohol content, but thats about the only flaw. Little bit yeasty. Taste is a fruit basket, full of blueberry, cherry like tones and toffee sweetness, chessnut. Full body with low carbonation, high alcohol. I love it.
Smak och doft av humle, malt, vete med toner av karamell, frukt och godis. Lagom besk, stor sötma, kraftig.

0.33 l bottle from Kehlheim... Nice dark, almost black color, stabile head... Very strong alcohol as well as nice banana  aroma... light sweetness, lightly sour taste... Flavor of poor alcohol, even a little bit like liquor... creamy full body, good ending...

Bottle. Massively thick, creamy cap atop an ultra-hazy muddy brown base. Aroma is heavy raisin & licorice. Bready. Cripes, the aroma is INTENSE. So brilliant. Taste is the same strong raisin, but bananas, a bit of vanilla with a gentle spice. This is 12%?! Pretty thick carbonation (nothing surprising) but, cripes, such a great drink.

Pours a dark red with high carbonation to take any chance of a head away. Aromas of big bananas, big toffee, tootyfruity gum, just a slight hint of alcohol, caramel, and some coriander. Flavors of tootyfruity gum upfront, alcohol through the nose that clouds the flavors, toffee, slight banana, and light coriander. Medium spicy notes, alcohol light to medium in strength noticed through nose mostly, slightly sour finish, medium sweet. First Eisbock.

330mL bottle.  Bottle number 2006/13313.  Purple hued.  Aroma of sweet toasted malt & a hint of malt vinegar (its an old bottle).  Smells of mixed berries and yeasty esters.  Whoa, STRONG.  Complex malt flavors!  Flavors of sweet fruit, bubblegum, over-ripened bananas, booze, brown sugar, sourness & toast.  Lingering flavors of fruit on the palate.  Thick & syrupy textured.  Its a German BarleyWine.  

(3689)

Aroma-Yeast, Banana bread.  Ap. Black pour with a greyish thinness.  Looks like a coca-cola.  Medium head, large bubbles, non-lasting.  WANG, but smooth.  I was halfway through this beer very quickly.  The Belgian Wang (yes I know the beer is German Im about the Wang is Belgian ) eases into a smooth sourness. Tastes a little like "sour patch kids" if you know what they are.  some sediment a very drinkable light carbonation.  worked my way into this one.  Wad not a fan at first, but really enjoyed it at the end.   being my first beer I realized it has a nice kick.  Wow 12 percent by volume now that I look at the bottle.   Alcohol is masked well.

Deep brownish red. Little to no off-white head. Aroma is strong dark brown wheat. Flavor is dark wheat lots of bitterness and a hint of finishing sweetness. I dont know why but these dunkels are just awesome. As for the ice brewing, well, it must be rewarding to conduct. And... its so smooth I thought it was 7%.

330ml bottle. Pours an opaque black, with a large light beige head, which lasts well and leaves decent lacing. Savoury cured meat notes mix with Turkish coffee, bittersweet dark chocolate and spice, with cloves particularly noticeable. Concentrated dark chocolate and Turkish coffee up front slide smoothly into weighty, savoury flavours of cured meats and dark bread in the mid-palate. There is a touch of typical weizen banana and cloves, wrapped up in bittersweet cocoa, leading through into a savoury, spicy finish. This is one serious beer: an intense, concentrated blend of dark, bittersweet and savoury flavours. Excellent stuff.

Trüber, brauner Weizenbock mit reichlich Schaum. Hefiger Früchtekuchen in der Nase samt Gewürznelke und Kardamom. Die sehr konzentrierten Aromen setzen sich im Geschmack fort. Trotz der 12% Alk. gefährlich süffig und nur minimal spritig. N!ce!

Poured flat and muddy brown-but a fantastic aroma-think chocolate raisin bar with bananas and a selection box of other flavours-kept changing so hard to describe. Really nice taste and palate which again kept changing.

Deep copper, hazy, persistent off-white head.  Rich bready malt, toffee, Munich-like melanoidins, raisins, figs, spicy clove phenols, light banana esters, warming alcohol.  Full mouthfeel, medium/high carbonation.

Tap into sniffer. Muddy brown with dense off white head. Honey nose. Intense ale flavor with an undertone of sour, almost like a mild Flemish sour. Aftertaste pops the spot with a bit of lingering high alcohol sweet. Obscenely easy going for 12%

Real wheatty taste, kind of a bread taste, you can smell the alcohol, 12%ABV which I  love, gives it an extra kick. After taste is pure hoppy, not sure of the IBU but just a little high for this type of beer in my opinion. The appearance is just merky. 

I love this beer, my favorite Eisbock.

2013/04/18 - Pours a dark ruby red/brown color with a thick, foamy tan head. Aroma is yeast, wheat, cloves, banana and dark fruits. Taste is yeast, spices, banana, and dark fruits with a sweet, boozy aftertaste. Mouthfeel is thick and sticky with a warming finish. Less carbonation than expected, and a little sweeter than i typically drink, but I would definitely drink again. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown with a tan head. Aroma is full of brown sugar, alcohol and bananas. The flavor is similar with some heavy toffee and caramel malt. I also get some brown sugar and cloves. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Dark ruby almost no head. Aroma: weiz yeast, caramel, booze, fruits, rich. Taste: wheat, banana, sweet, slightly spicy, caramel. Really nice!

Bottled	12/04/13.  A cola dark coloured beer with a purple hue and no head.  Massive volume of carbonation on the pour though.  A strong sweet boozy alcoholic drink.  Lots of plummy notes and some black pepper too.  Good sticky fruits but somehow doesnt taste as strong and long as expected.

Bottle # 2012-189427

Expected concentraced Aventinus and was not dissappointed.

Complex aroma, with hints of alcohol, banana and vanilla. Nice thick head, that quickly dissipates however. Taste is malty, sweet at first, but then a bitter finish, the high abv is noticeable but not unpleasant. Palate is sticky, full bodied. Almost like Im sipping whiskey when drinking this! This is an all-time favourite of mine!
Okay...if this is what they call the best Eisbock then it most definately is not my style at all...too sweet and too alcoholic.

Poured from 330 ml bottle.

Murky, dark brown with noticeable sediment, a khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of wheat toast, caramel, banana, yeast, nutmeg and allspice.

Taste of roasted malt, toasted wheat, brown sugar, dark fruit and yeast.

Medium/full body and medium/high carbonation.  Nice, smooth mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear dark mahogany with a thin, fizzy, somewhat lasting white head. Smells of roasted malt, dark fruit - plums, raisins, straw, liquorish, liquor alcohol ness with mead. Full  smooth oily body with faint carbonation. Lots of sweetness with a clear alcohol presence that should smooth out in a few years. Fruit fills the taste (apple), dried fruit -prunes, dates, raisins with toasted malt, caramel and  ends with some wheat/banana. Complex and very smooth. A world classic. Sweet.
Of all the dark fruits and berries there is, raisins are most dominant in this one. Oily texture. Nice.
Flaske medbrakt av esp0r. Drukket på hytta. Mørk colafarget, skumrand, smaker plomme I Madeira,hvete,alcohol. En sinnsykt bra øl

bottle from 2009, from Smith4498.. I never knew when to drink this and finally I was sick of looking at it so down it goes, a big caramelly thick chewy syrupy beer.. lots of flavor but lots of chewiness. glad I split it 50/50 with someone.

This beer lingers on the wild side. Aroma of heavy booze. Pillowy head of cream with great lacing, pours very cloudy dark brown.Has a creamy texture with a little sense of syrup. Some light carbonation - more than the other eisbocks Ive tried. Aroma of raisins and florals with some residual oakiness in taste. Also a little bitterness and sweetness. Nice. Bottle.
Wow. A caramel-fruity taste, with a distinct presence of alcohol. Not recommended for an evening of fast-paced drinking with the boys. Highly recommended for a relaxed sunday afternoon.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Torbido color marrone con saponosa schiuma beige. Al naso è prevalentemente fruttata e caramellata, dolciastra e maltata; il gusto è pieno e rotondo, purtroppo anche un po acidulo, offre note di nocciole e banana. Corpo generoso irrobustito dallabv, liquorosa, intensa e persistente. Buona, alla spina emerge maggiormente il carattere dolciastro dello zucchero caramellato.

Had this at a friends house the night before another friends wedding, as a gift of some sort, but Im basically gonna do this one from memory. It had a big time dark fruity character and the malts were assaulting my palate big time. Got about half-way through this before realizing it was 12% but should have known it would be that high with how boozy it seemed to be. Definitely something I would like to try again at my own disposal.
Definitely a standout beer. Well rounded with long aftertaste. Highly recommended.

Pouring cold, will review at room temp. pours a mahogany brown unfiltered. Off white carbonation, quickly fleeting. Aromas of bread and vanilla with sour cherry and gin. Taste is warm and malty with almost Abbey like flavours. Albeight from the house yeast. Subtle fruity finish, that dries to near green banana. Overall great balance of wheat, yeast and alcohol.
Bottle->snifter.  Pours a very murky brown with bare offwhite head.  Aroma:bananas, spices, dates.  Taste: wheat, figs, banana, booze.  Light carbonation, nice lasting aftertaste.

12 oz. bottle.  Served in a snifter.  Pours a dark brown with a slight, off-white head.  Theres a lot going on in this beer.  Aromas of bubblegum, cotton candy, and prominent cloves; the flavors match the aromas, with the addition of licorice hints.  Well carbonated.  Except for the burn in the back of the throat in the finish, alcohol is hidden well.  An incredibly complex beer.

Aroma de banana e canela, forte e amadeirado, duradouro. Sabor levemente adocicado com toques de cravo, banana, canela, café, terra. Cerveja com aparência e textura oleosa, final levemente amargo, com sabor agradável e duradouro no palato. Boa formação de espumas. É uma Weizen-Bock de respeito. Super agradável. Deliciosa.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2013 I love the historical description, never forgetting a typical bavarian maximum superlative with not a single drop of evidence to sustain it. But this is indeed quite nice. Perhaps the best feature is the aroma. It is not only fruity, but oily. I say oily not as in the leathery nose of some imperial stouts, but as in olive oil, frying garlic and anchovies. I am not taking the mick. This is exactly what I got. Very stimulating. The look is pretty average and the flavours are full of bananas, biscuits and cinammon, as the best hefe weizen one could find. Great drink, never to be refused.
Very nice sweet, banana nutty aroma.  Big boozy caramel malty and umami flavors.  Splendid carbonation.  Lingering bready aftertaste - just a wonderful palate.  Really good beer.  My first Eisbock.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 2013-12-25
33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy/cloudy ruby red brown with tan head. 
Aroma vanilla, banana, wheat, some alcohol, caramel, red fruits. 
Taste caramel vanilla banana sweets, little hoppy bitter.
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Amazing complex, again so much is going on. 

2013-02-03
33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazu/cloudy ruby red brown with tan head. 
Aroma vanilla, wheat, banana, raisin, caramel. 
Taste vanilla banana sweet, small bitter. 
Mouthfeel oily, creamy. 
Awesome beer so much going on in the taste and aroma.

11.2oz bottle. Bottle code is "2012 31906". Very dark amber / brown color. Good thin khaki head. Little loose lace. Awesome nose. Classic weizen yeast (banana) and something savory... Ive smelled it and gotten it 3 times before typing this out, but I swear, fried egg. The kind of fried egg you smell when you wake up stumble down the stairs into the kitchen and someone awesome is frying you some eggs, thats the kind of fried egg note Im trying to describe. Lightly smokey, even. Good nutty malt characteristic. Sweet taste, but nothing cloying. Light bitterness in the finish. Drinks like 9%, not 12%... ABV especially undetectable while its cold. A little warmth in the finish as it heats up but still nothing at all bothersome. Very smooth and easy to drink, even the tastiness helps. Im not sure why this beer screams breakfast to me. Medium to big body. Slightly viscous, but a dry finish. Long malty rich nutty aftertaste. Slight dark fruit in there. Mild banana and nut all throughout. Awesome, fascinating stuff. Would revisit, just for the pleasure.

Great beer. Dark brown pour with tan head. The nose is sweet malt, raisins and dates. The taste looses the dates, but adds caramel and a little banana and alcohol.  Did not think  I would like this so much.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a medium tan head. Aroma of sweet malt, raisins and caramel. Medium body with a strong sweetness and some caramel notes with a light alcohol finish.

Aroma is wheat, raisin, dates, chocolate, banana, and tropical fruit. Pours a cloudy brown with a long lasting light tan head. Taste is banana, wheat, chocolate, fig, fruity esters, honey, and some booze. Medium full body with decent carbonation. Very good brew.

2009 bottle. Pours dark brown with little to know head. The nose is caramel, brown sugar, molasses, tropical fruit. The taste is sweet mostly but balanced. The mouthfeel is crisp at first but creamy. The body is heavy and the finish is long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had this beer now the second time. Well, in the first round it was my "worst beer ever", honstly, I still remember it. It was very cloudy with little pieces inside and with taste of buttermilk. But this time round, it was just like perfect (well, not that perfect like Schneiders Tap 5, but still great). It has got a milky, dark brown colour with steady head and smooth body. The taste is of rich malt, strong alcohol, overripe bananas, nuts, torf and roast. Very delicious. I dont know why it was THAT bad the first time round (the second taste and the ratings are talking for this beer)....maybe the bottle was too old / not stored good enough when buying it? Maybe it was drunken too cold? I dont know, but now I know that this beer is really good though and I will probably buy it again, as Schneider Weisse is probably my favourite German brewery all time.

I have this 33cl bottle since a very long time and finally decided to pour it into a trappist glass (not a bad option, looks good). Brown to dark brown colour with a small white head. Grapes on the nose, with hints of licorice and banana. Taste is dark sugar, alcohol, and dark fruits...licorice as well. Quite weird but its not bad. Medium to full body, good carbonation. I use to drink other beers, however, I imagine why some people love this one. Nice work.

11.2oz bottle bought from grocery store. Pours a muddy dark brown with little head and carbination. Aroma of bread, raisins, yeast, and licorice. Taste translates very well from the aroma, with some alcohol heat on the finish. This is a very big beer. Definitely a sipper, complex, a beer that you would not order again, but enjoy the first time. I would recommend to only friends who enjoy a variety of beers. Not for your average beer drinker.

Great dark beer with complex high alcohol taste. This beer has a great appearance and a not so expressive aroma. The taste is complex alcohol that makes the sweet taste and a great dry smooth hoppy finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone By Belleketels
Sight bubblegum, but mainly like if you made a banana cream pie with a liqueur. Velvety mouthfeel. Clean finish. I love this beer.

Absolutely exceptional brew. Super smooth and silken without a single hit of booze in the flavour. The pour is a opaque smudged brown with a creamy pillowed beige head. The nose has bananas, a mild spice blend and a brown sugary roasted malt. Sweet and malty with candied tastes and bananas throughout. Smooth and unblemished finish with a lingering sweetness and a great flavour overall.

February 19, 2013 - bottle from Randalls.  Brown pour with nice amount of head.  Aroma was malty, caramel, dark fruit, touch of banana and alcohol.  Taste started like a wheat beer, quickly moved to sweet malt, then some chocolate and dark fruit, and finished strong on the alcohol.  Medium bodied with light carbonation.

One of the most complex beers I have ever had. Poured at 50 degrees and then enjoyed it over the next hour. As it warmed the flavors changed and lingered after each sip. Lots of dark fruits and malts. This beer is surprisingly potent as I discovered upon standing to wash my glass.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 1/21/2011.  Pours crystal clear dark brown color with a nice 2 finger fairly dense cream colored head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fairly large amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head.  Aromas of big raisin, prune, apple, fig, banana, molasses, toast, toffee, dark bread, wheat, clove, pepper, and light floral earthiness.  Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of malt and fruity notes.  Taste of big raisin, fig, apple, caramel, toast, toffee, banana, molasses, dark bread, wheat, clove, pepper, and floral earthiness.  No bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark fruits, caramel, molasses, toast, toffee, pepper, wheat, clove, and floral earthiness on the finish for a good bit.  Damn nice flavor balance, complexity, and robustness; with zero cloying sweetness present after the finish.  Medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a very creamy, slick, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an excellent eisbock style.  Damn nice complexity and balance of flavors; and very smooth to sip on for such a big beer.  A very enjoyable offering as expected.
Strong on figs, dates and plums. A decent beer if a little overly malty, a little sticky sweet. Dont care for the style.

Bottle from 2010 A gusher when I opened it. Poured a cloudy brown with a quickly dissipating head. Strong aroma of dried fig and alcohol. The flavor is intense on the palate with  dried fruits and some spice. A great sipping beer, but I prefer other styles.

Bottle 2012. Pours a clear but nearly opaque reddish brown with a huge tan head that quickly dissipates leaving no lace but good legs. The aroma is very sweet and well rounded honey, figs, plums, clove, and ripe banana. The taste is very sweet though not cloying, slightly tart in the middle, and bitter end. Flavors of raisin dominate until a spicy tannic end. The texture starts very lively, goes soft and silken, then dries out when the alcohol hits. And that hits pretty strong and hot. Its surprisingly thin and clean.  Its really good but im not so in love with it.

Admittedly, my first eisbock. Pours a dark ruby, very little head to speak of. Smells of fig, dates,  dark fruit, nectarine. Mouth feel is light. Taste is dried fruit, vanilla, raisins, malt, toasty. Excellent beer.
Pours a deep ruby red with a large foamy head, aroma of cherries, plums, thick palate, very rich, alcohol well hidden but can be felt, had to double check the abv. 12%!! Very nice indeed

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 Brown beer, with, incredibly, a nice head.Very fruity aroma, taste is also very fruity, plum. Medium carbonation, and you can feel the alcohol very well, too much actually. A very good beer, but I have to say that 33cl are more than enough :)

Edit: 26/01/2014, Bottle more than 1 year old. 
Brown hazy colour, almost coffee, with little head, but lacing. Very intense smell, very rich, with lots of fruity notes, better than one year ago. Taste is less intense than the aroma, with the alcohol overwhelming the other notes, imho.
Very good, but somehow hard to finish.
Dark brown with a dense beige head. Aroma of dark fruit and alcohol. Spice, raisins mix with the typical German weizen character. Creamy smooth with warming but not hot alcohol. Outstanding.

I got a bottle from 2009 that was stashed at the liquor store I work at.  Pours a reddish brown color with a decent sized off white head that quickly dissipates.  Very complex on the nose.  I got aromas of cherries, plumbs, banana, butterscotch, licorice, and a bit of alcohol.  Then I drank it, and I have to admit I was a bit disappointed.  Real thin mouthfeel, and a bit less sticky than I was looking for.  But none the less, has a real good sweetness to it, and has a good aftertaste.  I did enjoy this beer a lot.
Dark rubt brown, aroma of fruity, banana, caramel, somewhat sweet smelling. Tastes as it smells.....interesting. Smooth, not too fizzy.....very tasty.

Poured from $5 / 11.2 ozer - Wow!  Dont think I have encountered something like this before!  Quite intense ruddy hues and intense flavors!  Lots of alcohol comes through, but it blends well the malts and smooth wheat.  Very happy to encounter this heavy-hitter in battle.
Bottle from Stirchley Wines; dark brown pour, huge beige head, clove aroma with heavy alcohol presence, first taste is malty caramel which then unveils clove ripe banana some spice warming alcohol.
Bottle at home. Brown muddy beer with a small offwhite head. Malty, nutty and caramell aroma. Spicy, licorice, dark dried fruits, a bit alcohlic and fruity flavour.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bottle. Deep murky brownish purple pour with a smaller cream head. Aroma is slightly sour fruit, wine, and sweet caramel. Taste is similar. Wouldnt guess 12% ABV. Really good.
Speechless! This is heaven on earth. Strong, yet smooth. This is a must have for any serious beer drinker. Just try it.

Reviewed 1/9/2013.11.2 oz bottle into a Duvel tulip. 2010 vintage.

A: Pours a very dark brown with good opacity due to the haziness of the yeast. Huge yeast particles settle on the bottom of the glass. This features really impressive head retention for 12% - I poured it about 4 minutes ago and theres still a solid off-white colored film left on top.

S: The first thing I notice is huge dark fruit sweetness, along with lighter fruit esters and even some faded hops. After a while, caramel, brown sugar, molasses, and chocolate will enter the picture. Theres a noticeable oxidation to the aroma, giving it both a stronger fruit vibe along with an underlying soy note to it. The alcohol presence is mercurial; its about what I expected.

T: Flavors start off with a lot of ripe cherries and wheat malt. Afterwards, it shows hints of soy sauce (in a mild, pleasing fashion), chocolate, ripe pear, and apple. Not quite as deep, or even as intensely flavored as I expected. Once it warms up, it becomes more and more boozy without really contributing much complexity, and after a while becomes even sweeter; though it also becomes spicier in the finish as well. So yeah, this does have a bit of complexity and depth to it. Warts and all, this is a hell of an experience - and honest to God, its enjoyable.

M: At the first sip, its just about the silkiest damn thing Ive ever put in my mouth. After a while, it becomes a bit more astringent and even boozy. Combined with the carbonation, it features that subtle airy sponge cake quality to the texture. While its hard for me to taste the alcohol, its very easy to notice on the tongue, esophagus, and stomach - the syrupy finish doing its job to an extent.

O: Fresh, Im sure the booze would knock my tongue out, but its done a good job of evolving into something soft and mellow...ish. I seriously cant imagine how boozy this would be with only a month or two of age on it. The warmer it gets, the harsher it gets - and the less I want to drink it. Worth a try, but drink cold!

Bottle at Winterbierfestival. Gouda: Dark brown coloured brew with an taste of almonds, liquorice, dark fruits and hints of banana. There is a sticky aftertaste and a warming mouthfeel due the high alcohol.
Bottle. pours hazy dark amber with airy off-white head. Dark aroma of malt and caramel. Sweet flavour of caramel, malt and roasted nuts. Dryish aftertaste. really good.

pours an average , frothy, light brown head that fully diminished. Body is flat black, sparkles are visible. Aroma contains hay, roasted and toasted malts, molasses, pine, lemon, banana, raisin, plum, cherry, a hint of smoke, charcoal licorice, alcohol and spices. Flavor starts off light acidic, to go to sweet and light bitter. Thisbear is heavy on the malts and medium hoppy. Body is full with syrupy texture and soft carbonation. My first ever Eisbock, I like the style . I hope theyre all like this.
Bottle.  This hazy caramel brew is sticky bun sweet with loads of malts and nary a hint of hops.

Good Spirits Co. Glasgow (330ml for £5.20):
Strong plum aroma and a lot of banana to kick things off, along with some figs and nice amount of alcohol. There is some raisins, a bit of bubblegum and a lot of spice up next, this together with some darker fruits and sugar. The smell of this one has a lot of depth and there is some clove making an appearance to along with some spice and grapes.

Chestnut brown with some deep red tinges and a huge foamy head that is very slightly off-white.

Alcohol to begin with but nothing overpowering, this is followed by most of what the nose promised. The taste consists of banana, cloves and dark fruits with figs, raisins and especially plums all featuring. There is some spice as expected and spice as expected along with a few malts. this taste is rounded of with some sweetness and a boozy alcohol flavour.

Full bodied and quite sweet with no bitterness and a fair amount of carbonation. It is quite boozy and dry towards the end and it certainly packs a punch.

The flavours where very well balanced and the beer went down better than I was expecting whilst still having to be sipped. The aroma was really something special though with each smell complimenting the previous.

Dark ruby with small off-white foam head. Aroma is sweet caramel. Taste is bittersweet with the caranel sweet on top. But in both aroma and taste is a charcoal present. Short lasting aftertaste. (Velp 201301)

Kaatuu lasiin tummanruskeana, vaaleanruskealla runsaalla ja tiiviillä vaahdolla. Haju on kypsän banaaninen, alkoholinen, jouluisen mausteinen ja hieman suklaisen rasvainen. Maku on vahvan banaaninen, alkoholinen, jälkimaku on suklainen ja mausteinen. Ensimaku taas hieman marjainen. Suutuntuma on uskomattoman täyteläinen ja olut tuntuu iskevän joka makunystyrään. Kokonaisuutena hieno jouluolut, ja maistuu myös tällaiselle, joka ei bock-tyylisistä oluista hirveästi välitä. Alkoholisuus häiritsi hieman, siitä yleisvaikutelman pisteiden "vähyys"

Aromas of mixed berries, purple grapes, candy, caramel, clove, and banana.  Ruby-brown with a moderately retaining, beige head.  Sweet, lightly peppery, some cherry notes, and subtle vanilla.  Full bodied, rich, good, fluffy carbonation, spicy, and has an off-dry fruity finish.  Drinks like an Aventinus smoothie.

Murky, dark copper brown body, massive pale tan head, minimal lacing.  Nose is dark fruity malts, caramel, banana, clove, and booze. Flavor contains the same elements but is better integrated. Medium bodied, assertive carbonation, boozy, tight finish.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks beerandbeyond for fetching us the bottle. Pours murky brown with white head. Raisins, cheesecake, alcohol aroma, tastes like sour soft cheese, then sweet. Weird.
Velvety smooth texture, full body.

500 ml bottle from czar, thanks mate! Pours a clear, reddish brown with a very short lived beige head. Smell is overripe bananas, chocolate, and red candies. Taste is tons of bananas, overripe fruits such as red berries, very sweet caramel, cloves and spices. Finish is a fine herbal bitterness that luckily comes in to balance all that sweetness. Lingering touch of barley candies, chocolate, and soft, warming alcohol.Very thick bodied, silky, soft mouthfeel. Weak carbonation. Very loyal to the original Aventinus doppelbock - except on roids. Very solid. To be sipped like a good port wine.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2014 50cl bottle to weizen glass.

Aroma: Fantastic! Plums, banana, clove, cinnamon, nuts, spices, flower bouquet...you could go on and on. The complexity is quite high. Then you have the classic weizen aromas too.

Appearance: Muddy dark chestnut color with a very dense, foamy, cream colored head. Much CO2 rising up. 

Taste: One of the strongest and most powerful beers Ive ever tried, bar none. So much flavour, mostly balanced on the sweet and malty side of things. Pretty much mirrors the aroma.

Palate: Viscous, chewy and very complex. CO2 is somewhat hidden and the alcohol does make itself known in the finish but overall its very good.

Overall: This beer is fantastic, almost too much, since its so complex and drinks so easily that its ridiculous. You get 50cl as opposed to 33cl AND the price is great which makes it even better. The ABV is quite high too but surprisingly hidden so watch out! The thing that amazes me most is the sheer quality of this...IMO it matches the work of the trappists and dare I say its right on par with Westvleteren 12 if not even better.

Bouteille 500ml. Nez de levures fruitées (raisins vineux, prunes, moyen de cerises et de pommes, notes de bananes et de poires) et légèrement épicées (clou de girofle, léger de cannelle) aux notes boisées, assez malté de caramel toffee et de sucre brun avec des notes de chocolat noir, dalcool liquoreux, de vanille, de houblon herbeux et de blé. Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-bas et une texture légèrement sirupeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (raisins vineux, prunes, cerises, léger de pommes, notes de bananes et de poires) aux notes vineuses avec un goût épicé (clou de girofle, traces de cannelle) et des notes de vanille lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté sucré de caramel toffee (notes de rôti et de chocolat) et léger de sucre brun avec quelques notes asséchantes de blé. Parallèlement un goût moyennement amer dalcool liquoreux réchauffant, léger de houblon herbeux ainsi que des notes de noix constituent la finale. Post-goût long aux notes sèches, léger-moyen amer dalcool moyen, léger de houblon herbeux et de levures fruitées (moût de raisins et de cerises, notes de prunes, de pommes et de bananes) avec des notes de blé.

A complex brown with an amber crisp head. Aventinus is known for its complex and dense beers, but this Eisbock really kicks it up a notch. The wheats are alcohol really come through. I have aged a few for years and am looking forward to that immensely.

Hazy Brown earthy color with off white lacing. There is a slight meatiness on the nose. The meatiness comes through on the palate as well. Dried fruits on the palate also. An old fashioned Christmas meal.

29/12/2012 330ml bottle. Bruna, intensa, riflessi color rubino. schiuma leggera e poco persistente. Naso inizialmente non proprio pulitissimo, con note di frutta rossa e banana, caramello e zucchero di canna. In bocca è molto dolce, con una nota etilica che scalcia come un mulo, non male, ma stucchevole alla lunga e difficile da finire. Corpo pieno, carbonazione elevata. Buona, ma non proprio il genere di birra che preferisco.

33cl bottle. Its hard task to write about this beer. Unclear eisbock with a lot of silky Co2 but weak foam. Very unique. Taste is first citric (maybe for wheat) than malty almost sweet behind this and bitter smoke at the end. Body is like a builder, gulp is sticky.

Bottle 2011 ed.. Pours muddy with minimal fizzy off-white head. Aroma is intense and super estery fruity with plum, pear, apple, raisins, banana, bubblegum, dark malt, wheat and alchohol. Taste is heavy sweet, light sour. Body is very full, texture is oily/sticky, carbonations is soft. Finish is short with a slight burn. Surprisingly drinkable - a great winter sipper.

Bottled.  New bocks. Super fruity aroma,  sweet,  berries. Mid dark coppery brown,  lots of bubbles.  Taste is very nice,  sweet,  berries again. Mouth feel is medium,  full bodied. Lingering yeasty,  malt after taste.  Nice brew!
If it was a trappist youd believe it. Perfect mix of weizen and aromatic bock. Complex taste, long lasting. Unfortunately a bit too alcoholic.

33cl bottle. Pours deep mahogany with thin off white head. Aroma is banana, figs, prunes, cherries, raisins, deep bready malt, clove, spice, booze, interesting herby yeast. Taste mirrors the aroma with loads of dark & red fruit mixed with banana, spiced yeast complexity, bread, sweet almost-caramel malt, and a healthy booze warmth. All incredibly well balanced, no way could you think it was 12%. A wonderful version of the classic Aventinus.

Bottled, 0.33l. Clear dark brown color with small brownish head. Fruity aroma, mainly of raisins, plums, cherries, berries and yeasty notes. Taste starts with rich sweet barley malt, followed by fruity and light alcoholic notes. Warm, mouth--coating feeling with light bitterness in the aftertaste. Full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation in palate. Ice cold is excellent for head chilling...
A lot of alchohol in aroma and it does not dissapoint at taste. Sweet taste and aftertaste. "Spezi" colour.

New Beer Distributors, NY 33cl ($5.25): Im guessing that this bottle might have a few years on it. In any case, it pours mahogany with a small beige head that leaves some lacing after its quick disappearance. Aroma is booze, yeast, banana, clove, and dried fruits. Taste is sweet, but nothing close to Kulmbacher. Alcohol is present, but not in excessive force. Body is thick and syrupy. Loads of complexity, but it dont skimp on drinkability either.

Sweet, malty aroma. Very sweet, raisiny flavor. Deep dark brown color. Good finish, but almost a little too sweet to drink all night.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33 l bottle.    BB 16. Nov. 17 
Nice alcohol burn, alcohol, roasty, cheese, brown, hazy, minimal head, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, sticky, average carbonation, long finish,

Brewed in 2009/32137
Full but light foamh head with abundant beading which is especially impressive for a 12%ABV beer. A somewhat cloudy tawny dark brown with a fine line of rusty brown light at the base of the glass. Very full on the tongue but with a spritziness too with some morish banana notes. Moving towards a richness here but still some way from  Ode to Joy. More John Stuart Mill than it should be.

Bottle @ home, thx to my secret sinterklaas. Brown to ruby colour  head doesn?t last, but was off-white to light brown. Smells white wine, some wood, nuts, some alcohol. Tastes sweet, some wood, nuts, red fruits.. Not bad! Quite a heavy amd warming beer with a full body and slightly silky feel if it wasn?t for a small amount of fizzy carbo.
Edit: after a while the carbo goes away and the beer gets quite silky, which is lovely.
Bottle.  Pours dark brown with thin tan head.  Aroma of prunes, raisins, cherries, and Belgian yeast.  Taste of dark fruits.  Not too sweet.  Nice alcohol burn.  Good sipping beer.  Pretty good.

Marroncino con riflessi rossi. Schiuma media molto persistente che si attacca al bicchiere. Aroma fruttato, banana, e caramello. Al palto ingresso dolce: datteri, caramello, liquirizia. A fine sorsata appare lesuberante potenza alcolica mista a un sentore erbaceo che ricorda un amaro. Perfetta per le serate fredde.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 Theres something truly delicious about this. Thats a nice gun youve got there. Really enjoyable boozy booze. Looks awesome. My brain is a sieve. 40? Pah, try 71. Oh, HB for tomorrow.

Bottle, as pictured.  This is a good beer.  Surprisingly more spicy and dark-fruity than I was expecting.  Pours a deep but somewhat clear dark mahogany brown.  Smells very strongly of raisins, cinnamon, nutmeg.  Taste is similar, very sweet and complex.  Mouthfeel is very smooth.  Awesome beer.

Bottle. Pours a deep bronze with persist billowy whote head. Aromas are fairly typicalk weizen with bananas and cloves but there are also dark fruits and a little more spice. Taste is quite sweet as expected with some alcohol on the finish. Soft carbonation. Medium mouthfeel.

Pours a rich brown with thin off white head. Does not persist and little to no lacing. Very complex malty aromas with raisins, plum, caramel, bready and spice. Taste follows suit with big fruity esters and malty sweetness. Finish is chewy with a nice alcohol warming and persistent sweetness. Very unique but familiar at the same time.

Poured from an 11.2 ounce bottle into a snifter. Pours dark, translucent brown with a beige ring of foam around the glass. The aroma has lots of earthy complexities. Raisins, cherries, wood and leather come wafting out of the glass. The taste is a muted sweetness with a wine-like dryness. After a few moments, there is a light cherry tartness that tickles the back of the tongue. Overall, this beer is very nice. One that warms the body, and soul.

Beautiful bock coloring with a lasting off white head complex aroma filled with many fruits and spices. Pears, bananas, apples, all spice, clove, and nutmeg. Less bread than the regular doppelbock but thats ok. Tastes follows seamlessly with a perfect mouth feel. Bright but not to strong carbonation fits the flavors to a tee. Definitely a special occasion beer. Very happy I tried it out!
Dark brown.  Thin head.  Toffee and deep caramellizatiin.  Balances out the alcohol content very well.
Brun dimmig öl med beige skum. Doft av jäst frukt, bananer, kryddighet och lätt alkoholsötma. Kryddig smak med banan, fikon i cognac och jäst. Något för mycket alkohol.
