Bottle.  Pours a murky brown with a medium off-white head.  Aroma is dark fruit, raisin, banana, caramel, wheat, similar to regular Aventinus.    Taste is heavy sweet with a very light bitterness, a little alcohol.  Finish is sweet, lightly bitter, lightly alcoholic. Very full bodied, syrupy, well carbonated for the ABV.  Nice sipper.

Bottle courtesy of Suttree. Thanks!  Viscous dark brown with no head. Sweet, fruity prune, black bread,  and alcohol aroma. Sweet, fruity vinous plum, orange liqueur, cherry, booze, black bread flavor. Full thick body, soft carbonation, alcohol warmth. Im glad to be able to try this, but I find these strong beers difficult to enjoy beyond sipping a minimal snifter full.

Pours dark and cloudy into my tulip.  Foamy off-white head.  Aroma is superb; sweetness, chocolate, caramel, hint of coffee.  Taste reflects this, some spice to it, absolutely cannot tell that this beer weighs in at a mighty 12%.  You crazy Germans, please keep making beer.

Bottle @ Laundromat Cafe,Oslo,Norway
November 17,2012
Dark brown color.Aroma is malt,alcohol,wheat,and fruit. Taste is malt, alcohol and raisins.Medium to little carbonation.Tasty,but dangerously strong beer

Caramel, dates and malt aroma.  Pours a dark brown with thin light quickly fading head.  Raisins, caramel, sweet with a slight alcohol warming.  Earthy undertone.  Very smooth with an ever so slight bitterness on the finish.  Very nice.
Pours a dark cloudy red, aroma is very strong, dark fruit, very carbonated. Taste  Is very sweet, lots ofcomplex fuit and wheat some alochol burn. Great beer and at 12% smooth.

Pours a translucent, dark brown colour with a thin, off white head that quickly dissipates. You can smell the alcohol a little, but theres plenty of sweet malts and a smell, sort of like figs or dates. Very sweet tasting, also quite boozy, lots of sweet malt, figs and other dark fruits. Very thick as you would expect for a 12% beer, low carbonation, decent mouth feel with a long lasting finish. A nice beer, maybe a little too strong, not as good as the regular Aventinus.
Dark brown color with no head.  Aroma of  dark fruits, caramel, red wine. Taste of figs, sweet malts, liqurece... nicely balanced and very smooth, warming alcohol. The best eisbock I had

330ml bottle. Nice sweet, malty and some roasty aromas, along with some fruity ones. Pours hazy dark brown, with and small but creamy, compact and persistent offwhite head, some lacework. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Taste is malty, alcoholic, sweet and smooth, with some hints of spices and fruit. Complex palate. Aftertaste is long, warming and sweet. Very enjoyable and nice.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2015 Bottle. Opaque deep brown/ruby liquid with small off-white head. Aroma of raw sugar, caramel, clove, banana, booze and light band-aid. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, caramel, port and clove. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. I don?t know. Weird.7/3/6/3/14=>3.3Re-rating 2015-08-19. Bottle. 2010 vintage. Appearance as before. Aroma of raw sugar, port wine, plums, dried sweet fruit, toffee, strawberries and blueberries. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, super complex dried fruit, strawberries and port wine. Full bodied with medium carbonation. Wow, this ages super well. Very complex with lots of dried fruit and berry notes. Super good! 9/4/8/4/17=>4.2
brown, small fast fading white foam. tastes sweet, sugar, german style . light and sweet aftertaste.

Bottle at JFs (from Bitter Virtue) 28/10/12.
Clouded dark chestnut brown with a thin off white head that soon thins to the edge.
Nose comprises raisens, dates, prunes, Xmas cake, bread, spice, treacle toffee.
Tastes of dark fruits, toffee, raisens, Xmas cake, light chocolate.
Full bodied with fine carbonation leading to a fruity dry boozy finish.
Complex beer and whilst you know there is some alcohol in the mix the 12% is expertly disguised.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Murky brown with a solid tan head. Aroma is dark berries, Flavour is deep jammy sweet mulled berries, bittersweet with warming alco notes. Finish is dry fruity and sugary
Delicious.  Leaves a slightly sour aftertaste on the pallet, but otherwise it has a wonderfully malty flavor that, for those who appreciate it, will not disappoint.

After the beer was served in the glass there was found a lasting quantity wall adhesive light brown foam collar which was fine and even of structure. The beer also contained much carbonic acid in the glass. The beer has a  thick dark brown and a sweet taste. The after tast of the beer is hoppy bitter with a chocolat and caramel touch . This beer smells to plums.

2008 bottle. Awesomeness. Sweet sweet magic, raisin, odd orange/cherry/red apple, cane sugar, plum, bit of banana - good aroma that never dies. Taste: sweet alcohol, wheat, lightly sour, sugar, light fruit. Its so-so. Smells great tho!

Thanks Jeff!!!!! Ruby brown with a small skiff floating on top what is pretty good for the 12%. Sweet yet intensely sour apple candy, oak, sock like funk. What do the malts smell like..... I cant but my finger on it. Sweet apple with a nice alcohol warming finish. Caramel, candy sugar, perfume, apples, wood, more stuff with stuff that taste like stuff. Good stuff!

0.33l bottle. Orangish dark brown body, quickly disappearing light brown head. Aroma of reisins,plums,banana, some spices and champagne, maybe some chocolate as well. Lots of banana, caramel and reisins in the flavor with notes of champagne and some grassy hoppyness. Warming alcohol, but not harsh at all. Wonderful beer.

Bottle. Pours cloudy dark amber color with decent tan head. Aroma is chocolate, wheat, plums, overripe fruits, hint of wood and licorice. Flavor is sweet, wheat, chocolate, whiskey, plums, licorice, alcohol. Carbonation is higher than I expected.

Pours dark with a thin off white-head. Aroma of dark fruits ( raisin and figs), some clove, hay, horseblanket and notes of banana. Taste for me follows the nose to a tee. Good mouthfeel but some alcohol burn on the way down. Finishes sweet and clean.Nice.

330ml bottle.  Poured a murky dark brown color with a huge off white head that slowly fell to a tight cap.  Aroma is concentrated maltiness which hass rich syrupy, candy like fruity flavors with some alcohol.   Robust sweet malty flavor with molasses, dark ripe fruits. hints of dark chocolate and light spice.  The alcohol is well hidden in the taste. Rich and thick with an oily mouthfeel and low carbonation.

Deep mahogany pour with an bubbly eggshell head.Nose is sweet raisins, toffee, licorice and some defined wheat grains. Sweet deep fruit entry, yeast notes, toffee, licorice and booze. Medium heavy bodied with some decent carbonation. Alcohol heat in the back end, but not 12% noticeable. Damn good.
Draft. Tall, handsome looking darkish beer with hints of sweet plum. I had it with pasta, but would be better paired with meat.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2013 33 cl. bottle split with Dylan / Kraddel - purchased from an online retailer / shop - dark brown with a reasonable tanned / off-white head - smell is .... ok ..... I will be honest, I am getting fish guts here ... like those small fishes they used to sell in the supermarket, where you had to take guts out before eating ... this smells exactly like your fingers would smell after that - I know that smell can easily trigger memories and associations - better than anything else but this is ridiculous - I simply cannot get over the smell of this, weirdest beer ever for me, period - I had some weird beers but this takes the cake easily - other than that, there is caramel, toffee, banana, dark sugar, thick spices, ripe dark fruits - if I can get over the fish guts thing - I seem to be the only person out there getting this - I can even taste the fish guts, dear lord, toffee, caramel, dark sugar, dark fruits, a bit sticky, oily, somewhat softer carb. , dark malts, spices, light cherry-ness - not sure as how to rate this - do I like it? I actually do - do I find it insanely weird? yes, I do ////////// Tried again, way better than I remember it being, full of wonderful dark fruits, almost like a quad. Stellar stuff 4.1 -> 4.7

Rich and intense is the best way for me to describe this Eisbock. Ive had stronger beers, but this one certainly packs a punch. Its not just the alcohol, although its definitely present. The beer carries a load of fruit. Rich with wheat. Nice beer.

Theres a world of aromas to discover. Leather, red fruits, dried fruits, caramel, buttermilk, spices, balsamico, smoke, and a hint of nailpolish. Full-bodied dry finish with nice balance of sweet and sour.

Hazy brown with an off white head - lovely wheat aroma with some dark fruits, malt in the back - good wheat body with some dark malt, dark fruits and some alcohol heat - lingering wheat and alcohol heat in the back - this was very good

33cL bottle (11.2oz).  Ive never had a true Belgian-style German...until NOW!  Really similar to quadruple in style (my favorite).  Wow, It looks like Rochefort 12, brown, lots of undissolved yeast, modest head fades to nothing.  Aunt Jemima, syrupy as hell....just the way I like it.  Beautiful mistake, Schneider.

Very complex beer, with a lot of nuances in nose and palate. The overall is impeccable: rich, balanced, with a strong equilibrium between swetness and bitterness. Flavours from raisins and traces of pineapple to leather, smoke and cheese (the yeast is very present in the whole). The most remarkable is its superb and marvellous colour: dark amber and honey with brilliant reddish glitters. A very, very great beer.

Dark amber khaki head with long collar. Aroma of red fruit sweet malts and booze. Not as sweet as I was expecting dark fruits prunes cherries. Very dry finish. Definitely get lot of booze character. Good for sipping in front of a fire but I think I prefer the regular.

This was a draft pour at THE LOCA:L beer bar in Eureka, CA.  Came in the glass a very dark copper color with and off-white head and good lacing rings. Nose shows alcohol, and lots of ripe fruit. Medium body. Alcoholic mouthfeel but is not obtrusive. Flavor show a lot of fruit, including apple, bananas, and plums. Some spice in the finish. A very rich and tasty beer.

2009 bottle pours very dark brown copper with off white head. The aroma is grainy alcohol and dried fruits and a heavy spice. The taste is similar with apple, banana, grape raisin, some clove spice and earthy grainy alcohol. Very delicious and strong, this had the concentrated grainy sweetness and rich wheat flavor youve expect from an eisbock but wonderfully smooth for 12%. This is a big beastly wheat beer, right up my alley.

Bottle - dark in color with a creamy thin head. Has an aroma of bananas and plums. Has a medium slick mouthfeel to it and finished with a smokey malt taste. Didnt taste the alcohol like I thought I would but thats probably a good thing. Good for a one time beer but nothing I would look for again.
Brown murky, somewhat thick pour, sweet aroma, moderate head. Taste is sticky sweet with a very pronounced spice flavor that I am not at all familiar with, and which I do not enjoy at all.

Bottle 33 cl, tnx to rlgk. Pours cloudy dark amber with a nice creamy beige head leaving some laces. Aroma is malty fruity yeast bananas fruity a bit citric sweet wheaty cloves. Flavor is yeasty spicy fruity bitter pungent a bit phenolic bananas alcohol (maybe a bit too much) grainy and has some astringent touch. Finishes bitter fruity. Maybe a bit too boozy.

Bottle from Être Gourmet. Hazy dark amber beer with a nice offwhite/beige head. Malty fruity aroma, peach, banana, bready, caramel, brown sugar, vanilla notes. Malty fruity flavor, banana, warming alcohol, toffee, esters, citrus, floral notes, brown sugar, candy, bubblegum, peach, some biscuits. Pleasant and with alcohol quite well hidden. Fruity finish, banana, wheat, biscuits, some peach.

The beer is a burnt orange hue, with a small head that dissipates rapidly, leaving minimal lacing. The aroma brings bananas, dark fruits, wheat, clove, and alcohol. Quite tasty. Bananas soaked in alcohol and a rum characteristic work well together. Sweetness and alcohol are present throughout, making this bottle optimal for sharing, as I wouldnt want more than half the bottle. The beer is medium bodied with moderately low carbonation. Overall, a very good representation of the style, though I seldom drink beers of this ilk.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-05-2011

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Bottled on 25/01/2012. Dark mahogany. Pours thin, cream head, persisting. Light carbonation. Aroma - Rich, cereally, dark vine fruits, raw brown sugar, bit soy, warm spices & wood. Bit of a yeasty, sharp, sour aroma. Taste - Initially some dark, caramelised sugary / molasses sweetness and dark fruits (dates), but quickly turning drier: More dry and sour than i was expecting; Quite a sour finish - a bit like dry white wine. Quite a strong, volatile-aromatic, solvent-like taste/aroma and some appleness. Bit boozy. Quite a rich, complex wheaty malt. Also some complex, warming spicy, fruitiness if left on the tongue for a while. Body is quite light, bit lively on the tongue - surprising for the strength. Interesting & complex, but bit too sour and not quite as sweet as id have liked. Alcohol not well hidden; too strong for me.
Will try another bottle after some more aging.
Pours a murky brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of german yeast and malts, slight alcohol. Taste is smooth on the smell with the alcohol well hidden. Great german beer.

Pours dark and cloudy with a fairly thick, light brown creamy head which retains. Aroma of berries and spice. Thick bodyfeel, reasonable carbonation and immediate strong alcohol hit. Slightly cloying with spicy nutmeg and dark fruits (christmas cake time), Dry thick aftertaste of heavy berries, but not particularly balanced.

Aroma: spice, sweet malts. Appearance: a murky brown pour with a robust mostly diminishing tan head. no lacing. Taste: sweet malt, spice, and alcohol. Mouthfeel: medium-full with no carbonation, some tongue covering noted. Overall: this is a last beer of the night sipping beer vs. the first brew of the afternoon

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
11.2 oz bottle pours hazy brown with a tan head.  Aroma of spice, malts and bananas.  Taste is sweet malt, fruit and alcohol.
RBAG Summer Session 2012. Pours a hazy brown with a lively but short-lived tan head. Smells of alcohol, nuts. Tastes sweet - notes of raisins, plums, a dash of bitterness, hints of clove.

A-- Poured a dark ruby color and settled a dark, murky, I guess plumb color. Half finger of bright white head that went away as quick as I poured it. Just a white collar really. Visible alcohol legs to this. 

S-- Dark fruits, cinnamon, nutmeg, orange peel, and other spices. Slightly medicinal and alcohol says hello off the bat. Big time malt. Good nose. Like the fruity quality to this. 

T-- Prickly and slightly syrupy. Dark fruits and spices. Like a Christmas pudding or cake. Very warming and very quick acting. 

M-- Quite light and quite carbonated for the ABV. Smooth, slick and slightly medicinal. Booze is quite obvious but a very long lasting finish of spices and dark fruits. Quite a jammy beer.

O-- Biggest negative is how boozy it is but otherwise this is exceptional. A lot of balance in the body and a lot of flavors. Total winter beer and just a treat to have.

Pours a murky brown from the bottle with frothy tan head and decent lacing. Aroma of german yeast and malts, slight alcohol ala carlsberg elephant. Taste is smooth on the smell with the alcohol well hidden. Great german beer.
Great beer.  Strong notes of banana with hints of creamy alcohol.  Dark brown hue with a creamy banana with some yeast on the end.  Excellent.
Pours a hazy brown with a thin white top that quickly dissipates. Aroma is grain, a little sweetness and malt. Taste is malt forward with a small sweetness thats great.

11.2 oz bottle: 2008 #14524
Pours wood brown and murky with no head....just a faint greyish-tan ring.
Aroma is strong dark fruit, sugars, wine...a little banana.....
Taste is very swet and fruity....acidic...
Alcohol is presented with a throat burn and warmth.
Prunes....sticky-sweet mouthfeel.
More like a big belgian.....very, very good.

Smell is sweet and inviting, reminding me a wee heavy. Pour had a small head that diminished quickly. Color was red and looks thick. Taste was sweet and had a high ABV bite, but well masked. Palate was full and a bit acrid.
Bittrely good. Very interesting. Different taste. Worth the trying. Very good.........

Dark murky brown body with an off white head. Extraordinary aroma with banana, caramel, liqueur, vanilla, licorice, plum, wheat and some spices. Very heavy, alcoholic palate. Great, alcoholic sweet flavour with banana, vanilla, wheat, chocolate and brown sugar. Exceptional.

This wonderful beer pours with a thin head into a dark chestnut color.  The aroma is of toasty wheat and slight banana.  The flavor matches the aroma perfectly with clear wheat and caramel toasty flavors.  The banana ester of the yeast is slightly masked by the alcohol flavor.  Hops are not detectable.  Great beer.
Bottle @ Monks Sveavägen. Red brown colour with a white head. Aroma of malt and dried fruits. Malt, caramel and fruit flavour.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2016 Donkerbruin, kraag verdwijnt tot een randje op het bier.  Ruikt zurig en fruitig en wat alcohol. Smaak: banaan, bubblegum,  tarwe, een beetje zuur, redelijk zoet. Niet te koud drinken.Volle smaak. Goed spul.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2013 Bottle shared with McTapps. From first to last this one is a bucket of ripe fruits, especially banana. Drunken with the right temperature this one is maybe the most aromatic beer ever.
Poured a dark brown color from the bottle, aromas of roasted wheat, bananas, and some chocolate.  Flavor follows suit, nice beer overall.

330ml bottle. Hazy brown colour with average, frothy, lacing, tan head, leaving a thin layer. Slightly sweet, dark fruity aroma has notes of baked banana, red currant, a touch of chocolate, wheaty overtones, more than just a touch of alcohol. Taste is fruity, red berries, wheat, some alcohol, fizzy carbonation alleviates the full and heavy body to some extent. Alcohol is a raving success.

From the bottle.  Not much going for aroma, although my nose is a bit stuffy. Maybe some sweetened dehydrated fruit and cookie dough.  Appearance is dark brown with a great deal of particulate floating around. Taste is tart and tangy with a pronounced boozy sting.  Overall it is a little over the top in terms of alcohol.  It would probably be much better in the middle of winter.  Good brew, its just not  my style.

This beer is a very dark brown, almost black liquid, which is quite opaque and has a frothy dark tan head that subsides quickly. There is noticeable sediment. The aroma is of coffee and chocolate, as well as alcohol and raisins. Smelling this beer was amazingly appetizing. The taste has an elegant sweetness, that goes well with some sourness. This beer is definitely an extra-full bodied beer, with a thick, slightly oily texture, soft carbonation and a long, sweet finish. There is a lot of beer in the bottle, when poured it had a strong alcohol odour, and the aftertaste has an oily alcohol presence. That said, the thick sweet taste is absolutely delicious. I want to say that this is quite a meal in a cup, and is definitely a sipper. Compared to the non-Eisbock, Id say that it tastes even better, but its a trade-off for the increased alcohol content, which I found a bit difficult to deal with. In my opinion the high alcohol and resultant flavours really detracted from this beer but I still highly recommended it if you have the time to enjoy this very fine beer.

I'm not a big wheat beer fan but this Eisbock intrigued me. The first time I had it the wheat was apparent and I wasn't too impressed.  I give it a second try and the rich flavor came out much more apparent than the first time and I have come to enjoy this more than before. I'm guessing third time is the charm, right?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Has a deep nut-brown colour with a big frothy beige head which fades fast. In the aroma I find sweet chocolate, leather, dried fruit, wood, and some alcohol. Powerful and sweet flavours of leather, wood, liqueur, alcohol and some chocolate truffles. Thick and smooth mouthfeel, and light bitter. A heavy beer with maybe too much alcohol in the flavour.
en bouteille au mondiale, belle robe brun rouge, odeur de vin, goût de fruits confis, chaude en boucge, alcool présent, riche et complexe.
0,5l bottle. Dark brown color. No head, flat. Dark fruit, plums, sweet aroma. Clean sharp texture. Plums, fruity, raisins in flavor.

11.2oz bottle in a weizen glass.  Pours brown with a thick, lacy, light beige head.  Aroma of wheat, caramel malts, alcohol, and some light floral hops.  Flavor the same, with a lot of alcohol and wheat.  Average texture.  A pretty good beer, and very strong.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Very dark brown colour, reasonable head. Strong pungent alcohol aroma. Sickly sweet chocolate toffee vanilla & coffee flavour. Smooth with big sweet aftertaste. Very intense & not my sort of beer.

Dark brown with lots of particulate matter and medium beige head that lasts a long time.  Complex aroma, brown sugar and molasses, dried fruits, baking bread, chocolate.  Full body, alcohol really only slightly noticable except for warming presence.  Flavor starts sweet with dark sugars, then dark fruit and wheat, then dry finish to keep it drinkable.  Like bread in a bottle but better.  Powerful flavors all in good balance.  Great.

Sampled from an 11.2 oz brown bottle this beer  poured a very dark brown color with a huge foamy tan head that lingered and left some lacing. The aroma was sweet raisins, molasses, plum, clove, cherry, bubblegum and  had noticable alcohol. The flavor was strong molasses, caramel, dark fruits, dates, fig, tart cherries, bread, clove and bubblegum. Wonderfully complex with a long swirling finish. Fairly full bodied with less alcohol presence on the flavor than I expected. Excellent.

Loamy brown with a compact brown tinged head of foam. Strongly boozy nose, touch of higher alcohol, over-ripe banas and phenolic clove bordering on antiseptic. Steady stream of carbonation. Rich and thick body, smooth on the swallow, full on ripe banana, caramel, rich toffee, wheat spices, slight yeast marmite umami finish.

33cl bottle from Westholme Stores, Goring. Slightly opaque with a dark ruby brown colour and a ring of white head; the aroma is the typical wheat; the wheat carries through to the mouth but with some rich malts as well, giving a smooth intense flavour with cherries and almonds; and a gently warming, lightly spiced, finish. A masterpiece of a beer.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2012 My 100th rating:) Pours a dark, hazy colour, with a light tan head the disappears quite fast. Wheat, toast, chocolate caramel and coffee on the nose. Oily texture and a nice alcoholic feeling at the first sip. The warm feeling stayes extremly long. The taste is mainly dominated by caramel, chocolate, licorice, but there are also som coffee, bread and raisins in the mix. Its an amazingly complex taste. One thing that stands out as maybe the best quality here, is that its so fantasticly balanced. the alcohol is bearly noticible in the mouth otherwise than the warm feeling in the chest. Besides that, the other tastes are not each too dominating, but works together to give you a little explotion of tastes that work really well together. This has to be one of the top beers Ive ever tasted, just mindblowingly good! The high avb means that this one is best shared. Recommended for those hwo have not tried it yet!
Deep rich pour with plenty of sediment.  Great rich flavor with little bitterness.  Creamy drink with a lot of malt and high ABV makes it one of my favorites.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2014 6-30-12, A great GREAT bock. Surprising fruitiness (one taster said it reminded him of juicy fruit gum - in a good way). There is moderate carbonation with deep malts. Delicious. 7-25-14- nice deep plum and ripe cherry notes on top of malt goodness. 9.5 bd. 8.7 joshK

330 ml. bottle. Bottle number 2011 024717. Pours a medium, short duration, beige head, with a bit of lacing, over a cloudy, brown (SRM 25) body....nose is heavy malts, with treacle, molasses, raisin, plum dominant, lighter banana tones, clove....taste is sweet malts,  with treacle, molasses, raisin, plum, lighter but still obvious, banana, bubblegum, with heavy clove....mouth feel thick, sticky, alcohol burn present, carbonation low. This is a remarkable confection. Thick, rich, spice loaded, sweet, with layers of aroma and flavors, a bit hot on alcohol, but otherwise quite delicious. Oh yes, it meets the style. Think of it as liquid plum pudding. BJCP 10/3/16/4/8

Bottle. Pours hazy brown full tan head. Very unique aroma, licorice, caramel, dark fruits. Medium sweet complex taste. Full body, creamy texture, alcohol presence is appears but is well masked for 12%+. The dark fruits flavor plays a prominent role in the finish. This is excellent overall.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2012 from bottle. pours a dark obscure, red/brown colour and barely any head at all. the aroma is like the one of the "normal" aventinus but way more concentrated and intense. you get all the dark fruit aromas - plums, raisins, cherries and cranberries - mixed with almond and pear liquor notes. one can definitely sense the high abv of 12%. the taste is very sweet and fruity with a hint of maltiness and typical weissbier banana flavours in the back, but very ripe or even fermented bananas. it is almost like a fruit liquor. full body and average carbonation. very nice indeed!

Pours dark with a reddish, maybe purple hue.  Aroma and taste are very complex and enjoyable.  Aroma of dark fruit, soy sauce, smokiness, and a unique copper metallicness.  Taste is same with some oaky, smokiness.  Reminds me of a German version of a Belgium Dark Strong.
mahogany with small head. very sweet and fruity. mainly plum and raisin, but also banana. also some smokeyness and clove. wonderfully complex. alcohol well masked. this is an amazing beer.

My version is very fresh. The head is ok, the body red-cloudy. It smells very  wheat-darkmalty. The taste is very yeasty, malty and alcoholic-creamy. It is ok but I hope if it is longer storaged it will be better. 9/9/8/9/11/9

A cloudy, light brown beer with a thin, off- white head that mostly lasting. The aroma is fruity and yeasty with notes of banana, caramel, bread, clove, almond, marzipan, alcohol and milk chocolate. The taste is sweet, spicy and fruity, very complex. The texture is oily, fizzy carbonation. You cant feel the 12% ABV untill it kiks your head. Well done!

500ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a small off-white head that leaves virtually no lacing.  Aroma is light fruits and spices with hints of chocolate and mild hops.  Taste is malty and fruity sweetness with some cloves and banana and a light hoppy bitter finish and a presence of alcohol.  Medium bodied with mild carbonation.  This brew is quite complex and I cannot do justice in my description.  Definitely one of my favorite beers.
Bottle - not much head, very dark amber color, sweet malty & alcohol aromaand flavor, hints of spiced fruit

Bottle from Wegmans priced at $5.99. I was well unaware that this was 12%, just wanted to try the style.  This brew pours a hazy brown with a very big fluffy tan head that is well supported by a ton of carbonation.  The aroma on here is fruity, almost reminds me of a quad but less boozy.  The taste hits the front of your tongue like an assault of dark fruit sweetness and a little burn on the tongue in the finish.  Really tasty brew.  The palate is very silky and the carbonation makes it slide right past your lips to your stomach. Overall, this is a killer brew and ive got to put it up there as one of the best imports ive had.

The aroma immediately sucks you in with some hints of fruit with a boozy undertone.  The pour is a dark brown with a nice tan head.  The taste is quite complex.  Its a slightly fruity up front with a touch of bitterness in the middle.  It does however show its potency at 12% leaving a little bit of a burn at the finish.  The texture is medium bodied and velvety smooth until that point.  Quite good!
Dark pour with lots banana notes in the nose.  Taste is full of banana and dark fruits. Pretty complex but overall easy to drink.  It didnt look very appealing though.

Bottle. Pours murky brown, small off-white head. Nose is heavy clove, bits of sweet banana, burnt sugar, dark bread. Carbonation is soft but lively, with sharp clove, sugary root, with more banana and herbal undertones. Mouthfeel is a bit thinner than the regular Aventinus, which has a perfect, thick bready feel. Still so good.

15th January 2010Cloudy dark brown beer. No head. Light dry palate, turns softer quickly. Dark toffee, unsweet and a little spirity and spicy. Banana, well buried. Soft spritzy minerals before the dry finish which has a spirity warmth. Decent but not sure it deserves its reputation.

Poured from an 11.2 ounce bottle into an imperial pint glass, bottle number 2012 26192.

A: Very murky septic tank water looking brown with a thick and dense off-white head.

S: Very strong blend of ripe banana, spices and mild alcohol, esters present but mild. 

T: Bready upfront with a strong banana, alcohol, esters and cloves finish. Boy the finish is intense leaving spice flavors on my tongue.

M: Thick with mild carbonation.

O: The flavors are too concentrated if you ask me, the banana is prominent which is fine, but the alcohol, and cloves are too prominent and the esters hit hard. I prefer the original.

Bottle. Pours deep hazy purplish brown with a big, creamy off-white head. The nose is cocoa powder, big malty caramel, strawberry, spices and light booze. The taste is lightly spicy christmas cake, some light banana and sugar. The beer certainly identifies its wheat hallmarks. Rich caramel and chocolate base. Light sweet cherries on the long, slightly hot and tangy finish. Full bodied, playful carbonation. Overall, very nice, refreshing.

Bottle, bottled 5.10.2011, BBE 05.10.2016. Pours dark, cola brown, almost black with a medium, almost white head. Aroma is banana, clove, lots of dark fruit, slight alcohol, vanilla, liquorice. Taste is fairly sweet with banana, dark fruit strongly again as well as vanilla, slight alcohol and wooden tones. Turns a bit boozy on the finish. Wheaty sour and clovey spicy aftertaste. Palate is pretty full, somewhat carbonated.
Stort smutsvitt skum, brunröd kropp. Doftar banan, russin och blomträdgård. I smaken går alkoholen igenom, vilket sänker betyget för min del. Smakar banan, röda bär, honung och karamell.

Great, but I like the regular Aventinus better. The nose is banana and clove a long with a lot of dark fruit in the raisin region and a youch of bready aromas. The  beer is deep brown with a thick syrupy head of a slightly fizzy structure. The beer tastes like bananas, cloves, and dark fruit with other subtle malt characteristics in the back. The beer is thick and full bodied with an almost overwhelming alcohol presence, but with a smooth slightly oily finish.
Soooo good. Awesome. Raisins, molasses, bread, sharp, direct, condensed flavors. Great beer.
Aroma of sugar plum, wheat, and bananas foster.  Pours dusty brown with a foamy white film.  Taste is tangy with caramel banana, plums, and slight cinnamon.  Delicious and sweet.

Fantastic nose, with depth and complexity.  Pours a muddy brown colour and the flavours are gorgeously rich and full bodied.  Has a little sweetness up front, but balanced nicely.  A dangerous 12% beer as it hides the alcohol very well.  A few sips and rosy cheeked!

Pours a very cloudy and very dark brown colour with a tall frothy off-white head. Aroma is sweet wheat with dark fruit, banana, caramel. Taste is also sweet with wheat, caramel, banana and other dark fruits leading to a sweet fruity finish. Only a slight alcohol burn on the way down. Damn nice stuff.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2012 Bottle. Pours slightly cloudy brown with a small creamy light tan head laces well. Aroma of sweet wheat with some alcohol notes as well. Sweet to the taste, with wheat, raisin, molasses, alcohol and unidentified fruitiness. Mouthfeel is rich and creamy. Very nice beer.

Brown 33cl bottle dated 2008, number 19309. Best before 30th July 2013, drank July 2009.

Poured into a half litre Franziskaner Weissbier glass because I know this can be a lively bugger sometimes!

Lively it was, but the glass contained it.

Cloudy, murky and foreboding looking body, a sort of grubby brown, teak wood red colour. A good firm tan head sat on top, looked interesting more than inviting.

Alcohol and a fizzy pop (Vimto) smell to it, some malts in the mix too. A sweet vanilla and banana aroma also came along as the beer warmed up.

Christmas pudding of a beer, plums, rich fruitcake, a faint hint of cigars and smoking jackets. The sort of beer to have by a roaring fire on a winters evening while the wife prepares a supper of home made soup with crusty brown bread.

Very pleasant winters beer, brought back from a Berlin beer trip, glad I found it.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2014 Deep dark colour with small head. Aroma is malt, wheat, dark fruits. Flavour is is dark fruits, bit boozy, nicely sweet. Have to retest later, have one older bottle.
8.9.14 best before 12/15. Pretty tasty stuff.

Pretty good. Didn't taste super fresh. tasted malty to me

Bottle from wine expo

22

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Creamy and smooth with a lot caramel and raisins. Id say its like a mix between a porter, a quadruple and a doppelbock. Smells amazing - very sweet. Jonathan loves it, its thick and syrupy for me, but it is really really good. One of our top favorite beers.

Pours with a huge fizzy head that subsides fairly quickly to no head at all. Nose is sweet and raisiny. Color is a hazy brown. Taste is heavy and sweet, almost cloying, but not quite. Body is lighter than I thought it would be, but the texture is sticky. It finishes sweet and stays in the mouth for a long time, with an after taste of alcohol. It almost reminds me of a dessert wine or maybe a port (?) Im a hop head, so this is way out of my comfort zone, but still very enjoyable for the right occasion.
Lots of brown sugar on the nose, also detect a little apricot. Very rich but invites you back for more. Great texture and level of carbonation. Will definitely have this one again!

330ml bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a very dark and hazy brown with a thin ring of carbonation that holds around the edge of the glass.

Aroma is full of molasses and brown sugar along with figs and prunes. Not really any alcohol detectable but plenty of malt.

The flavor explodes with dark fruit and molasses. Raisins and figs are most prominent. These transition into wood and pipe tobacco finishing out with a touch of coffee. Alcohol is present as can be expected with a beer of this strength, but is never overpowering. Mouthfeel is full and quite thick, almost syrupy.

Overall this is really great beer. The flavors are especially concentrated compared to the standard Aventinus and it is really quite drinkable.

Bottle from Beers of Europe
Dark ruby brown, hazy, big frothy off white head that dissipates.
Aroma is complex - soft banana and cloves, vinous, dark fruits, alcohol soaked raisins, some bubblegum, light spices, some acetone solvent, complex yeast esters, alcohol noticeable, slight sour notes
Taste again is complex - wheat, rich dark fruits, raisins, soft cloves, some spices, fair amount of alcohol heat, some varnish. complex fruity dark malts, yeast esters, can get a bit too varnishy after a while but still a great flavour
Palate - soft carb, full body, very smooth. Finish as main flavour, smooth spicy dark malts with warming alcohol.
Overall - Unique beer, the freezing brings out some strange complex flavours - its a really good beer, but the varnish note can get a little strong for me. I would definitely have this again though but I prefer the standard Aventinus.
water , wheat malt , barley malt , hops and yeast ,  Aventinus, the Wheat Doppelbock of Bavaria, has always been known to be the most intense and complex wheat beer in the world.

The living beer. As I open it almost slip from the bottle. The big head comes up firstly. The yeast is still working. A dark murky colour with piece of yeast swimming across my eyes. Aroma of red fruits, rawsberry and friends. The first taste is very alcoholic, but later it turns to a sweet, roast malty. And at the end I can feel it refreshing despite its 12% alcohol contain. I hope it is as sweet as my dream will be...

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2013 Bottle. Pours deep, dark brown with average, creamy off-white head; short retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is caramel and cookie malt, molasses, figs, floral hops, and light spice. Flavor is malt dominate with faint hops and some dark fruit esters; booze undertones throughout with a sweet finish. Medium/full body, light/medium carbonation, and high warmth.

Pours a woody, ruby haze with a short-lived fizzy cap of a tan head.  The nose is quite sweet - cherries, candied sugar, malted wheat, bit of booze - rather pleasant.  The taste carries a lot of the same qualities and the alcohol is well masked/incorporated.  Not all that drinkable but about as easy-drinking as you could hope for at this ABV.

Pours a deep brown color with a thick head that remains for a while.  Great wheaty scent along with a very strong banana aroma.  Strong banana flavor hits first, then you can taste the wheat and even some dark fruits.  A slight alcohol burn to finish with a little tartness too.  Very interesting and complex beer that I sipped for an hour.  Love it.  Will definitely buy more.

Bottle, poured a brownish color with full frothy head. Big aroma with raisin, candy, dark fruit, licorice, malt.   Med-light sweetness,  Medium body.  Creamy texture.  Ave carbonation.  Very complex.  Nicely drinkable at such a high alcohol.
This is very sweet, and has a dark cloudy color. Its got a little head, but goes down very easy.

Bottle thanks to mar..pour is a dark plum with creamy tan head, Nose is grape, malts, hard candy, bready, blackberry..Taste is fruity, grape, bready,spice,plum, sweetness..Plate is medium and silky..Nice lingering of dark fruits..Slap in the face of amazingness

33 cl bottle @ Cardinal, Stavanger. Murky brown in color with a nice short head. Aromas of ripe bananas, caramel, sweet malts. The freeze-distillation works really well in this beer, concentrating the beer to a much thicker beverage. Strong flavors of caramel, spices and sweet malts. Nice bitterness. A really good punch with alco warmth. A great beer for those cold dark nights.

bottle   pours dark brown with ruby red highlights where the light catches  .thin  beige / tan head soon dissipates .aroma is banana , cloves , esters and some dark dried fruits . full body with medium carbonation and slick mouthfeel . sweet taste embodying the aroma notes and the alcohol combining at the finish with a juicy ending.  the alcohol warmth lingers in the throat long after the liquid has slipped down .The style wont suit everyone but this is a must try beer . Excellent example of its type

Pours a dark brown with a thin light tan head. Strong banana and clove aroma. Quite spicy, with caramel and dark dried fruits. Strong, more bock like than the very weizen-ish regular Aventinus. Sweet caramel flavor, fruity, and packs a spicy punch, finishing on a strong clove note. It sounds stupid to say it, but this really does taste like a stronger version of Aventinus. Barely an alcohol burn. Wonderful body. A great first eisbock experience.

Bottle to pilsner glass at Loreley in NYC. Looks good;brown with good head. Smells good too. Plum and fig; similar to a quad. Tastes great; like it smells with a hint of cloves and bananas. Mouthfeel is good - especially for the abv. Overall, a great beer for its type, and one that Id definitely drink again.

Aroma: kind of smells like an anti septic
Appearance: very dark with a reddish brown hue
Taste: taste is like having a spoonful of vanilla extract. My first thought was banana pudding
Palate: light fizz, flavor lingers

I loved the flavor, the aroma wasn't fantastic but I still greatly enjoyed it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2012 - 03 - 14 330ml bottle. brown colour. medium creme head. warm, dark, chocolat aroma. light bitter sweet taste. alcohol not to much noticable...

great colour.  a really deep ruby brown with a long lasting ring of slightly red/purple head.
strong aromas of dried red fruits, raisin, cherry, and a whiff of alcohol at the end. deep complex taste with all the above and much more: cloves,banana, strawberry and on.
the alcohol doesnt interfere with the mouth flavour but dominated the finish.

Pours an odd hazy reddish brown color with a thin white head that doesnt last long.  The aroma is tart, bananas, cloves, and vinegar.  The taste is sweet bananas, spicy cloves, dark fruit, raisins, bread, and a slightly tart green banana finish.  This brew is quite pleasant, complex, and surprisingly refreshing given the 12% abv.  I cant imagine that there are too many weizen bocks out there that are better than this.  Definitely try this one.

aroam, very flora ripe banana, roasted malt  cloves
color, dark amber, hazy, small head. some lacing
taste,very rich, banana on the front, very strong like banana bread with brown sugar, cloves emerge, very stron malt background.
overall, my words really cant fully describe the intense flavors in this beer, just awesome, its pricy 5 dollars a 11.2 ozer, but woth it!
user_location: @RED BHUT JOIKIAS!, Paulsboro, New Jersey, USA

text: Bottle. Amber brown with a fizzy head that quickly fades to nothing with lots of visible bubbles and some floaties. Aroma of toffee, bread dough, spice and alcohol. Flavor is dark caramel, wheat bread, light hop bitterness and mild alcohol presence. Medium to full body with active carbonation that leads to a prickly mouth feel. Good beer, lots of sweetness makes this more of a dessert beer than an every day drinker.

Bottle.  Pours with a decent size head that dissipates quickly.  I could smell the beer from 2 feet away as I was awaiting the head to go down.  Smells of licorice.  Has a dark brown color with a lot of life to it.  It will leave the taste of butterscotch on the palate.  For a bock it is not bad.
Pours  a hazy brown with a lively but short-lived tan head.  Smells of alcohol, nuts, cheese.  Tastes sweet  - notes of raisins, plums, a dash of bitterness, hints of clove.

A big beer stowed away for several months. Medium brown color, not much head retention. Astonishing storm of CO2 and unfiltered sediments. Aroma of heavy fruit and rum cake. Syrupy sweet, hints of banana spice and rot. Thick body, though not overwhelming. Alcohol is mellow but not subtle. Not differentiated from standard Aventinus, and can be summed up as having more booze and less wheat.
Fresh Secret Santa bottle. I think this is only my 3rd Eisbock so Im no expert here. Pretty tasty overall. You know the 12ABV is there but it doesnt dominate. Good but not my fave style.
Dark brown colour. Banana aroma. Tastes like banana chocolate cake. Delicious.

Bottle: 2011 no. 070359
Small to medium light tan creme head that disappears quick and leaves a headless murky brown beer in the glass.
Smell barleys, sticky toasted barlesy, some malts, caramel, toffee, stingy hay, bit boozy like dropshot and whiskey.
Taste barleys, sticky barleys, sticky malts, toffee, darker fruit, prunes, figs, (autumnal) herbs and spices, hint of alcohol, some hay, medium bitter, a light sticky (warm) sweetness, a light nasty bitterness (but overpowered by the other ingredients) something like elder hops and a slight hint of something light light sour.
Herby warm light bitter malty afgertaste.
Low to medium carbo, soft/light spicy/exploding mouthfeel, full body and a creamy (almost oily) and sticky texture.
Amazing brew!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Botella de 330ml.Copa Globo.Saboreada en jun´11.Color caoba oscuro.Levaduras en suspensión. Capa beige,fugaz, de burbuja pequeña. Presencia de plátano tanto en aroma como sabor. Sabores de esteres,especias,pan y un simpático toque de mermelada de ciruela. Lúpulos cubiertos por sabores malteados. Cuerpo medio-intenso y carbonatación moderada. Sutil y cálido alcohol.Final de dulce afrutado.Frutas del bosque y uvas en el retrogusto. Cerveza bien equilibrada. Asimilación buena y refrescante. 330ml bottle.Snifter glass.Enjoyed on jun´11.Dark mahogany in color.Yeast in suspension.Brief small bubbled beige head. Banana is present both in flavor & aroma.Estery,spicy,bready & a quite funny plum mermelade flavors.Hops well hidden by malts. Medium-full body, moderate carbonation.Subtle warming alcohol.Sweet fruity finish. Berries & grapes on the aftertaste.Well balanced beer.Good & refreshing drinkability.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2012 I really think this should still be under the Eisbock category. It certainly has more Eisbock attributes than Weizen Bock characteristics. 11.2 oz bottle. 2009 vintage, bottle #15036. Pours a murky brown with a medium beige head that collapses after a couple of minutes, leaving a ring. Aroma is dark fruits, funk, a little banana. Taste is mostly sweet, but has tart edges and finishes bitter. Taste is a complex flavor explosion of pure beery awesomeness. Regular Aventinus is one of my all-time favorites, but I thought this was going to be cloying (like Kulmbacher finishes). Its not so far (*crosses zehen*). Body is full, mouthfeel is oily, carbonation is average. Unless this gets cloying after it warms up, this is another Schneider masterpiece (but not quite as good as regular Aventinus).

A dark and fizzy pour with a quickly dissipating head.  The aroma is woody, earthy, with a slight fruit note.  Plum perhaps.  The taste is very complex.  Warm, alcohol, maybe grape, plum again, a fresh undertone, a little lemony. After swallowing the alcohol is still there but fades into a hint of bubble gum.  Not a daily drink, but very interesting..in a good way.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Pours brown with a long lasting, off-white, foamy head.  Aroma is of barnyard yeast, wheat malt, brown sugar and alcohol.  The body is full, smooth and creamy.  Taste is of dark fruit, wheat malt, yeast and brown sugar.  Long, warming finish.  The bottle was old, but the brew was still great.
Not a daily beer, shoud be left for special moments. Take the regular weizen,  aromas and add, caramel, chocolate, coffee, toast, vanilla, woody. So you can imagine...

Aroma: Roasted malt, slight bitterness, slight plum/prune. No hops, no diacetyl, clean.

Appearance: Deep copper/amber, ruby highlights. Fizzy off white head.

Flavor: Roasted malt forward, slight peppery hop undertones. Warmth from the alcohol present both up front and on the finish. Remnants of bubble gum.

Mouthfeel: Medium body, soft carbonation, medium-high warmth.

Overall: Seems out of balance, more towards the malt and alcohol, not enough support from the hops.
I drank this beer a while ago. Ill update this ratin if I have the chance to drink it again.
On cask at Coffee District. This was pretty delicious to say the least. Nice apple brandy thing happening in the aroma. Flavor was a little under carbonated but still made for a good drink.

330 ml bottle bought @ Etre Gourmet. Pours dark reddish brown with a rather small fizzy off-white head that slowly dissipates while leaving almost no trace on the glass. Smell is very sweet and slightly tart with sweet fruits like banana, prunes, figs and dates, herbs like cilantro and lemon balm combined with wheat, lemon zest and hints of metal and alcohol. Taste is very sweet, slightly sour, slightly bitter and slightly metallic with banana, figs, dates, lemon zest, lemon balm and alcohol. Mouthfeel is full-bodied and intense. Finish is sweet and slightly tart with sweet fruits, orange peal and spices.

Un buen aroma a chocolate,y sobre todo plátano,banana o como le querais llamar;se percibe tambien bastante el alcohol a medida que la cerveza se atempera,para mi gusto es excesivo.
Es una cerveza que luce muy muy bien,opaca que va desde los tonos marrones a un casi negro,con una espuma que se asemeja muchisimo a las trapenses.El sabor es muy extraño,es muy bueno pero muy extraño.Con esto quiero decir que es una cerveza compleja,cada vez que le das un sorbo encuentras algo diferente con lo que deleitarte.Es como un zumo,muy muy dulce con un sabor al final amargo caracteristico .Sobre el sabor que deja al paladar,es tambien progresivo,porque va cambiando a medida que la bebes.En mi caso,empezó con un picor considerable en la garganta y el paladar ( posiblemente por el alcohol ) y acabó con una textura dulce muy buena.Tiene una cantidad de gas media,lo justo para que se note.
En definitiva es una buena cerveza,practicamente de sesion que a mi parecer se asemeja mucho a cualquiera cerveza trapista,pero sin llegar a ella,con un fuerte aroma a platano y un deje a chocolate.Ojo con el acohol,en mi caso se hizo notar durante todo el proceso.
Short beige head. Very opaque appearance. Much banana aroma. Complex taste with caramell maltiness and fruit. A perfect dessert beer for creme brulle.
Bottle. Dark brown with a thick white head. Banana, clove and dark fruit aroma. More of the same in the very complex flavour. The alcohol is almost completely hidden. Delicious.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2012 (33cl Bottle) I think im gonna pass out , im wasted and 12 % kraut bocks at midnight is not my greatest achievement of 2012.  I see this is no longer listed as an Eisbock  ,it does not have the beautifull flavours of their normal Aventinus Weizen Bock in contrast . This beers intense  boozy body is slughish. Chocolaty and bananary , And i feel sick..

Appearance: extremely rich dark chestnut, glowing like a ruby against the light; short fizzy, creamy tan head and a gentle bead when poured into a snifter; decent legs.   Aroma: sweet malts, caramel, molasses, chocolate, raisins, port, and a hint of yeast.   Taste: boozy, with notes of chocolate-covered cherries, raisins, prunes, yeast, and a bit of maple syrup (maybe).   Finish: lingering notes of sweet dark chocolate and syrupy fruits, slowly fading.   Notes: A big, rich, delicious, complex sipping beer.  For all that, its eminently drinkable, and there isnt as much of a boozy afterburn as youd expect. In fact, the alcohol is considerably hidden in the palate, although the taste and aroma is present.  This adds, rather than detracts, certainly.  What a treat.

[ASPETTO] 			
color marrone scuro, opaca			
[SCHIUMA]			
color beige, media presenza, fine , media persistenza			
[ OLFATTO ]			
buona intensità, lievito, cereali, frutta secca, amaretto, alcohol			
[GUSTO]			
intenso, malto, frumento e lieviti in prima fila, che infondono un una certa dolcezza; ancora compaiono sapori che ricordano lamaretto e forse anche cioccolato, una leggera astringenza che introduce un fruttale (frutta matura) . Termina mantenendo note dolci, con evidenti note alcoliche. Retrogusto persistente, caldo che ricorda quasi un vino rosso corposo.			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio-alto, consistente in bocca; percezione alcolica evidente, sensazione di calore; buona carbonazione			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
birra potente, alcolica e complessa sia al naso che in bocca. Un carattere basicamente weizen ma con laggiunta di maltatura prepotente, toni fruttati che ricordano una strong ale belga, quasi natalizia ( a parte strane speziature). Da meditazione prolungata, si beve bene ma a piccoli sorsi e si arriva allultimo  soddisfatti ma provati: alcool forse un pelino eccessivo. Mancava solo un bel camino acceso.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2012 Pours murky dark brown cloudy with thick foamy off-white head. Aromas banana, vanilla, orange, caramel, alcohol, wood. Taste is hints of tart fruits, raisins, with thick oily  slight watery texture with smooth carbonation. Aftertaste is sweet malty flavors with warming alcohol. Finish is medium short with dryness. The beer is smooth and drinkable, being  12% ABV, alcohol is not overwhelming. Depends also on the temperature you drink this.

Pours a dark murky brown with a decent sized light brown head. Leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is strong dark fruit and banana peel with some wheat characteristics.  Taste is raisin, dates, banana, some wood, and a hint of alcohol in the finish. Alcohol is concealed for the most part.  Silky on the palate and warms on the way down.  Pretty good overall.

330ml bottle.

Look: Muddy dark brown with a hint of red and a small tanned/mocca head that leaves minor lacings.

Aroma: Lots of sweet dried fruits (plums, raisins, oranges, bananas) and caramelly wheaty malts. Rum soaked raisins and plums with ripe banana,  marzipan and sweet caramel with a minty note and a hint of chocolate. The sugars prickles the nose.

Taste: Very sweet with dark dried fruits, chocolate, caramel, wheat and yeast. The bananas are there but low key thank god. Its spicy and a bit peppery.

Mouthfeel; is big body with soft pointy carbonation and a bit syrupy texture.

This is great!

Got a bottle from the great power of beer and wine, sevilla, spain. Dark brown color. Thin to medium brownish head. Medium carbonation. Low to medium sweetness. Low sourness and bitterness. Grape fruit, chocolate, roasty and alcohol aroma. Dont get me wrong, it has too much alcohol aroma for me.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Brown pour with a quickly diminishing white head. Quite a vinous nose. Dark fruit and chocolate aroma. Sweet flavours of dates, raisins and a little toffee. Rich and warming with a lasting sweetness. Nice.

Bottle at home.
Clear dark brown witt a large light brown head, quickly disappearing. Aroma heavy malty (roasted, brown sugar, dark fruits, vineous). Flavor heavy sweet, light bitter, in a good balance. Almost full body. Very impressing, especially to pancakes with vanilla icecream.

Deep, dark, brown with a small ring of a beige head. Aroma of raisins, caramel, wood, port, spice, and alcohol. The taste is rich, sweet fruit and malt with relatively (for a 12%er) well hidden alcohol. Full bodied and boozy feeling with a short finish and low carbonation. Heavy stuff.

Pour from bottle; some carbonation; dark brown with quickly fading white head.  Some port/wine/fruit flavor, but just a nice hint. Also hint of sweetness and syrup; again, not too much. The high ABV is evident on the palate, but does not interfere with the taste.

Bottle. Really dark brown colour with a white head that settles into a ring quite quickly. Aroma of wine, port and grapes. Alcohol and spices like nutmeg are present. Flavour is syrupy, alcoholic sweetness all over this one. Tasted really like port, sweet, sugary port. Still quite good.

Quite fruity aroma, lots of banana, apricot, clove, brown sugar, vanilla.. sweet, rich, flavor less complex than nose, finishes much too quickly, a bit one-note.. this whoosh of banana-tinged sugary malt, then done.. ok, but disappointing.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2012 Location/Date:Bottle on January 19th, 2011.
Appearance: Pours a black with hints of brown, with some light white head. 
Aroma: Malty, sweet(dark cherry?l).  Boozy.  
Taste: Faint bitterness, heavy malt, some kind of dark fruit. Interesting.
Palate:Medium light body, some carbonation and fizz, lingering aftertaste.
Summary: After a long day of work(its 10pm), I figured I need a beer and pulled this German one. Little did I know it is 12%(never knew german beers went this high in alcohol), a style Ive never had (Eisbock)..or the top rated of that style.  Interesting german style to try, cant imagine this style being better than this, although Im glad this is my only beer tonight(a work night).

33cl bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee.  Pours a deep, brown color with a white head.  Aroma is banana, clove, maybe a little boozy.  Medium on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, wheat, clove, raisin, booze, with a sweet, boozy finish.  Definitely a warmer.  The booze is noticeable but not bad.  Pretty smooth for 12% ABV.
It poured a cloudy dark amber color with an off-white head.  The aroma was of malt, wheat and some banana. The taste was medium to heavy sweet and somewhat bitter.

From notes: Philly Beer Week guest tap @ Brauhaus Schmitz.  Poured cloudy nut-brown with an ivory-colored head.  Aroma is caramelly sweet, mixed with dark cherry.  Deep, a bit on the thick, viscous side.  Malty sweet taste up front, giving way to notes of cherry and nuts in the finish.  Would love to try one thats been aged a couple of years.

33 cl. bottle poured in to a snifter. Big, off-white head with a pink tint. Hazy, dark brown colour with dark red hues. Very powerful aroma, like a turbocharged hefeweizen!  Lots of sweet malts, sweet, dark dried fruits, banana, resin hops, wheat, cloves, and a distinct alcohol. Medium to heavy sweet taste with lots of alcohol, marzipan, wheat and rich, sweet fruits. Full bodied with a thick and sticky texture. Soft carbonated with a long lasting, sweet finish with lots of alcohol. An excellent beer in every way but perhaps with too much of everything.

Bottle. Rating #1447. Hazy, murky dark brown pour wirh a beige head. Sweet and boozy aroma, lots of rich dark fruits with a light banana aroma as well. More banana in the flavor with a little alcohol burn in the finish. Nice stuff. (2108)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle.  Wow. Smell is some port wine, alcohol and ripe fruit.  The taste initially shows some rum or port soaked plums, alcohol, a nice complexity of some known wheat but just much bigger.  Almost some raspberries, chocolate and leather as well.  This certainly a treat, and more in the fact that I have never had this style and might as well start out with the best.  Prost!

Kleine Bierstybe, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 281211.
Brown with small head. Aroma of wheat and alcohol. Flavor with banana, caramel and yeast.

Had this from a keg of the 2007 that was on tap for growler fills at Half Time, with a big thanks to Matt for having the patience to sit on the keg for 4 years.  Pours a just clear amber with a medium sized white to beige head.  Soft banana and caramel, toffee on the nose.  Medium bodied, sweet and malty.  Malt and oxidization, light phenolics on the finish.  Light and creamy.

versa un marrone molto scuro con una schiuma crema non molto persistente, al naso subito la banana, con un mix di uva molto accentuato, anche note alcooliche, nel complesso unaroma molto piacevole
in bocca è dolce, per me che non amo le birre sbilanciate verso i malti è una delusione che mi aspettavo, quello che non mi aspettavo è sicuramente la complessità generale dei sapori, fichi, uvetta, castagna, prugne, ancora banana, un mix avvolgente, lungo, incredibilmente piacevole. Ancora non mi spiego come possa, una birra così complessa e pesante, sia di struttura che di alcool, essere così bevibile.

[Bottle from Utobeer, Borough Market, London] Ruby-brown with a large but diminishing beige head. Looks very fizzy on the pour, but theres little sign of this in the smooth, viscous mouthfeel. It clearly shows its strength - its warming in the mouth, with notes of rum and port.  Chocolate and a light roastiness comes through too in a drink that is sweet throughout but never excessively so - a great evening sipper, that is possibly not quite as well balanced as the weaker yet even better standard Aventinus.

Dark brown beer, off-white head. Big malt aroma, wheat, roasted tones, dark fruits, banana, raisins, slight port wine. Flavour rather sweet, malt, raisins and plums. Finish quite long, notes of Weizen with some pronounced alcohol at the end. The sweetness of the beer complements it nicely, without becoming too cloying. Very nice.
(From 33cL bottle @ home)
Dark, not much head.  Lots of plum and other dark fruits involved in the taste with the finish mostly being more of the same.  Ive had a few of this style and it has yet to grow on me.

Bottle.  Pours a thick, hazy brown-black with a medium head that lingers around.  The aroma is of strong malt.  The flavor is heavy on the alcohol with sweet malt flavors, some spice and a mild sour aftertaste.  Lots of body.  Great Winter beer.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2012 Bottle from Stirchley Wines, Birmingham. Beautiful raisin-ny arome. Sweet, smooth, warming. Wheaty backdrop, mulled fruit foreground. Big on dried fruit and berry. Medium length, warming finish. Very nice.

Smells of sweet fruits and cereal . Full creamy head. Thick palate that starts sweet and quickly turns tart and sour finishing with a medium bitterness to it. Moderately carbonated from the bottle. Tasty first eisbock. Must try it again.

This beer pours  a dark color and love the fact that it is unfiltered.  Aroma is of sweet, boozy, fruits, slightly sour cherry being prevalent. Taste is very similar to the aroma, slightly sour yet sweet fruits with slight malts.  Very good beer
dark brown color. not beautiful to see. something banana. strong taste of alcohol. maybe this bottle has problem ? the arome is not interested. its tlake an old liqueur. bizarre aroma of amaretto.

Yeah, this was my second "special" beer which i tasted, so i was very nervous to taste this, because it has so much alcohol(12%) and i think, that its gonna be very strong beer. But happy to see, aroma was very pleasant(actually i like it very much) little bit banana, caramel, some herbs maybe. Taste was actually pretty good for me, sweet and after taste little bit bitter.
